Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Grea Stay”
Reviews.Author: srasotasunshine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the intercontinental 08/24/12-08/27/12. The rooms were clean and the staff were very nice. We did not eat at the hotel (why would you with so many great places in the city??). The location was great for walking. It is a bit off the main area but is only a 10 min walk at most. I don't have any negatives to mention about this stay (and if you read my reviews I usually find something! I find it helps to now the downfalls).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice weekend”
Reviews.Author: cdsh
Reviews.Content: We live close to New Orleans and have stayed in many of the hotels for a weekend get away. This is one of our favorites because the rooms are very nice and the bed is always comfortable. It is located on a great street (St. Charles) with good proximity to the French Quarter. The only draw back is the parking fee of over $30.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: talihinagal
Reviews.Content: After a 12 hour drive the InterContinental was a pleasant experience. The only draw back was the parking fee, well over $30. The staff was very efficient. The room was very nice and the bed very comfortable! It is located just close enough to the french quarter. I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Mueller1500
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, and well kept. It is close walking distance to everything! We enjoyed our stay here. THey do have a gym and a pool but we did not use it. Would stay here again if we could. Also really close to Burbon street..a 5 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for dome and quater”
Reviews.Author: BIG_SOS
Reviews.Content: Stayed for saints game. You are right in between the Superdome the French quarter and the river. The rooms were redone since last time I been there. They were very clean and furnished with nice furnishings. Parking was $32. Parking has gone up all up and down the Poydras Street coridor with most lots charging $25 for self parking Service was very nice at both the front desk and the valet stand. What stay again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: chad1209
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune of staying at the Intercontinental for two nights. The reception staff was friendly, the room was beautiful and quite large, and it was very conveniently located downtown--close enough to the French Quarter (something like a 5-block walk) but far enough away that you're not kept awake from drunk people. The beds were comfortable and the view from my room was awesome. I used the pool one afternoon as well, and it was clean despite being an outdoor pool (it rained all day). I did not get a chance to explore the hotel restaurants and bars just because I was in NOLA for such a short time and preferred to see some local spots--but the menu looked good, if a little on the expensive side but that's to be expected from a luxury hotel. I stayed away from the hotel parking, since it seemed to be upwards of $30 a night. I was on a roadtrip to Alabama and Mississippi, so I just waited to rent a car til after I checked out of the hotel (you don't need a car to get around NOLA if you are just doing touristy stuff downtown). Fortunately, the rental place was closeby--a short 5-block walk. The only downside was that I realized a few hours after I checked out that I left my iPhone charger in the bathroom wall outlet. I called reception right away and asked if they could hold it for me for a few days until I came back from my trip. They said housekeeping didn't find it... a little sketchy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate”
Reviews.Author: CMSCLS
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, comfortable beds, pleasant club room service!nice gym. The location is nice as it I close to The French Qtr but not too close so as to be loud. The noise IN th hotel (on Club floor) was a bit loud but that is not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: yzfrr1
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was by far the best thing about this hotel. Everyone was nice and friendly. The hotel is located in a good area. It is about 5 minutes from Bourbon street and Canal Street. It was clean and was well decorated. We chose to get a balcony because I love to hang out on the balcony and enjoy views. However, the balcony on all of the rooms faced an office building with no views except people working and eating on one of the floors across the street. On top of that, the rooms adjacent to us had easy access to our balcony if they wanted to climb the small divider. With the window shades open there was no privacy in the room (including the full time view of the people in the next building that was always occupied during the day) and offered an insecure feel unless you kept the balcony door shut and locked at all times. So if you fear some crazy jumping onto your balcony and possibly into your room, skip the balcony. It was about $50-$70 more anyway. (One note on the balcony: I am not a first timer in a city like this. I just expect a little more out of my balcony. On the other hand, it did not look like any other hotels had better balconies. So it might just be my perspective). The room itself was a bit noisy. I could hear people above us and next to us. Nothing loud, but the noise was definitely present.

Reviews.Title: “Major Disappointment in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: WXinDC
Reviews.Content: First the positives...staff was exceptionally friendly and positive, from the Club Room (breakfast and happy hours for people staying on the Club Floor) to the bell staff to the housekeeping staff. Great people. Management, not so much. So the toilet in our room (1435) kept running, we could live with that. The AC never got the humidity down, although in the next room (1436, a family member) the humidity was just fine. The killer? The Shriners were having a convention and their hospitality suite was directly across the hall from us! The are an incredibly self-absorbed and insensitive group of middle-aged frat boy partiers well into the wee hours (around 1:30AM) who were shouting and laughing and slamming the door every time someone came or left to their party room. AND THE HOTEL MANAGEMENT KNEW THIS WAS THEIR HOSPITALITY SUITE BUT PUT US THERE ANYWAY! In fact, we were upgraded because we are Platinum Priority Club members. Despite many complaints from us, and other guests, the hotel security did not make the partiers leave, and the desk staff kept telling us that they were sorry and management would do something to make it up to us. They did not. When I checked out and paid my $1300 bill for two rooms and dining, there was no mention of apology, no mention of making it up in some other way, there was no response from management. Two nights out of the three we were there we were kept awake until after 1:30, as was our daughter and grand daughter in the next room. Total management failure. Intercontinentals in Boston and Baltimore have been fabulous, but this aging hotel suffers from management in absentia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Racoon12345
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans and we stayed at the IC for 3 nights in a Club Suite. The Suite was huge and beautifully appointed, with a separate seating/office area and 2 large flat screen TVs. The furninshings and decor were beautiful and the bed was huge. The bathroom was disproportionately small ( as was the tub) but had all necessary amenities. The view was not inspiring - a car park and other buildings. Given the situation of the hotel, I doubt that any rooms have an especially good view. Being on the Club floor, we had access to the Club Lounge for breakfast and evening cocktails and canapes. The Lounge has an excellent food and drink selection in the evening, most of which is self service. Wine and beers are served by the staff (of one rather surly lady, who was like a strict school mistress) on request. Refills are not forthcoming - you have to ask. Beware weekday breakfast finishes at 9am, which I consider to be on the early side. We arrived at just after 9 on our first morning to be advised by the surly lady that breakfast had finished. Not even a cup of tea or banana to take away was offered. (When we checked in, we were told the opening times but I did not take enough notice. I just expected that it would be standard breakfast times) On the 2 mornings we arrived on time for breakfast, the selection and quality was good. I have been to many IC Club Lounges in the past and the service is usually polite, friendly and helpful. While the surly lady was not rude, she was certainly not welcoming. All the other staff we encountered were exceptionally helpful and friendly, especially the Bellboy team. The IC is in a great location, just a short walk from the French Quarter, Bourbon Street, Canal Street and the Mississippi. There is a St Charles line Street Car stop just yards down the road if you turn left out of the main doors. This will take you to the Garden District and the museums, including the WW2 museum, which is well worth a visit. You can buy an all day ticket on the Streetcar and at $5, this is very good value. My partner and I enjoyed our time in New Orleans enormously and would certainly recommend the Intercontinental as a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Sleep Well”
Reviews.Author: ricelakewisconsin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the 2012 ELCA National Youth Gathering. It was hectic but the staff was all very nice and welcoming. The beds were very nice and comfortable and did not have a hard time sleeping at all. We were about equal distance from the Super Dome and the Convention Center so that was nice. Also not to far from the French Quarter. No continental breakfast though. Would recommend this hotel to many.

Reviews.Title: “I will try and post a picture of the shower head I think that will tell the story”
Reviews.Author: Lvinstyle
Reviews.Content: Not worthy of the Intercontinental name definitely needs an upgrade. Needs remodeling. Everything is rather dingy and needs a refresh. Service was average and not overly pleasant the way most new Orleans are

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in The Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: Ami5466
Reviews.Content: Nice room. Lobby is very nice. Had drinks at the lobby bar while wating for our room to be ready, and Astrid was very nice and gave us great suggestions for dinner. Although the hallways were a tad shabby, the room itself was very nice and comfortable. My husband and I were very pleased with the room and hotell location. Parking is pricey, so be prepared or look for alternate parking option. Overall, we were very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Midwesterner007
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of times this summer and enjoyed it both times. The hotel is in a terrific location--close to the French Quarter, casino, streetcars, shopping and restaurants. The hotel itself is beautiful and our rooms were clean and nicely decorated. We ordered room service and found it to be fast and the food was pretty good. Yes, room service is a little expensive, but, with some dishes the portions were large enough for two. Breakfast was especially good--the pancakes were almost pastry-like in taste. The only downsides--the beds were a little saggy on our second stay. The rooms could be a little more soundproofed. And some of the napkins were a little worn. However, by and large, an excellent place to stay with friendly staff. We got an excellent rate through Hotwire and it was certainly well worth the price. We'd stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “First Class, All the Way, Baby!”
Reviews.Author: happymallqueen
Reviews.Content: I recently took a trip to New Orleans where my last three nights' reservation was lost. At the last minute, I secured a room at the Intercontinental and I'm so glad I did. Great location; wonderful front desk staff, clean room, up to date everything...even got to enjoy the glorious pool for a day. Can't think of one bad thing to say!

Reviews.Title: “Much improved (B+ to A+)”
Reviews.Author: mdzebar
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel in the past that offered excellent service for competitive rates. In the past 5 years they have upgraded all of their TVs along with a nicer pool and more extensive exercise room. I will definitely stay there anytime I have to be in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Close Enough to Everything”
Reviews.Author: lonestarst8
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel, with lots of amenities and great service. It is in the business district- which is actually quite close to the French Quarter, the Riverwalk, Harrahs & the Garden District. We booked 3 rooms with King sized beds, but the hotel ended up giving our party 1 room with double beds (incidentally the double beds were really lop sided), but the family in that room seemed ok with it. 1 room had a decent sized balcony. All 3 rooms were really clean & spacious. The hotel has a nice restaurant (breakfast, lunch and dinner), a sweet shop, a swanky lounge bar, an on site pub, and gift shop. The bellmen were all very nice & helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to usual intercontinental standards”
Reviews.Author: sammywardill
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some great Intercontinental hotels around the world so I was happy to book into the Intercontinental New Orleans on a recent business trip. I was disappointed. The hotel look and feel is tired. It is in need of refurbishment. Showers were poor. Carpets and dÃ©cor were old. The walls were thin and my room had an interconnecting door to my neighbours so I could hear their television all evening and all night. Standards of cleaning were not great. My quilt cover had a huge piece of wax on it when I arrived. I changed it for the quilt on the second bed and that was dirty too. Breakfast was frustratingly slow for a business traveller. They have that annoying system where they make you wait until the (one) server is ready to seat you at their convenience. On the last day of my stay, after waiting 5 minutes for a server to greet me at the door I was told that I would have to wait another 5 or 10 minutes for a table. I was furious (especially as I could see lots of empty tables that I could have used). I think that I was not alone in being annoyed. Eventually the food & beverage manager (Frank Gifford) came to speak to me to explain. Apparently they were "obligated to give excellent customer service" so, because they were short staffed, they had to close off half of the restaurant so they could serve the remainder well. It amazes me that he thought that it would be better customer service to keep people waiting to sit for 5 to 10 minutes rather than make them wait a few minutes longer for a coffee (and a bill).

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: jvjcr
Reviews.Content: Booked a room with a king bed with breakfast included. The room was very clean and classy. Loved all of the warm colors. It was very inviting. The ac was so quiet, I had to check to make sure that it was on. Never had an issue with any noises on the inside of hotel. The breakfast was part of our package. They sat us in the veranda and it was so nice!! We could order off of the menu or choose the buffet. I never had one problem with this hotel. Loved how it was on the other side of Canal away from the french quarter. Short walking distance to Bourbon. It was cheaper to park right next store for $25.00/24 hours. I would def stay here again. It was perfect in every way.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay. Hope u don't need your car”
Reviews.Author: MzLadybug
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights to goto a wedding. Got a $90/night rate through Hotwire. We had been in Houston the night before with impeccable service, so this really paled in comparison. The staff was polite, but they do not try to set themselves apart from the other hotels. Had an issue checking out. We called from the room for our car and were asked if we could be put on hold, and then they didn't wait for the answer just put us on hold. Ok. So why even ask? We gave them our ticket #. Went downstairs and checked out. We were told that the desk gave the valet guys the wrong ticket number. New orleans has GOT TO FIGURE OUT that people do not want to wait an hour to get their cars to go home on Sunday. The other cities in the south are going to leave new Orleans in the dust as they are more competitively priced ad the service is BLOWING THEM AWAY. We are two hours from new orleans but will prolly drive the extra hour to Houston for better hotel experiences and nicer people wherever where we go.

Reviews.Title: “Needs comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer R
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel August 6 to 10 2012 it's a nice hotel , nice staff but they need to upgrade their beds they sag and the board that they put inbetween mattress does not help. The pillows are hard too. They upgraded the locks they forgot about the beds. They should at least put 4 pillows in each beds firm for side sleeper and soft ones for back sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Convenient to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: smdaigle
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and had a great stay. Our room was in very good condition and nothing looked worn or dirty. We enjoyed having a balcony room even though it was 99% humidity during our stay and so being outside wasn't exactly comfortable! The bed was not the most comfortable I've slept on in the last year. I think they probably need to swap out the mattresses. It wasn't horrible but it wasn't quite up to the standards you'd expect in a high end hotel. I would have rated this hotel a 5 if the mattress was a bit better. That aside, the room was what we expected from a 4 star hotel (Right down to the Service bar with the outrageously priced snacks, drinks and liquor that no one in their right mind should touch!). Check-in and check-out was quick and painless and the staff were friendly and helpful. We ate one meal in the hotel dining room and it was quite good. We were the only ones in the dining room and it was like a private dining experience in a very upscale restaurant. This was a weekend night and we opted to stay at the hotel because we had a large party and some of us were too worn out to go back out and look for another place that could seat us all together without a long wait. We all enjoyed our meals and appreciated a few personal touches from our waiter including a list of off-menu options that he provided for the child at our table. The bar is open and has a couple of really helpful and interesting bartenders who took great care of us also made a couple of great Sazeracs! We also had access to the Club level hospitality room. The appetizers they put out during the evening are wonderful - I couldn't believe it when I saw a plate full of crab claws. The hostess was a lovely woman who was very attentive and kept our drinks full. We walked to and from the French Quarter several times at different times of the day. It's not a bad walk and we felt comfortable with it even late at night. Of course cab fare would have been minimal to/from the Quarter and we kept that in mind as an option just in case. We were very happy with our stay and will return to this location for future visits to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and friendly staff--terrible parking.”
Reviews.Author: TruMischief
Reviews.Content: Loved hotel, staff friendly, maid setvice was great five of us stayed 4 nights in from California and Texas. Â Hotel was close to French Quarter, but not too close. Â :-) Â Â  Ordered pot roast over grits from room service with all the fees ended up bring apx $32.00 and being the south the grits left a lot to be desired (how do you mess up grits?!--didnt enjoy meal) Â . The turkey club was excellent.Â  Â Parking was an atrocious additional $32.00 dollars a day!! Â (plus tips.. ) I would like to see the paino bar opened later into evening not once were we able to enjoy it and it seemed abandoned each time we passed thru. Also the fifth floor doors to seated patio closed and locked early -- maybe open late or not locked at all or for those of us that DONT want to go all the way to the FRONT OF THE HOTEL for lung killing (smoke) breaks. Â ---really??? All in all I will return for another stay.Â  Njoyd

Reviews.Title: “Beware! Worn and dirty!”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbelllewings
Reviews.Content: Our flight was canceled and so we had to book a one night hotel stay. We were very excited when we saw the entrance. It looked elegant and modern. That's about as much modern as we would get. The check in was quick and the attendant was chatty and pleasant. We were placed in room 725. When we exited the elevator which was dark and dreary, the first thing that hit us was the stale smell of old carpet. It smelled strongly of feet, but we brushed this aside and continued to our room. When we entered our hearts sank. There was debris on the floor from past guests, there were water stains on the bathroom counters, the furniture was worn and scraped in many areas. After finding an empty coca cola bottle behind the night stand, and hair on the pillows AND sheets, we were too disgusted to stay any longer. We called downstairs and requested a new room to which they quickly sent a worker to switch us out to. The front desk called it the deluxe room. I think they called it this simply because it had a balcony? In reality it was just as bad if not worse than the first room! There is peeling wallpaper by the air vent which you can see mold underneath, more debris on the worn out urine smelling carpet, and we just found almonds on the floor from another previous guest! I sit here in this very room writing this review because I couldn't wait to get home to do so. I was considering before having my guests stay here during my bachelorette party but after staying here I've changed my mind. There is no way that this is a 4 star hotel, I've seen lesser star rooms much cleaner, and there's no way that this hotel has housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Average Because of Valet Parking”
Reviews.Author: texas_empty_nester
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. Excellent location. Not too close to the French Quarter which was a plus. Other landmarks w/in walking distance. Good restaurant all around the area. Giving it an "average" because of my overall experience. Paid the $35.84 for valet parking. Didn't mind as long as the service was good service. Not the case. Waited 25 minutes for the car and when it arrived they had brought the wrong car. Was told the valet fee would be removed from my card. The stay was 8 days ago. Still waiting on the cost to be refunded to my card. : (

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: stromamo
Reviews.Content: I normally would give this type of hotel a 4 star rating (it was very nice but not luxurious). However, we had a problem with the bathtub draining and they showed up within 15 minutes of calling to fix the problem. Now that's great customer service! The rooms were nice and spacious and the bed was very comfortable. It is in a good location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, just outside french quarter”
Reviews.Author: gary m
Reviews.Content: First time visit to New Orleans, Hotel was in perfect location, about 10 mins walk from French Quarter. Room was spacious, and although near elevator, was quiet. Coffee shop on the lower level (Behind escalator) was ideal for breakfast. encoutered on happy drunk texan in the hotel, who when realising we were british, asked if all british people had bad teeth, I replied asking if it was true all Texan's couldn't take their drink!

Reviews.Title: “Typical full service hotel - good location.”
Reviews.Author: Twice_the_Money
Reviews.Content: I was able to score an amazing rate on the Internet - that made up only slightly for the obscene valet parking charge of $32 a night (plus tax) higher than ALL the other hotels in the area. The hotel is located a short walk from the Quarter, right across Canal Street and is close to Riverwalk and the other downtown attractions. While the room and amenties were fine, this hotel does not get a higher rating due to the lackluster service at the front desk - brusk would be a good description - as well as the average only attitudes of the other employees working there.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Justin and Cole B
Reviews.Content: Great location, awesome rooftop pool. It was awesome having free wifi in the room. Hotel was a bit older, but it was still very comfortable and stylish (very New Orleans!) Bad: Parking was kind of expensive, though I think it was average for the neighbourhood. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A great deal here!”
Reviews.Author: JohnS1935
Reviews.Content: Got an incredible deal on this one, and it turned out very nicely. Everything was as expected at this up-market hostel... First class service - the restaurant was quite reasonable for breakfast and the car parking was good value as we were able to check out and leave the car there while going on a riverboat ride.The location is superb - 2 blocks from the French Quarter and right on the Trolley route. A taste of luxury {:-))

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: Pamela B
Reviews.Content: My previous experiences with InterContinental have been exceptional, which is why my husband and I chose this hotel for our recent trip to New Orleans. However, it did NOT live up to previous expectations. When we arrived, the desk clerk (Alexis, avoid her at all costs) was extraordinarily rude and blamed it on a headache and a convention in town. We were followed to our room by four drunk teenagers at 6 in the evening. I was willing to write that off to being in New Orleans, however, I wasn't willing to write off the large bag of trash sitting on the floor outside my room. A room switch ensued, to a room with no seating except a desk chair. Guest Services initially claimed that none of the rooms had easy chairs or love seats, which was absurd, since you could see the marks on the floor where the chair had rested! A request for the manager earned a different answer...and an easy chair. Two more calls to Guest Services were required to gain access to the mini bar and to request a "Do Not Disturb" sign AND another trip to the front desk to get both keys reset after being assured that this wouldn't be necessary upon check-in. The Assistant Manager finally tried to make it right with a hospitality basket on the second evening, but attention to detail and better customer service in the first place would prevented a majority of the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and location”
Reviews.Author: Anders T
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, spacious rooms and often for a great deal. Got upgraded to a hospitality suite which was amazing. Have nothing but positive things to say about this hotel. Didn't use the outdoor pool but it looked clean - and a bit small. There's a parking lot next to the hotel ($25 overnight) which is a better deal than the valet service ($32+tax).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Good, Service very inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: Liberatr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last weekend and the hotel has a good location - 10 minute walk to French Quarter, 5 minutes to Harrah's and the riverwalk. Hotel is a little outdated but clean. Had a very enjoyable stay except check in was an issue. We arrived around 11:30am and tried to check in but no rooms were available. That's fine as check in is not until later but the agent (Layma) gave us such an attitude when we asked if we could store our 6 bags. She rolled her eyes and begrudgingly started tagging the bags. As this happened, another check in agent told us he actually found a room for us which I greatly appreciated (sorry I forgot your name but you were great!). I don't understand how Layma couldn't do this for us, especially since I am a Platinum member. Other then the rude, lazy check in agent everything else was fine and I would come back (and hopefully not get her).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jamie1310
Reviews.Content: It is a chain hotel with high expectations and that is what was delivered. Although not right in the center of the French Quarter, it was an easy walk to the hustle and bustle of the French Quarter yet it was close to some local business and eating locales, which is nice if one doesn't want their whole experience in New Orleans to be absorbed in the French Quarter. I have been to New Orleans many times so I am aware and conscious of those around me, as I never feel it is the safest of vacation spots so it was not without knowledge of crossing Canal St. but I did not feel any more anxiousness then many spots closer to the heart of the French Quarter. The hotel itsel is big, beautiful, modern and the rooms were spacious, which is sometimes hard to find in New Orleans. Did not like overpriced items found in the room such as $6.00 bottles of water but it is what is expected at such type hotels. Would easily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: Angler1_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location - just outside of the French Quarter, but well within walking distance to all attractions. The room was functional, but the shower was awful. The water did not drain so you're standing in 2 - 3 inches of water. Also, the shower head was an old fashion cone kind that nothing comes out the middle and the outside goes in all directions. We tried turning it, but still had water to come out some where from the tub. Our first morning there, the coffee maker didn't work. It is a cheap one cup at a time maker. We went down to breakfast and stopped at the desk to report the coffee maker. I was told that when I went back to my room I could call "O" and tell them. She didn't offer to do this for me or ask if I would be going right back up to my room (which we weren't). When we were being seated for breakfast we were asked if we wanted a paper, which we did, but it was never brought to us. Our drink order was taken and told someone would be with us shortly. No one came and neither did our drinks. We helped ourselves to the buffet. Still no drinks - this was after no coffee maker. We ended up asking two other people and finally got some water and coffee. Service really was not good at breakfast. When we returned from our day out, the room had been adequately cleaned, but all the drinking glasses were gone. I called the operator reported the coffee maker and asked for glasses. Someone came with two wine glasses. He said I would have to call again to get drinking glasses. Finally someone came to replace the coffee maker and it did work. We used the glasses from the bathroom for drinking. The hotel's best feature was the valet service. These guys were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. They took time to learn our names, spoke to us every time we left or entered and took exceptionally good care of our car. If the other staff members had shared their attitude, any problem encountered would have been handled differently. All the others just told me to call someone else or that's not his department. I was really disappointed in the service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: KAM16
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the InterContinental New Orleans (St.Charles) and I was very pleased. Like everyone else, I read the reviews prior to my visit and felt a bit anxious about the mix reviews. Honestly, I don't have one bad thing to say. The rooms were nice, clean and updated (I saw some reviews about tube tvs...I had a flat screen). The staff was great...friendly and helpful. The hotel was 2 blocks from busy Canal Street...once you're on Canal, you're only 1 block away from the entrance to Bourbon Street. I would definitely recommend the InterContinental New Orleans to anyone going to NOLA ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice rooms, nice swimming pool but â€œimprovableâ€� beds at the Intercontinental New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: florent1980
Reviews.Content: Following a last minute change of plan, we decided to spend 2 days in New Orleans during our annual road trip! All hotels were dramatically expensive since we were there during a week end in may. We managed to find a great deal through hotwire. The location of the hotel is perfect. 2 minutes walk to canal street but outside the French quarter (which is positive for me, I wouldnâ€™t like to sleep in the middle of the noise at nightâ€¦). The rooms were great, large enough. View is not fantastic but not bad neither (you see nice buildings but also a huge parking). The beds were not acceptable for 4-5 stars standards. We had 2 double beds which were very small and the worst thing was a board in wood below the mattress! This was really annoying and not comfortable at all. I do not know if I got the worst bed because of hotwire but I was definitely very surprised. The swimming pool is very enjoyable, we liked it very much. There are a lot of parking places in New Orleans. Price can go from 10 USD to 40USD. We actually never found the parking of the hotel which was supposed to be 25USD per day. We entered the closest door and it happened to be another parking which was 30USDâ€¦ I might have been a bit stressed finding my way in an unknown city but it is definitely not very well indicated. There are several open parking around at 10-12USD per night which I think are better deals although maybe not as secured. Overall experience is still great specially with the hotwire price. Location is great, swimming pool is great. The room amenities (starting with the bed) could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: ernperez
Reviews.Content: Prior to arriving we were not aware that the "Essence festival" was going on at the same time as our stay. Needless to say the town as well as the hotel were full of action. As an ambassador member I hoped that we would be upgraded to a suite but non were available, but we did get a balcony room, which was nice. The front desk would not budge on giving us club access. The room was comfortable and clean Though the room was a bit small, the deck expanded it 50%. Staff were average at best and no exemplar situations worth mentioning occurred. On our last day we again requested and were upgraded to an executive room, over all the balcony room was nicer, as the only difference was not having the balcony and adding a sitting room with an old tube TV.... Over all average, we did not dine or drink at the hotel. The hotel is nicely situated two blocks from the hustle and bustle of Burbon st. I prefer to stay in this location as you dont have to worry about the revelry that happens at all hours of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the N.O”
Reviews.Author: klhawkz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline and took a chance. We are so glad we did! The hotel was great the greaters and bell staff was even better! We stayed 4daus but wanted to stay longer,...,the bottle of wine was a great touch!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: BigBear1977
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental is a very nice hotel close to the French Quarter. We spent 4 nights there and enjoyed it greatly. The doormen were excellent, can't say enough about how helpful they were. The beds were comfortable and rooms nice. Just a good hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a good area!”
Reviews.Author: adkmommy1
Reviews.Content: We made a quick trip for one night to NOLA. I booked the room on Hotwire so I saved about $30. The hotel is not far from Bourbon St. or French Qtrs. We felt safe walking. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is friendly. There are also restaurants in the hotel which is convenient. The room was very clean and spacious. There is a charge of $36/night to park. This is pretty much the norm for NOLA so be prepared. Overall we were very pleased and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frank R
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was nice however the housekeeping wasn't what I expected. We returned to our room around 3PM on the 4th of July to change for our dinner plans and the room hadn't been cleaneed yet, the top of the dresser was so dusty that you could write your name in it by the last day. Had to ask for the decaf coffee and shampoo to be replaced. Overall, a good location in spite of the few minor problems, the St. Charles Streetcar is right out the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Good conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jorlan
Reviews.Content: A conference I was attending was held at this hotel and so although the price per night was a bit expensive ($140 per night before taxes), it was still a good deal since I only had to go downstairs to attend the conference sessions. The rooms were really nice, very big with a large comfortable bed and great pillows, large LCD tv, big bathroom, and a good location near Bourbon Street. The hotel has conference rooms, bars, lounges, and it looks nice when you enter. I read the other reviews that mentioned it looked old and needed renovations but it was fine for me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sruthi A
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel that provided great service...the room was very clean and the beds were so luxurious after a long day of traveling. The rooms were however a little outdated but not to bad. Its in a great location that makes it so easy to walk to the French Quarter and there is a street car stop right by. The people working were very friendly and accomodating, and gave great directions and recommendations. I would definitely come stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Nosila1982
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Intercontinental over the weekend. At 55$ a night, I really can't complain much. It is in a great location, right next to One Shell Square. It was in walking distance from Harrah's and from the Riverwalk. Now on to the room. We were on the twelth floor, the land of the 90s... Our tv was really old. I read that the hotel is replacing them. Also, the hallways are very very very muggy! I dont get it. The rooms feel fine, but it was always hot when walking in the hallways. I asked another guest if their hallways were the same and he said yes also. Also, its time to update the clocks... I've stayed at almost every hotel in New Orleans and have never seen a place that needs technology updates like this place. They should replace the old school alarm clocks with Ihome docks. Thats what the other hotels in the city are doing. Someone wrote that the beds aren't comfortable, but we found the bed to be very comfortable! Also, we liked that there is free wifi in all the rooms. Thats really great. All in all, we had a really good time and would stay again. PS- 36$ for parking??? Thats rape!

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental ?????”
Reviews.Author: GuntherGoldberg
Reviews.Content: For me this hotel has not the standard an Intercontinental , very old and dirty , the conditions of the rooms careless. Must have a renovation , good location and very soft bed. The shower small and a lot of water came out of tub, must te paint the building in my room the wal fall a part.expensive , they charge me a 3 dollar for an ice tea and really mean ice tea because was a glass full of ice.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: Hunny325
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Intercontinental at 1245am on the 15th of June. I was helped at the front desk by a clerk named, Teri. She was very professional, helpful and provided me with a list of restaurants as well as things to do. My room was great, the bed was very comfortable, I had a 42in T.V. and a large balcony. There was no view however, I sat out there almost everyday. The hotel was extremely quiet, housekeeping was great as well as room service. It was walking distance to, Bourbon St., Canal St., French Quarter, Harrah's Casino, The Riverwalk and a lot of really good restaurants. There was a CVS in walking distance. I stayed there a week and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay, Great View”
Reviews.Author: Sonja P
Reviews.Content: 1st time trip to NOLA. Stayed here in April 2012 with my 2 girls & a friend. Our corner room had a great view to the south of the skyline & of historic buildings. Staff was helpful & polite. Surrounding restaurants & available outing for a family oriented trip were acceptable. The only negative for me was the actual shower and toilet area of the bathroom could be updated but overall it was a pleasant stay. Would stay here again if opportunity presents itself.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: 3grlsmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 5 night trip (conference) The hotel is large but not too large and the location is right in the middle of everything to do ~ a nice 5 block walk to to GROSS Bourbon Street. There is a nice free gym and a rooftop pool which is rare and needed in the hot weather. The 24 hr. room services is necessary and very good ~ since there are a few hours of the day when neither restaurant is open!

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but still a great time”
Reviews.Author: houston1836
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at The Intercontinental. The hotel is a nice business class hotel. The location is great. We had a few problems though, but they weren't the end of the world. The first day we didn't get maid service until after 5 PM. Our bar glasses were never replaced once during our entire stay. On the flip side, the staff was super friendly. And did I say the location was great. We would stay at this hotel again, but we would choose the W or another nearby hotel if the price was competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobertD
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for a little getaway last spring the decor was nice the room was clean a little dated and the carpets need cleaned but we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Start to a Cruise to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Zman47
Reviews.Content: Many think that the InterContinental is a highly rated hotel and that service and trappings are at the finest levels. Not Dear friends who were joining my wife and I on a repositioning cruise to the Med decided to stay on the club floor of the hotel for three nights prior to the Royal Caribbean cruise. High and low lights of the stay 1. Front desk had our reservations but were zombies with their welcome and would not directly answer how our luggage would get to the room 2. " Over there" with a wave of the arm was the answer to Where are the elevators 3. The rooms on the second to top floor had a view of a highrise parking lot and were the same room as those much cheaper...No extras 4. Our friends needed six changes to room keys due to some computer problem...the answer was " we don't know..may change you to another floor without access to the club room...same price. Once when their key did not work they were told to leave the club floor as it was for those who were registered on the floor and obviously they belonged on a lower floor. This comment to folks about to leave on a two month cruise...wow 5. the club room was underwhelming and very tired...the one is Sydney Australia is over the top and the service there is more then one might ever want with views of the world 6. Food and beverages ran out each night halfway through the limited hours of the hospitality hours. Although the staff lady in the club room was charming, the 300 a night was three times those national chains on the River Walk next to the Cruise terminal. 7. The last night someone pulled the fire alarm at two A.M. and the entire hotel had to be emptied...we were on the top hotel floor requiring us to walk down over a dozen flights as they turned off the elevators... We sat outside with no information EVER from the management. The security folks could NOT reset the elevators so they did not come on until the morning crew came in to work. You got it...we had to walk up over a dozen floors to get back to our rooms. 8. The top floor pool is tiny...way beyond small and only six chairs around the pool when I went out on the open deck to review the offerings. The deck and pool had not been cleaned properly in some time and for the hour I was up there, not a single staff person was in sight, even though many room towels were tossed to and fro 9. As New Orelans is more and more a cruise ship starting point, hotels will be used as pre vacation spots so as not to miss a cruise. I would not stay at this venue again as it ranks about the level of a Howard Johnson with fancy flowers in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem in the center of New orleans”
Reviews.Author: NewDawn1066
Reviews.Content: I travel around 5 days a month all over the US and Europe and mainly stay at Hiltons or Westins just due to location. In future I will go out of my way to find an Intercontinental if this one was anything to go by. Admittedly I had the great fortune to be checked in by Johan Nguyen - the Front Office Duty Manager who could not do enough to explain the different options and offers that were available to me. I ended up upgrading for minimal additional cost to a suite and signed up for the Ambassador Club which allowed us a daily excellent cooked breakfast, free room wifi (8mbps - unheard of in a hotel) and free cocktail hour every evening in the ambassador lounge on the 14th floor. Nothing was too much trouble for Johan who is obviously destined for greater things to come! My colleague also had a room and he was equally impressed with the cleanliness, service and amenities the hotel has to offer. Short walks to all main attractions and a luxurious welcome oasis of calm and cool when the New Orleans humidity takes its toll. We tried to put our finger on why we like the hotel so much for our 5 night stay and put it down to the fact that the room furnishings and color schemes were very relaxing and luxurious, power shower was awesome, mini bar had enough space to store your own drinks as well, and where we were located on one corner was very quite. Could have quite happily stayed another couple of nights and seen more of the city as we were working at an exhibition. Next time there would be no shadow of a doubt that I would stay back here. By the way in response to the parking comments - Yes the car parks will rip you off if you let them but we found plenty of street parking for free next to the hotel between 6pm and 8am and then after 8 it was only $3 for every two hrs and even the car parks were giving 24 hrs for $12 at weekends. In summary - 5* masquerading a 4* if you ask me which is the exact opposite to normal experience - Well done Johan and the team you are a great flagship for your company!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent with a big drawback”
Reviews.Author: cancun123455870
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinetal for one night. I was really impressed with the staff, very nice and professional. The pool on the top roof was excellent.Drawback was the beds were extremly soft and in need of a mattress replacement, It was a very uncomfortable night. Another very disappointing thing is to have to pay $32 for parking. Overall the hotel was really nice, but I wouldn't come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: MRSMannersPortland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the InterContinental for a few days before leaving for a cruise. We had pleasant interactions with front desk and concierge staff. Our room was nice, comfy and clean. The location was very convenient to the French Quarter, shopping on Canal Street, the Aquarium and Insectarium and the St. Charles streetcar. The only negative experience we had was during dinner on our last night there. We were going to try the pub but it was too smoky, and we had our young daughters with us, so we opted for the dining off the lobby. The food was mediocre at best and the service was painfully slow.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown luxury”
Reviews.Author: reprof
Reviews.Content: Well-located, large, luxury hotel in CBD; easy walk to Canal Street, French Quarter, etc. Free wi-fi worked reasonably, but it asked if you accept terms on each use. Room comfortable but air conditioner (heat pump) could be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Worn Out with No Service”
Reviews.Author: Andrew A
Reviews.Content: If you like old worn out things go to this hotel. The T.V. was so old it looked like the one I grew up with. The picture quality matched my families 1970's T.V. If you like broken down beds you will love this hotel. I went to get something in the store at 6pm on Thursday night and it was closed for an hour. I think the attendent was on dinner break and there was no reserve. In fact I saw three staff making time with the opposite sex and three working in the entire two days I was there. I did not rate it terrible because the air conditioning worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Intercontinental Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tigercar5
Reviews.Content: We recently went with 3 other couples and stayed at the Intercontinental Hotel in New Orleans and we had a great time! As several people mentioned it is in a great location~close enough to everything but not so close that you get the noise from Bourbon St. and some of the busier areas. Our room was very quiet (we could not hear the trolley car as another person mentioned.) We ate breakfast there one morning and the food was excellent~large portions and we REALLY enjoyed the 5 man jazz band that played while we were eating. They came around and talked with us in between songs and we really enjoyed that. The service was a little slow but we realize we were down south ;) All of the people who worked there were very nice and professional...found one of the concierges a little "unfriendly" but all in all everybody else was very nice. My son recently moved to New Orleans so I know we will back to visit again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Anita H
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline's name your own price so therefore, I wasn't sure exactly what I would be getting! We were not disappointed. The hotel was very nice, as was the staff and the valet parking guys. The location was really good - not in the middle of the French Quarter noise but close enough that we walked most of the time. The parking issue in the area is a bit of a problem but even though it's pricey, it's worth the cost ($34/nite) to valet park with the hotel. We tried the parking garage next door but it's $25/nite with no in/out privileges so everytime you need your car you have to start over with the fees. The valet parking is in/out as needed for the one cost. It was definitely worth it to us. The one drawback was the streetcar noise during the night - but that is probably the case at many other hotels in that area also. They are built along the streetcar line. The only thing we noticed about the hotel is that it could use some updating - nothing major - just some cosmetic things. Overall, we would be happy to stay at the Intercontinental again.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality Intercontinetal”
Reviews.Author: Gobbledyspook
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some very swish Intercons, eg in the Middle East, and although this one isn't up to the highest standards of some of the more luxuries ones, it's still a very good hotel. Free wifi in public areas, nice big, clean rooms, good breakfast. Some of the carpets perhaps need replacing, but overall fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...but, it could use a little updating.”
Reviews.Author: divaheart06
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is situated perfectly in the French Quarter. You are right down the street from Canal Street, and down the street and around the corner from Bourbon St. However, in spite of the perfect location, the hotel could use a little updating. Wallpaper still adorns the walls, and the bathroom tiles could be replaced. Nonetheless, the water pressure is excellent, the beds are comfy, and the t.v. (hopefully, you'll be watching as little t.v. as possible) is a nice size. The staff was also very responsive. We informed the staff of a non-working lightbulb and phone, and both were fixed promptly. All in all, I would recommend the Intercontinental for its great location, and prompt friendly service (oh, and its comfortable beds). However, if you are looking for a five-star hotel, you may be a bit disappointed. Happy Traveling!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Tina30375
Reviews.Content: From the bell hops to the housekeeping staff, I could not have asked for better service. Everyone was so pleasant, and well trained to be customer focused. This hotel was immaculate and the restaurants were great. Room service was actually very reasonably priced and arrived quickly and delicious. The hotel showers you with little extras during your stay that you won't hear about on their website; such as chocolates delivered to your room by the staff with a note of "sweet dreams", and other random acts of kindness. Valet parking may seem pricey at $32 per day but was cheaper than the Marriott close by and the public parking next door was $30 per day and of course no valet. The parking attendants were very nice and retrieved your car quickly. The hotel is located on St.Charles Avenue which places it a short walk to everything without all the noise and the smell of the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennJohnnyandBoys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel specifically because we purchased it through hotwire for $80 a night. I completely understand that is a significant discount compared to what most pay. Problems are as follows: valet only parking at $32 a night; view from room was the neighbors balcony. I tried to take a picture but it wouldn't come out. Clean, comfortable beds. Clean bathroom. Probably wouldn't stay again unless through hotwire again.

Reviews.Title: “Conviently Located & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ErikaChicky
Reviews.Content: The price is worth it, the escalators to reception & the elevators was a little bit of a shock. Not overwhelmed with the staff, but the place was clean & the beds were comfy. The pool up on top of the roof is small & it's in the shade in early afternoon, but a great little getaway in the downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Nole627
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights and was more than delighted with my stay. The service around the entire hotel was great, true southern hospitality. The location is perfect, as the French Quarter is right around the corner, maybe a couple of blocks away. They do charge for parking, something like 30 bucks a day. Fortunately, you can take a shuttle to and from the Hotel and walk around the city; so you really don't need to rent a car unless you plan on going somewhere relatively far. Also, had the complimentary breakfast included in my stay, and the food was great too. Great atmosphere, I definitely plan on staying here again next time I'm in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hopewetravel
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be very nice. Didn't see obvious need for renovation, but perhaps we had one of the newer rooms. Had nice newer TV, bedding was nice. Elevators could get busy, but just at certain times of the day - near checkout and around time people were leaving to go to dinner. Location was the big plus for us - short walk to Canal and French Quarter, St. Charles Streetcard stop across street, River and Casino short blocks in other direction. Only ate one breakfast there - abuffet was just OK and pricey I thought. Service in restaurant was slow. Overall it was very nice. Were there for a conference at $200 a night so I can't speak to what other rates might be out there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent $ervice Here”
Reviews.Author: latestarter99
Reviews.Content: As a Disaster Recovery Specialist, I do the extended travel thing quite a lot. And since I travel to â€œdisastersâ€� Iâ€™m not always blessed with the best accommodations. So once in a while I like to treat myself and take the high road to a 4 star hotel, which is why I now find myself writing a review of the Intercontinental Hotel in New Orleans, Louisiana. The Intercontinental offered room rates online that exceeded my travel per diem. But Karen Stahl (the Revenue Manager), was very accommodating in getting me an agreeable rate AND a room upgrade! I arrived in mid-May and was promptly greeted by Bellman â€œRandyâ€� who cheerfully relieved me of my numerous heavy bags. Check-in was a breeze and bellman â€œMervynâ€� escorted me and my tons of luggage to my room which was and well-appointed with the usual amenities of internet, TV, VERY comfy bed, and a cash bar. The big surprise was the â€œbalconyâ€� which was not the typical 6x6 platform that many hotels call a balcony, but a huge 15â€™x15â€™ covered patio overlooking a roof top garden (very nice!). The Intercontinental is a step up in service and amenities, offering 24 hour room service. Mine was promptly delivered by a friendly and courteous gentleman named Julio. The hotel is a full service establishment and as youâ€™d expect, those services come at a price. But if youâ€™re prepared to pay the price you wonâ€™t be disappointed. The room service menu offers a reasonable variety of fare (at a price) and very well prepared and presented. I suspect that most people would be out sampling the local cuisine and not dining in their room. But I was working every day so getting a quick no-fuss meal delivered was high on my list of priorities most weeknights. As is common in New Orleans, the hotel offers valet parking (exclusively) at $32 + tax daily. I tried to always have at least $2 to tip the valets. The garage is a few blocks away and they do a lot of running back and forth so I figured they more than deserve that consideration. Call ahead for your vehicle and allow about 20 minutes for the car to come around. There is a public garage next door that charges $25/day if you want to save a few $$. The ground level of the hotel is dedicated to Peteâ€™s Bar & Grill, the sundry shop, and a coffee/Danish shop. Check-in, additional restaurants, and the Concierge are an escalator ride to the 2nd level which is very attractive and well-staffed. If youâ€™re an experienced visitor to New Orleans, you get used to waiting for elevators. But the Intercontinental has 4 very fast elevators and I never had to wait more than a few seconds for the lift. As I said, my room was well appointed, but my personal preference would be for brighter lighting. The room also offered some of those little touches I love, a very quiet air conditioning system, turning on the hot water and finding it gets hot and stays that way throughout my shower, a broad selection of TV channels to view (though no pay per view movie offerings which puzzled me). One shortcoming was the little coffee maker which brewed one cup at a time. I love my coffee so I travel with a small French press. The plus here is that the hotel supplies Columbian Supremo and when put through my press was rich and almost chocolaty, exquisite in the a.m. The biggest plus (for me) was their â€œInstant Serviceâ€� button on the phone. I hate calling customer service and either not getting an answer or getting put on hold indefinitely. Not so at the Intercontinental. Hit the button, it rings once (maybe twice) and a courteous person greets you by name and handles whatever it is you need without transferring you to another department (another thing I hate). If youâ€™re a frequenter of New Orleans, youâ€™re probably used to late night revelers loudly wandering the halls. (Why to intoxicated people talk so loud?) Not so at the Intercontinental. My room was very quiet and the bed!!!! Think of sleeping on a cloud! Iâ€™m usually an early riser and I have to admit, the bed was so comfortable that I really didnâ€™t want to get out of it and I got well acquainted with the snooze button on my alarm clock. Housekeeping was quick and thorough. Though I suspect that quick is the key word. In fact, the only obnoxious sounds I heard during my stay were the repeated slamming of doors as the housekeepers moved from room to room. Afternoon naps on the weekend were not a great idea. Bottom line: If you want to treat yourself a little better than your usual bargain hunter stay, you really should try the Intercontinental Hotel in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “A good modern hotel in downtown NOLA”
Reviews.Author: StLEngineer
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is a nice modern hotel. In New Orleans, this means that there is no damp, musty smell, the rooms are well laid-out and have modern electrical systems. When I look for hotels, beyond having it reasonably quiet, no odors, and clean, I want to have a comfortable bed. The Intercontinental has all of those. The room rate was a good one, including acceptable Wi-Fi service. The location is also very good, just a few blocks from the French Quarter and roughly a ten minute walk north of the Mississippi. The Saint Charles streetcar line has a stop across the street and the Canal Street streetcar is only about three blocks away. You can walk to any of the New Orleans urban attractions, although you'll probably want to take the streetcar if you go to Audubon Park or to the universities. The room was quite spacious, the bed comfortable, with electrical outlets available for chargers to plug in. Now a few of the negatives. The rooms do have windows, but there isn't much of a view as there are buildings all around. That's the way things are in a downtown area unless you're in one of the tallest buildings. There is a minibar, which I certainly didn't want, but there is no refrigerator for the guests. I'd certainly like to see the minibar replaced by a refrigerator. The cable reception is not very good and the LG television has colors that look faded.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for jazzfest weekend 2012”
Reviews.Author: QueenaKentucky
Reviews.Content: Good location with easy access to canal street and trolley. Short walk to french quarter and in a safe area. Didn't eat or drink onsite. Rooms are accommodating but could use new carpet. This was our second stay here and we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place Ever? No. Great? Not at All.”
Reviews.Author: weinish
Reviews.Content: First off, when you're in NoLa you really don't spend a lot of time in your room, so it's not the end of the world. But this place is listed on various travel sites as a FOUR star hotel. Maybe it was in 1992, the last time they did an upgrade, but when I stayed there, it was a 3 Star at best. This review is based on the premise that this is labeled a 4 star. To note, I have stayed at the W, the Royal Sonesta, and the Crowne Plaza previously, and all were better/nicer and more modern. The day before I stayed at the ICH, I was at the Hyatt Regency Downtown. That hotel was GORGEOUS, and brand new. This hotel was not. I stayed in Room 731, and that's because i did it on Priceline. I got a good deal, $60, so despite the lackluster nature of my room, I just dealt with it. Smelled like cigarettes, the beds were both completely tilted to the clock side (i actually flipped one myself), and the elevator was beeping loudly the entire night, to go along with slamming doors. The bathroom was decent, and had a separate sink/shower area, which is nice. The TV would sell for $4 on craigslist. The hotel is good because it's located on the St. Charles trolley line, and is a short walk from French Quarter. This hotel is at best "good." It's "really good for $60" priceline. But this is in NO WAY A 4 STAR HOTEL. I'm told there are other better rooms, and maybe there are. But I sure as heck didn't get one, nor would I stay there for the regular price of $250, which it was listed as. Sans Priceline, this place is worth about $150, maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Classic”
Reviews.Author: 3gatos
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night- this past weekend at the Intercontinental on St. Charles. I have no complaints, and I'm particular about where I sleep and the cleanliness of same. The ladies at the front desk were very helpful and sweet. We were greeted upon checkout and they remembered me from the day before... no lack of hospitability here. I called for a late checkout and was told 2 pm. GREAT!! When I called for my car I was told 15 minutes. I figured that it'd take much longer, so we waited.. but low and behold they probably did have the car ready in 15 minutes- as it was in the very front of the line when we arrived downstairs. Very comfortable stay, great bed, plasma TV, coffee maker with "Colombian Supremeo" coffee being offered! Incredible staff, great location, clean rooms- these things combined made our hotel experience one we won't forget. We will return. No complaints. None.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iddyw
Reviews.Content: The first time my wife and I stayed in this hotel we were on our honeymoon. We got to the hotel to find that the woman couldn't find our reservation, after a few minutes though she found it and low and behold they had upgraded our room because it was our honeymoon. We got up to the room to find that they also had provided us with champagne and chocolate dipped strawberries. A lovely touch. The devour may be a little outdated but it adds to the feel of a grand hotel. The staff were great, I regularly conversed with one of the gentlemen that worked at the front Neil. The stay was so good I e-mailed the company to say how good it was. Our stay was so good that we decided to stay at the hotel again when we returned to New Orleans the following year (it's a yearly trip for us from the UK for Saints games). I found the hotel was just as excellent as the previous and Neil even remembered me from the previous year. I won't be staying there this year as we are staying with friends this visit but I may see if we can book ourselves in for a night or two just because I love it so much at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classic older hotel near French Q.”
Reviews.Author: VTyankee
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the classic Old world ambiance - lovely furnishings, lovely accommodation. The bed was particularly comfortable, and although I was on the st Charles side, I was not bothered by street sounds, as I was on a higher floor. Another time I will try the street car, which is convenient to the hotel. The location was excellent for spending time in the French quarter. I could wish that free wifi was available in the rooms, but you can get it in the lobby. There is a convenience store called Moms just across the street, if you don't care to pay the hotel's prices for in room snacks. My room was clean with an updated tv and bathroom. Perhaps the hallways could use some sprucing up, but generally this was a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not even close to Interconental standards......”
Reviews.Author: Novajim2010
Reviews.Content: Checked in today, have to agree with others. Very, very rude front desk staff, nothing like the great Intercontinental properties I have stayed at before. Very dirty, worn and stained carpeting in the halls and rooms, old TV, very small room. Asked for a high floor, checked in at 12pm and no rooms were available. So we checked our bags with the hotel (had to go hunt down someone to do this from me, as the front desk couldn't be bothered) and returned at 7:30 and found we have been assigned a very small room on the 6th floor. I was at the Hyatt Regency last night and it was spectacular. I'm so sorry I went looking for a "special" place for my weekend here with my girlfriend. Should have paid more attention to Trip Advisor, but was just sure this place would live up to the Intercontinental standards. Sadly, it's much closer to a Holiday Inn this group also owns.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Some Updating, but the Serivce was Great!”
Reviews.Author: vonjon82
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the InterContinental! The staff at this hotel is awesome! They gave us plenty of information about the town, where to go, things we could do, etc. The valet satff was always quick, the concierge was very knowledgable, and the front desk staff was very accommodating. Although the hotel could use some updates in several areas (the room had a large, bubble back TV sitting on top of an armoire) the interior of the hotel is well kept. I did have an issue with the vent in the shower being open-looking and the dust, dirt, and cob webs being clearly visable. The room did have some wear, some of the furniture was a little beat-up looking and the wall paper in one area was lifting. The location was really awesome. It's only about 3 blocks from Canal St. and the street car there. That street car will take you to the Museum district and to the River Walk. You are in great proximity to the French quarter, and the St. Charles street car which takes you out to the Garden District. Altogether I'd say, that I enjoyed the hotel and the staff. If it were an option I would of given this hotel a 3 1/2, but the service I received pushed me up to 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - friendly people - problem solvers -wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: Stayed there this past weekend. Our son was married and we picked the Intercontinental based on reviews and price. He stayed elsewhere (overlooking Bourbon Street) and paid 3 times more than we did. No comparison in the hotels - ours was much nicer, much cheaper and much quieter! Yes, he had the Bourbon Street experience - probably all night long with drunk tourists and excessively loud music. We were able to party as long as we wanted and then let it go. He was trying to sleep in the middle of an all night party - I suspect it was a long night! One thing that really impressed me - my son was to get married on Saturday with a parade, etc. Thunderstorms called for on Saturday so - the wedding was moved up to Friday evening. We arrived at the Intercontinental at about 10 am Friday morning and dropped off our bags (they kept them for us under lock and key) and headed off to city hall to get the paperwork and waivers done. I explained our problem to the desk clerk and the young man was most helpful. I explained the wedding had been moved up and was now at 5pm Friday. Regular check in being at 4pm was going to be a major issue. I asked for a 2pm check in to allow us time to shower and prepare for the wedding. He assured me it would not be a problem - contacted the cleaning service people and asked for our room to be cleaned asap and took our cell phone number. These people were great - they had us in our room by 1pm and we were able to get everything done in plenty of time which relieved a lot of pressure. It is/was most appreciated. They eliminated a major hurdle (at no extra charge) and saved the day. Good job Intercontinental Hotel - your Hotel was excellent but your people and attitude was exceptional! Many thanks - Richard and Kathryn B., NC

Reviews.Title: “pretty gross”
Reviews.Author: jesskamin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental over Easter Weekend. I read the reviews on trip advisor warning that the hotel was not up to the typical Intercontinental standards...but thought the people were being hypercritical. Well....I learned first hand how run down and gross this property had become. We had a balcony room which was ready at 11 a.m. when we arrived. That was they only good part of the stay! The room smelled like urine. The wallpaper was falling off the wall. There were marks all over the walls. There was a vent over my head in the shower that was missing the cap and I could see cobwebs and dust while I was trying to get clean. It just felt grimy....like years of partying and neglect took place in the room. The balcony door was nearly impossible to open and close...once we did make it out there we noticed RED RUM was written in the 1/2 inch of dirt on the sliding door. awesome! This has clearly been there awhile due to the 1/4 inch of dirt filling in the letters. We did try to upgrade the room to the concierge floor because I read those were nicer...but they said no. We could stay in our current room and pay an extra $60 a night to have access to the concierge floor. We passed. With so many options in New Orleans...I would definitely stay someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “In NOLA for fun !”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a three night stay,04/13/12 to 04/15/12, at this hotel. It is located within walking distance of the French Quarter, The room was spacious and clean. The club room was full of cocktails and hors devours, just delicious. I found the desk clerks to be helpful and professional. I definitely would like to stay with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for our first stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller6161
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as part of our Southern America tour. The hotel is well situated just off Canal street, and from this street you get down to the river or across to rhe French quarter. We had a nice room with a large bed and good coffee maker, I like my early morning cup. There is also a free safe, the previous resident of our room had left the safe locked shut so we could not use it. The staff couldn't have been better, three people were involved but they got it open for us. We spent a bit of time in Petes Pub on the ground floor, not busy but we had a nice time. We had to use the concierges desk due to transport problems and the concierge gave us first class service. We only ate in the hotel once, a breakfast from the hot buffet and I must say the food was not hot and the staff seemed a little overwhelmed. Other than that a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Meeting Venue”
Reviews.Author: ZydecoGal
Reviews.Content: My professional group chose the Intercontinental for it's annual conference. It was not the fanciest place, but reasonably priced for the location and amenities. Out of all the places I have attended for conferences, the layout and convenience of the meeting rooms, quality of AV tech service, and catering was the best. The breakfast buffets and lunch we were served were outstanding. I had another helping of the crawfish salad stuffed avocado for dessert. The staff were all unfailingly courteous and helpful. Waits for elevators were minimal at any time of day. Housekeeping responded cheerfully to requests for extra towels and hangers and accommodated cleaning times to our schedules. The room was updated and there was a roomy closet, mini bar large enough for me to fit my left overs from Lebanon's Cafe in there (stuffed grape leaves are great cold), code safe and large desk as well as a small round table. The bed was comfy--I'm used to larger pillows but I was fine--and everything was very clean. If I have any complaint it's that the bathroom has a fixed front bureau look and no drawers or shelves for toiletries. Rather than clutter the counter, I left my items in travel bags and deposited them in the closet. I did get a rental car and found that I could park in the lot next door before 9 a.m. for $10.00. Towards Canal, close to Carondelet and Gravier, is the Hilton Garden Inn parking lot. The public can park there for $5.00 above the 6th floor. There were always spots on the same block as the Intercontinental for free between 6 p.m. and 7 a.m. Even though it was French Quarter Festival weekend, I think I ended up paying about $35 to park Tues-Sunday. It's an easy 3 block walk to Harrah's and then you can amble up Decatur or along the river front into the French Quarter. My room faced St. Charles. The rumble of the streetcars in the morning wasn't disturbing to me as it brings back nice memories of my mom taking me to Audubon Park on one when I was little. But, if you don't want to hear the clank clang clunk of the trolley, ask for a room in the middle of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Warren L
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in safe area convenient to French Quarter. Rooms and lobby were clean and in good condition. Only negative was you could hear screeching of wheels of St Charles streetcar from outside window.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: casmelancon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental New Orleans during the French Quarter festival and we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel was a great value. The property was beautiful and very clean, we will be staying again on our next visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rktj
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but great things to say about this hotel. I was a little concerned about some of the negative reviews but we received a great deal from Orbitz for our stay during the BCS National Championship Game that we could not pass it up. Hotel is in a great location. Staff was great and our room was very clean and did not feel outdated at all. In fact, we found it to be very nice and we enjoyed the massive balcony. Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice presenting, but didn't deliver”
Reviews.Author: Jlawoodson
Reviews.Content: Hotel appears very modern and updated, but the decor, beds, and entertainment were outdated. If you're not paying a lot of money, this hotel is great for its location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “They try real hard and almost make it”
Reviews.Author: waylar
Reviews.Content: Staye here 5 nights in March 2012 on vacation with my wife. Was a little concerned before we left home about some of the trip advisor reviews so I emailed the hotel and voiced my concerns. Receive a nice reply and was assured that I would be pleased. That went a long way in my opinion that they cared. Staff was terrific and alway helpful and polite. Rooms were ok, it's not a new place but it was satisfactory and clean. Had a superior king on the ninth floor, very quiet. The hotel is located perfectly right on St. Charles Av on the streetcar line. The Veranda restaurant is not open for dinner, breakfast was poor and overpriced. Ate breakfast across Poydras at the Corner Cafe, great. I would stay here again, but there are so many places in NOLA that I would probably try others. Parking was $32.00 a nite so beware.

Reviews.Title: “Happy With Our Choice for Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: Barmag
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights during Mardi Gras week, having researched TridAdvisor (where else?!) extensively beforehand. We were happy with our choice, and did not see anywhere else we would have preferred during our travels around this amazing city. The location is central and not too far from anywhere, but less noisy than might be expected. The Mardi Gras arrangements were fine - there was a good viewing stand (extra cost) immediately outside the hotel, and the important parades all pass down St Charles Avenue. Security arrangements were tightened up, with restricted access to the hotel for non-guests. This all seemed to work well, without destroying the friendly atmosphere of the occasion. Our room was a good size, bright, clean and reasonably modern. Housekeeping was first class and unobtrusive. We often go out for breakfast, but here we stayed in every day to enjoy the excellent buffet breakfast in the terrace restaurant.
