The other restaurant was smaller and less enticing - we had dinner just once, average food. The coffee shop/bakery in the basement only opened during the middle of the day for a few hours, and we never did manage to find it open. The pub on the same floor is large but mercifully well soundproofed. Cheerful and attentive staff throughout the hotel. The concierge is as charming and helpful as his video on the hotel's website suggests: our touring and dining queries were all dealt with smoothly and efficiently. Free WiFi only operates in the public areas. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Smells like cat urine go somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Grettalynn
Reviews.Content: We arrived and the room smelled like cat urine. Called the front desk and since they were booked solid the brought us a tiny tree air freshened. Lovely.

Reviews.Title: “not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: tsukikenn
Reviews.Content: by name and when viewing their website, one would think this is a 4 or 5 star hotel. Only the price seemed to indicate a 4 or 5 star. However, like the other reviewers, my experience didn't meet my expectations. There is practically no lobby and there are no seats when waiting for your transportation. My room was adequate but noisy. Room service was good and the food was above average. However, the conference food and service was less than average.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best one”
Reviews.Author: gitanocalificado
Reviews.Content: Nothing special, below Intercontinental average. Very old TV sets. Expensive parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: familyfun712
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable room with a good view. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever - Great location, wonderful Staff and best of all a Quiet, Elegant Room. Will we return.”
Reviews.Author: Pakse
Reviews.Content: Short Review - stay here, great hotel - get a room on the club floor. Long Review - Checked in at 1:00am. If things are going to go pear shaped, it is going to happen at 1:00am. Not only is it late - but this is a family trip, this is why I work - this is why I travel - this is what matters to me. On a business trip if things go wrong - it's just me, I'll deal with it; but on these family trips - well, they are more complex and it matters a lot more to me that things go right. Everything went right. Check-in took all of 2 minutes. Staff was polite, courteous and knowledgeable. Very smooth. The lobby was clean and elegant - and very sharp - if I hadn't known better I would have thought it was brand new hotel. Elevator needed a room key to whisk us up to the 14th floor (my wife liked the extra security). Walking off the elevator the hallway was bright and fresh and the carpet in great shape - again, things looked good - in no way dated (some reviews have mentioned cleanliness; I'm in the food business - my lowest health department score in years has been an 98% - I know clean - the hotel was clean; this isn't an opinion (the wife is a certified inspector and has a doctorate - she was impressed, that's not easy). Ok - Hotel looks good, staff is great, lobby is nice, hallway in good shape and now we get to the room. The room. Wow. Just Wow. After staying at the Grand in Paris, the Amstel in Amsterdam, the Willard, the Barclay, the IC Rome and a host of others - it takes more than a standard room for us to go wow. This was nice - by any standard. Beautiful corner suite on the club level. We loved the room; the master bed had been fitted with one of those fancy foam mattresses, the extra bed we requested was in the room - even more comfortable than the master bed; and outfitted with extra pillows and blankets. Great beds, spotlessly clean room. And it was huge - Master bedroom with a private bath, sitting area, foyer, dinning room, office, second bathroom. Oh - and a kitchen - huge fridge; which we made use of and loved :) We slept well and soundly each night. The location is 2 blocks off the french quarter - the room was silent at night. Silent - no streetcar noise, no noise of any kind. I had to work, loved the desk (not a glass top thank goodness) and the Internet was quick. Ok - so the room from it's core function of getting a good nights sleep - check, perfect. It was tastefully well appointed, highly functional and a joy to relax within. I've mentioned a few times we were on the club floor - many club floors in the US are not a great value; this was the exception - this club was quite nice. Each morning my wife and I wandered down the hall for a quiet breakfast; eggs, bacon, salmon and much more - very nice breakfast; good coffee to boot - but make sure you have a croissant, truly the highlight of the breakfast. And kudos to the lounge attendant, she was wonderful at assisting with any request. Each evening the lounge was transformed with a plethora of food and drinks (we did not partake as we had huge dinner reservations each evening) but the food did look nice. Twice I ran down to the lounge for an extra drink late in the evening (Diet Coke - as I stayed up a few nights and worked late while the family slept) - I really appreciated they kept chips, sweets and drinks out late in the evening. Lounge - Great value for money - wonderful full hot breakfast, nice evening food and drinks and very considerate snacks and drinks kept stocked in the lounge 24/7 for guests. We really appreciated/enjoyed the lounge. Location - again - perfect. Two blocks off the quarter kept it quiet; and right on a streetcar stop meant we had a fun ride down to magazine and the garden district for a whopping $1.25. For longer trips the cab stand at the hotel always had a taxi for us, even during downpours. Less than a 2 minute walk to CVS, with multiple local shops even closer. To recap: Clean Hotel, great nights sleep, wonderful room, excellent lounge and prime location. We will return, we will recommend the InterContinental New Orleans to friends and colleagues. Should I have the opportunity to hold a meeting in the city, my first call will be to the InterContinental New Orleans. Our trip could not have been better and the hotel and staff were a big part of making this one of our best family vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: sappina
Reviews.Content: Quite old hotel, very bad service for a really expensive stay. Parking costs 32$ per day and you should wait the car for half an hour (minimun) A bottle of water costs 6$ During the staywe cannot use the room an entire morning due to cabling works, totally unacceptable! After the works the room was dirty Services too low for the price paid

Reviews.Title: “Not customer oriented”
Reviews.Author: cazzeroli
Reviews.Content: The location is good but the service was really awful. We waited 1h the car from the parking where the average pick up time is 20min, we should stay out of the room for an entire morning due to the cabling of the wifi; after the work they left the room dirty; the worst thing was that when we complained about these problems the reception guy was totally unconcerned and served us very bad Totally unacceptable

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Up To Expectations”
Reviews.Author: boontongirl59
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of its location close to the French Quarter and cruise port. Stayed two nights and was happy with the location....but underwhelmed with the front desk personel and room. Front desk folks were not welcoming at all...almost to the point of rudeness. Rooms were a bit "tired" but beds comfortable. Valet attendants were wonderful and happy to recommend places to eat and visit.

Reviews.Title: “Superior customer service with expensive add-ons”
Reviews.Author: Roy R
Reviews.Content: We traveled as a family with our 1.5 year old and 4 month old. The staff was very welcoming and helpful with tips about where to go, what to do, etc. The property seemed fairly new with a very nice lobby and really friendly staff. The beds were super comfortable. The pool was mediocre in the fact that it was small and shallow. The hotel is in a good location - 10 minute walk to the French Quarter or Harrah's and less than 5 minutes from all the shops and restaurants on Canal Street. The valet parking was very expensive ($30/day) and we did have issues getting our car a few times as we called down but the car wasn't ready when we came down. The wi-fi was also very expensive. You would think this would be a complimentary add-on since the hotel room itself is pricey. This hotel is very modern and has all the amenities you would be looking for. Highly recommended for families and business travelers alike with a caution about the expensive add-ons.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and full of charm”
Reviews.Author: sleake
Reviews.Content: I stayed that the Intercontinental for a business trip. Upon arrival, the valet attendants are friendly and very helpful. The hotel is beautiful, lots of modern charm. All of the staff was friendly. The room....CLEAN. The room is spacious, the bed comfy, and the floor was quiet. I didn't hear anyone from any of the other surrounding rooms. As a light sleeper, this is important. There is a coffee maker in the room....pass on that. The coffee is like motor oil and the coffee maker is a little odd. Mine steamed and spit and spilled water all over the sink...but I am sure they are not all that way. LOL There is a small pool and a gym. The pool would not be not sufficient for kids, but perfect for cooling off after a long day. There is a pub on the lower level and a coffee shop, both recommended for a great burger or nice latte. The hotel is located in the business district but is convenient to Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. Just a short 5 or so block walk. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: wildcatgolf
Reviews.Content: This Intercontinental Hotel is not as up to date as others, but still better than your average hotel. Very nice folks working here, they want to help. Rooms are fine, a little dated but everything worked well. Stayed on 8th floor and had no noise on a very busy weekend. Club level is nice. Julie made us feel right at home. Location is a few blooks from bourbon, which is great for no street noise. Walking to french quarter, arena, restaurants, and shops is no problem. There may be better places to stay, but this hotel trys hard to please. Nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manhattanchelsea
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and amenities all around. Overall, above average in all areas. Executive Lounge needs some attention however and fresher image and better food presentation. Daily delivery of New York Times a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: K8Mac1
Reviews.Content: Second time I have stayed here for New Orleans Half Marathon. They really need to remodel the rooms! The TVs are old (not flat screen) and sit in a hugh armoire which takes up lots of space. There we two of us in the room, and each day, we got two washcloths, two bath towels and two hand towels from housekeeping. And each day we had to get two more sets because we took two showers a day because of the heat. So I think they need to revisit the number of towels they give guests. Staff is nice, and as I said, it's a great location in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cyr75
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with oustanding rooms. Nice hardwood furniture. Very friendly staff : we were upgraded for our room so as to get 2 connecting rooms (with young kids, it is really more confortable). The outdoor swimming pool was heated during our stay ; it was great to swimm on the top of the hotel during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay wasn't what we thought it was going to be,.”
Reviews.Author: meme300
Reviews.Content: Paid $26755 for 7 days, way to much money for the service and room. Was told internet service was available, but wasn't told it would be $10 a day if we wanted it in our room, which is where most "good hotels" have it. Had to go down to a very noisy lobby when we wanted to use it. They advertise "paper delivered to room daily" Don't know whose room it went to but it wasn't ours. For the money we paid you would of thought breakfast would be given, but no way. Expensive to eat at the hotel . $26 for a burger and fries. Certainly not worth it. Wish I had read reviews before I booked.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service & over priced”
Reviews.Author: standup0vation
Reviews.Content: Will not recommend this hotel. The staff is not really helpful and the managers are downright rude, specially the night manager Mr. Johan Nguyen. The hotel is definitely in need of renovations. Very overpriced and there is an event scheduled in town, the management as well as the reservation coordinator Mrs Nicole Harisson indulge shamelessly into price gauging which is actually against the law. STAY AT OWN RISK as you cannot complain to anyone at corporate level. This hotel is part of the FRANCHISE program of the Intercontinental Hotel Group and is operated by the owner, and does NOT reflect the usual higher standard of most of Intercontinental Hotels. Would never recommend this hotel to families with children or/and senior citizen,as they can fall prey to an unscrupulous management. Not worth the money nor the trouble!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Latty
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay! As Ambassadors we were upgraded to the Executive Floor, it had good view and was quiet. The Exec Lounge was welcome, more like european lounges, open bar and good noshes. The Concierge was very helpful, as were the front desk staff. The furniture was showing a little wear.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel needs a face lift ... urgently!”
Reviews.Author: Twobigfeet
Reviews.Content: This hotel has definitely seen better days ... the decor is from the last century (80's) and appears worn, drab and quite frankly, dirty! The sooner Intercontinental decides to do a facelift and remodeling of the hotel, the better. The only redeeming quality of this hotel is its central location ... but there are so many other more appealing hotels in New Orleans that offer the same. My advice: stay somewhere else if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok hotel, but not up to intercontinental standards”
Reviews.Author: ericahub
Reviews.Content: Comments that this hotel is not up to intercontinental standards is spot on. The lobby is fine, and the bathrooms are nice, but the rooms are very small with dated decor. The staff were helpful overall, although they did send my luggage to another guest's room, which I addressed with the management. They do charge extra for internet, which is common in business hotels, as they expect you to expense it anyway, I think. There is free wi fi in the lobby. Overall, if you get a good deal, it is worth it. However, I was expecting it to be up to other intercontinentals I have been in (which are normally very modern, i think) and it was not.

Reviews.Title: “Always good”
Reviews.Author: DaughnSpahn
Reviews.Content: I grew up in New Orleans, know the city well and this is the hotel we usually stay in when we return. Good location, great services.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: iixii
Reviews.Content: The pro of this hotel is that it is close to the french quarter. On the down site, they charge extra for parking (common in the area) and wifi (less common). The room was clean enough but looked worn. The main issue with the stay was that the key to our room did not work and the staff refused to move us to a different room be cause apparently none were available. We could only get a different room if we paid extra for an upgrade. The were asking more than double the original rate just so we could get a working key. Rather poor form on the part of the staff when they obviously had empty rooms to keep us stranded in the room we couldn't open.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Sheri S
Reviews.Content: Great staff, very helpful at check in and with suggestions. Even loaned us an umbrella when it was raining. Hotel is showing age and the walls are paper thin. You are in New Orleans and people are yelling at us through our walls telling us we are being too loud. Hotel was right off Canal, which is close to everything. Bourbon St was literally a 5 minute walk. French Market was only about 10 minutes. I was only here for a short stay but was overall satisfied with the service

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: rjnurs
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a fast (even early) check in. Great room. Clean and comfortable bed. I managed to get a GREAT deal on Priceline, so the value was fabulous for us. I have read some complaints about the rooms being dated, but so what? I don't HAVE to have a flat screen TV. (I don't come to NOLA to watch TV.) Everything was clean and comfortable, the bathroom spotless. The lobby is beautiful and the service was impeccable. I had very fast bell service and valet when checking out in spite of in being 10 minutes to check out time on a very busy Sunday morning! Walked easily into and out of the french quarter, but you have to be ready for some serious walking in this town anyway! Would definitely stay here again, but probably not spend the full price for their rooms, just because I love a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Intercontinental Standards”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: "The hotel is showing its age," is a common refrain from TripAdvisor members regarding the New Orleans Intercontinental. They're right. I stayed at the Intercontinental New Orleans from Feb 1-5. It's a nice hotel in a good location along St. Charles Avenue in the CBD. However, it's simply not up to Intercontinental standards. The first thing I always do upon checking into a hotel is to turn on the TV. When I attempted to turn on the TV at the Intercontinental I discovered the remote did not work. I then discovered the slide-out drawer the TV rested upon was broken...leaving the TV slanting from left to right at an angle that made for awkward viewing. After turning on the TV using the buttons on the front of the TV I noticed that hitting "Channel Down" actually turned off the TV instead of working properly. Additionally, the TV is an old CR-Tube model. In an era when three star hotels have large flat screen TVs, it felt a bit strange watching an old-style, non-HDTV model at a supposed four-star hotel. I try not to stay at places that do not offer free wifi, but the Intercontinental doesn't even offer PAID wifi! The hotel is really like taking a trip back to 2005. Since I've stayed in New Orleans 5 times over the past 5 years, I thought I'd give you my guide to the hotels I've stayed in (from best to worst): 1. Lowes (great location, great bar (Swizzle Stick) and wonderful service) 2. Royal Sonesta (the jewel of the French Quarter, very attentive service, but guest rooms and hallways look dreary and drab) 3. Sheraton (mega-hotel on Canal St., caters to conventioneers, good location) 4. Intercontinental 5. Royal St. Charles (DO NOT STAY HERE - rude, inattentive service, ground floor nightclub (now a coffee shop) kept me awake all night with bass-heavy trance music) I would have complained about the TV, but a.) it was midnight upon check in, b.)replacing a tv is not an easy task, especially for those old heavy ones, and c.)I didn't want to switch rooms at that time of night. Oh...almost forgot. I know SOMEONE has to stay in the room by the elevator, but it sucks that it was me. Drunk people returning from the French Quarter at 4:00AM awoke me every night. If you go, don't stay in Room 730!

Reviews.Title: “Dated, but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Larry J
Reviews.Content: While some of the furnishings are showing their age (they could use some Formby's wood restorer), they were very clean and comfortable. We weren't swarmed with people wanting to help us with our luggage--but that was ok, since we didn't have much or need help. We got a super rate, since my wife knows how to manipulate Priceline. The hotel is very conveniently located to the French Quarter and the riverfront. Grab the St. Charles streetcar in front and ride it to the end and back for a leisurely activity--only $3 for an all-day pass.

Reviews.Title: “good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: SomersetDenzil
Reviews.Content: good value as we got reduced rate with on line booking.Nice room , staff very helpful and friendly.Car parking was expensive extra

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff, Accomodations not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Angela L
Reviews.Content: We just had a very nice stay at the InterContinental NO. Randy, one of the staff members went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable and recommend useful tips and affordable activities. He even pulled out a coupon for us when we mentioned we were going to a particular restaurant. Everyone we encountered at the hotel was helpful and nice but this guy went above and beyond, they should give him a raise. The accommodations could've used some work - some spots on the linens, rips in the wallpaper and the chair in our room looked like it had seen better days. But overall it was a good experience, mostly because of the excellent staff. Oh, and the location was fantastic as well. Very convenient to walk to French Quarter, Bourbon street, river walk, aquarium or to grab the streetcar.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you can get a deal on the rate. Don't pay full price for this one.”
Reviews.Author: bigmamu
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for five days and attended a professional meeting at the convention center. Rooms are fine, staff was nice. However, it not as high end as you would expect. For some unknown reason there was a 15 min wait for breakfast even though there were plenty of tables available. Also my biggest complaint was no wireless at all in the rooms. So, if can get a deal on the room rate, it's fine. Otherwise spend your $$ somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and clean spacious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy138
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - 4 blocks from Canal Street and on the St. Charles streetcar line. If you are on the St. Charles street side, you will hear a dragging sound from the streetcar, but I actually liked the noise (it reminded me of the sound snowplows make). My room was spacious and had a great comfortable King bed. The bathroom had a separate vanity area with a magnifying mirror and small but powerful hair dryer. The toiletries were ok - nothing special. The desk are was ample, and the chair and ottoman doubled as my closet, although a lighted closet with full-length mirror is provided. Overall, EXCELLENT. Room service was good too - try the onion rings and root beer float.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: NVCBJ
Reviews.Content: Good service at reception and and the auto area at entrance. Entrance area and reception are well appointed and modern-looking. The floors on which the rooms are located look tired, and are not up to my expectation of an Intercontinental hotel. We stayed two separate nights, in different rooms. Our room the first night, on the 12th floor, was "fine" but showing its age. 525, our room on the second night, was of a shape that suggested that it originally had been something other than a regular sleeping room - the TV console was at an angle to the wall with all the wiring for the TV and fridge exposed; there were electric wires and TV cables taped to the floor; furniture that did not match appeared to be randomly placed around the room, Both rooms, particularly the second one, were substandard to what I expect from an Intercontinental hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Winter vacation”
Reviews.Author: Patricia D
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel. Close enough to the French Quarter and far enough to not be in the middle of the late night craziness. Nice quiet room and very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “BCS GAME”
Reviews.Author: TIDE2124
Reviews.Content: Poor service, old tv, valet parking is expensive and takes forever to get your car. I called to complain and the Intercontinental guest relations dept. was of no help. I spoke to Jada at the hotel several days later and she was somewhat helpful but not what you expect for an Intercontinental Hotel. The best part of the trip was the ballgame RTR !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful valet staff”
Reviews.Author: Campers5
Reviews.Content: My family of five stayed in this hotel in late December on a road trip to Colorado. We had a large luggage rack on the back of our SUV and of course, we were worried about the safety of our "stuff". The very helpful valet staff kept our car parked in the front area of the hotel during our entire stay which was one night and the next day until around 5 pm. After we checked out of the hotel, they held our car at no extra charge while we spent the day touring New Orleans. Our hotel room was nice and clean but I can not say that it was wonderful. But all the hotel staff was wonderful and I would stay here again because of the wonderful service that we received.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: thatsenough29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel January 13-16th for a small vacation. Check in was fast, our room was ready 6 hours before normal check in time. The rooms were very clean, the view was great. The staff was a pleasure. The hotel is on the streetcar line, but we only used the streetcar to go uptown, as everything else, the French Quarter, Bourbon St, and excellent restaurants were all within walking distance. Great stay, we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Denise A
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel my check in was fast and efficient, especially for a Friday afternoon. The bellman escorted me to the top floor of our suite. We had two entrances to our 2,000 square foot suite. The suite was furnished with two separate bathrooms, love that! Bathroom amenities included, fluffy robes, slippers, and great bath products. We were welcomed with a bottle of wine, fresh fruit and water. The view of the city was fantastic. Turndown service is offered daily. My husband and I went to the bar for a night cap, it was pretty quiet for a Friday night. We had just missed the music and the bar closed early. Our breakfast the next morning was disappointing. The service was slow, and the restaurant wasn't busy. My husband did speak to the Food and Beverage manager and our problem was resolved. The hotel is in a great location for walking the city. The staff is very helpfull on letting you know of any "special events" happening in the city during your stay. The houskeeping staff were fantastic! We always had extra towels, and a smile from everyone. A comfortable bed, a happy staff of employees with a can do "attitude", and a great location makes this hotel a plus if you are traveling to "The Big Easy".

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: flygal89
Reviews.Content: Just returned home after staying at the Intercontinental New Orleans for three nights during the BCS Championship weekend. I was a little skeptical going into this stay after reading reviews from other travelers, but I was very pleasantly surprised. I am quite a discerning traveler, and I must say we were pleased from the moment we arrived. It was a crazy busy time to be in New Orleans, and we were checking in on the Saturday before the BCS Championship Game, which was on Monday. I expected great delays at check-in, because I knew they were booked to capacity. As soon as we drove into the driveway of the hotel, we were greeted by a smiling valet and a bellman...surprising, given the number of people who were arriving at the same time! They pleasantly took our car and our bags and directed us toward the registration desk, where we were greeted by a friendly young man named Alton. He greeted us with a smile and addressed our two little girls, ages 8 and 9. He made sure we knew our way around, directing us to the elevators and sincerely telling us to come to him if we had questions or concerns. I had called a head a couple days before and requested an upper floor, and we were happy to find we were on the 12th floor. I think lower floor rooms probably have more street noise. Upon entering the room, we saw comfy beds with extra pillows...a big plus. Some of the furniture was a little worn, and yes, the television was not a flat screen, but everything worked great, and we were happy enough with the furnishings. There were blackout drapes on the window (huge for me!), hair dryer, coffee maker, and we were given extra towels as soon as we requested them. Room service was prompt and friendlty, and the food was delicious. We ordered breakfast one morning, and we were thrilled when it arrived. You can order one New Orleans style breakfast, and it will feed two people, though it doesn't say so on the menu. The coffee was great too. We also ordered dinner one night, but I always order a burger or sandwich from room service, because I feel like it's safe. This time I ordered the Bistro Burger, and it was fabulous! I wanted to eat the whole thing, but it was HUGE, so I couldn't! Because we have two little girls, we always have to visit the hotel gift shop, no matter where we go, and we were very pleased with the service and selection there. All toiletries are available, and the staff is very kid-friendly. As far as location, if you don't want to be in the midst of all the chaos of the French Quarter but want to be nearby, this hotel has a fabulous location. We were a couple blocks off Canal Street, making us just a few blocks from the French Quarter. Poydras St is just down the block, making this hotel convenient to the Superdome, easily within walking distance. The streetcar picks up just down the block at the corner of St. Charles and Poydras, and we opted to use this to get back and forth to Commander's Palace retaurant (a must!). We checked out on a Tuesday morning...again, another busy day, since the big game was the night before. Again, I was anticipating delays at checkout and at the bell/valet desk, but those delays did not exist! Check out was speedy, and Alton remembered the girls! We have been home for just one day, and I have already recommended the hotel to a friend who is visiting New Orleans in March. There are "nicer" hotels in New Orleans, but I cannot believe you will get better service from any staff. And the location is tough to beat. The only reason I didn't rate it "excellent" is because the hotel does show some wear and just needs a little sprucing up. Kudos to an excellent staff. We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellant staff”
Reviews.Author: EGliz1022
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in early December 2011. The conceirge was so helpful! I believe his name was Michael. He gave me some good tips on running routes in the area as well as good places to eat and shop. The hotel is a bit old and could use some updating, but it is clean and in a fantastic location. We loved being right near the trolley line. We usually stay in the Quarter but no more. It was great to be a few blocks away and have some "quiet" time. We would definately stay here again mostly due to the great staff and the location,

Reviews.Title: “Super nice!!!”
Reviews.Content: I mean its an intercontinental hotel would you expect anything less. Great rooms and service...Great place to stay my only concern is if your younger it may not be a place for you. its an older crowd of people that stay here so if your looking for a party hotel this aint it. That being said i loved my stay here and cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “my go-to hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: wisgirl01
Reviews.Content: I love the Intercontinental in New Orleans because it is clean, has super comfortable beds, upscale amenities, the staff is friendly, and it is a safe walking distance to everything. Depending on when you go, there is plenty of on-street pay-to-park, usually right in front of the hotel. $1.50 an hour, but free between 6pm-8am. The decor is a bit dated, but all other factors trump for me. I love staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, large room, good beds, good location”
Reviews.Author: Pierport
Reviews.Content: I would rate this 3 1/2 stars. Good sized rooms, comfortable beds, great location. Room was somewhat dated but was fine. Certainly not perfect but was a good value and was fine for us,

Reviews.Title: “New Years Weekend”
Reviews.Author: KDnowak
Reviews.Content: Highly over rated. View from balcony was the Pan American Building, wow!

Reviews.Title: “hotel is showing wear and tear”
Reviews.Author: Ashton B
Reviews.Content: the hotel was not as clean as it used to be. trash in the hallways, door know in bathroom falling off, seems everyone at the front desk was in training

Reviews.Title: “This place is nice!”
Reviews.Author: Betty2me
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in historic hotels like the Monteleone or Reed House. The interior reminds me of either. My room was clean, the upholstery on the nice chairs is spotless, the toiletries smelled awesome and nothing was broken, chipped or lacking regarding infrastructure. The only thing keeping me from giving this an excellent rating was there was a mini bar instead of a free fridge and my mattress was too soft. I couldve stayed at The Monteleone for $323 per night but spent $130 less to stay at the Intercontinental. Even the parking was $20 cheaper per day. Don't listen to the haters. This is way nicer than the Holiday Inn on Royal St. and parking will always cost in downtown New Orleans. Plus, there was a new Porsche sedan parked near the lobby. This is no dive.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: amyjemesouviens
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec. 17 - 19, and it was wonderful! The hotel was luxurious, beautifully decorated for Christmas, and very clean! The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was well equipped! We enjoyed this stay very much and we do recommend it to others. The location was ideal as well! Do not hesitate or worry about booking a reservation here! It is truly ALL good and I am very observant!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds and Problem Solving Staff”
Reviews.Author: Melissa A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend at the beginning of December - a great time to visit NOLA if you would like to avoid crowds, but still enjoy the Christmas decorations. Our room was available even though we arrived at 10AM - hours before check in - but our room key did not work. We tried MULTIPLE times to find out that the lock was broken. Though the whole ordeal took about 3 hours to resolve, we were upgraded to a Club Level Room. The staff definitely made up for the inconvenience. The beds were super comfy and the area was perfect. Quiet and gave us just enough of a walk to work off all the delicious food we enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “Attractive 3-srar hotel,,HORRIBLY over-priced”
Reviews.Author: martinibill7777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a Holiday Inn type level 2.5-3-star hotel. Prices are obscene. $32 a day parking, plus tax and tip. $6.00 bottle water. It is no wonder it is always available on Priceline. Don't bid more than $40 and bring your own snacks.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisalisala
Reviews.Content: Last weekend, we stayed at the Hotel InterContenental in New Orleans and had a terrific time. We loved that the trolley ran right in front of the hotel. We discovered a beautiful courtyard on the 5th floor. For a $100 we upgraded to a suite which was very nice. Loved the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place & location!”
Reviews.Author: Stephano617
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable. Great location, the staff was very helpful, especially Randy the doorman! They went out of their way to make our stay great! Easy access to the Quarter, 3 different streetcars & plenty of dining options!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GinaM95531
Reviews.Content: Nicer than the budget hotels and a bargain via one of the discount online miscellaneous bookings. Only an extra block or two from the main French Quarter areas. People were even walking to/from the Superdome for the Saints/Giants game. We stayed three days post-cruise to do some typical tours for the area. Housekeeping could improve for our particular room. Other than that, it was a great place and the folks are friendly there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel. Expensive Valet Parking!”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseMaster
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a Jay-Z and Kanye West "Watch the Throne" concert this past weekend with my girlfriend and must say it is very nice for just a Benjamin and a Grant and that's with tax. named my own price off Priceline! After reading all the other reviews I was afraid I made the wrong choice, that was until I got there. Then I realize this is a very, very nice hotel. Probably about a 4 or even a 4.5 star hotel. Rooms looked old in the pictures, but when we got there the rooms felt very expensive and luxurious for the most part. Like old luxury, which really gave it that New Orleans type of feel I was looking for. Beds are very very soft, which me and my girlfriend practically melted into like a soft marshmallow. Nice of them to stock the fridge with 5 different types of liquor, 1 or 2 wines, a few sodas, and some candy-bars and cookies as well. At hotel prices of course, lol. Just be aware, valet parking cost about $35 a night. And the parking garage next door cost about $30 for over 10 hours of parking, so might as well stick to valet parking. Last, location can't really get better if you ask me. I didn't realize everything is about 2-3 blocks away... Harrah's casino, the Riverwalk Mall, the famous Mothers Kitchen and Bourbon steet. Mother's kitchen was probably the best part of the trip to me honestly, food there was amazing. Like super duper, good down south home-cooked food. The best of the best. And I am from North Carolina. So take it from me. Mother's reputation is well deserved. Would I stay there again? For the price I paid, anytime. The only thing I didn't like about New Orleans is it seems everything is very expensive there. For no reason. And I mean everything...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but aging accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: Cricket1964
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful location, within walking distance to Bourbon Street, Harrah's, Aquarium, Riverwalk, and three different streetcar lines. Got a fantastic deal on priceline, which listed it as a 4 Star. Street appeal is good, and lobby and common areas are good. Pool is very small. Rooms were mostly clean, some debris from previous person. Beds were pretty comfy, but are definitely full size, not double or queen. Also, the beds do seem to be well worn. Service was good, room service good. Some broken fixtures, wallpaper peeling, mostly little things, but it all takes away from the overall appeal of the hotel. Parking is more than 32 per night so figure that cost in. Walls are thin and you can also hear streetcar traffic (even from 12th floor).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for a Great Rate”
Reviews.Author: mholder37
Reviews.Content: We received this hotel for a Priceilne bid. We got a wonderful deal. The room was clean and the staff was friendly and very attentive. Our bedding and non-smoking preferences were all honored. There were a few glitches, however. It took almost two hours to check into three rooms. We were told a room was ready, and then it wasn't, multiple times. I was called by the front desk and told the rooms were ready and then when I got to the desk they insisted no one had called. Then we were told that 2 of the rooms weren't ready by the front desk when the housekeeper standing in front the room said it had been made up and was totally ready. Also our keycards didn't work on a regular basis. I'd say I got 10 new cards for three rooms over 4 days. We were careful to keep them far from our phones but that didn't help. Finally, our coffee was never refilled after the second day and in one of the rooms our towels were not fully replenished after the first day. Some of our party loved the beds, others thought they were too soft. I fall into the too soft camp, but your mileage varies there depending on what you like. The location was good, only a five minute walk to the French Quarter, and felt safe even at night (though we were never out past 10:30pm). The elevators were surprisingly fast and always available. The pool is small but nice and the fitness center was excellent. Parking is stupid-expensive but that's the norm in that area. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, made me feel at home!!”
Reviews.Author: Jenjenkay
Reviews.Content: I've been here for a meeting. Hands down, this hotel provided the BEST service I've ever had as a planner. As difficult as I am, everyone was so accommodating - they're number 1 goal was to make sure I was happy. They made sure that my group had a real New Orleans experience. As was previously mentioned, the hotel rooms are due for some room upgrades, but the ballroom was beautiful. I can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! What a great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yral R
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? The service was excellent. Valet was fast and efficient. Check in was seamless. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very spacey and comfortable. The bed and pillows were cozy. The shower...the shower is probably the best thing about the room. Very nice strong water flow. Almost like receiving a good massage. The climate control was adequate. The food from the restaurant was tasty as well. I would highly recommend staying in this hotel!!!! WE LOVED IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Please clean the comforters!”
Reviews.Author: Katestclaire
Reviews.Content: We were greated very warmly and check-in was a breeze. Upon first glance, the room was nicely appointed. Upon further inspection, the brown runner at the end of the bed had white crusty stains on it. This was literally sickening! Also, since our stay was the Monday before Thanksgiving, the hotel's occupancy was very low. This makes it hard to understand why they would place us directly on the trolley route! The sound of the trolley every half hour sounds like a Boeing 747 right outside our window! Also, out remote for the TV did not work and we called 3 times, being told that someone would be right up to replace it...not once did anyone ever show up. Needless to say that after check in, service and cleanliness were amiss!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: texasgirl1969
Reviews.Content: If you are expecting a new, spotless hotel, this isn't it. I loved the hotel. The staff were great and welcoming. I had a few drinks in the bar area and I loved that they had plenty of seating for surfing the web, etc. Visited the restaurant for a cup of coffee but did not eat so I can't comment on the food. The room was spacious enough and comfy. I did not like the view but this is what you get when you pick a hotel downtown and not on Bourbon or Canal street. Got a great price thru priceline and it actually was better than expected given the reviews I've read. It is exactly 3.5 short blocks to Canal St and 4.5 blocks to Bourbon. I'm in Texas and 1 block to us is about 3 in the FQ area. The only bad thing I would say is the water system. Good golly, when you flusn the toilet or take a shower it is EXTREMELY loud! Overall, I would stay here again if I got a good deal again but I'd prefer the FQ/Canal St area. Stayed here Nov 18-20, 2011

Reviews.Title: “Family trip to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: MSBulldogBelle
Reviews.Content: We got a double room. As stated there is no door separating the vanity area from the room, so if someone is brushing their teeth, you will hear them. Also my husband was sick so I almost wish the A/C was louder. LOL. There are no refrigerators or microwaves in these rooms, so don't expect to have a place to store or reheat any leftover food. Overall for the price, we are very satisfied with our choice and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but needs a facelift”
Reviews.Author: cookmb
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that I did book a combined air/hotel package through Expedia which may have something to do with the room we got. Beds had down type pads on top of the mattresses, which were comfy, but the mattresses were obviously old as I felt like I had to keep myself from sinking into the middle each night. Our window in our room looked out onto someone else's balcony which was quite odd. Location was pretty good. 2 blocks from the Quarter but far enough away from the craziness. We did not eat in the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “You need to ask repeatedly to get the room you want!”
Reviews.Author: l0ves2trvl
Reviews.Content: We checked in for a 6 night stay and were given a room on club level as requested. The room was really small and right next to the elevators. We immediately asked for a larger room in a different location and were told there was nothing available, period. We called reception the next morning and made the same request and asked for a suite on the club level. It took 3 calls to 3 different people before we were finally moved to a suite at the same rate. The first woman said there was nothing available and we didn't need a suite since we were a couple and it would cost $60 to $80/night more. My only question to management is why did it take 3 calls to get our room changed? The suite was well equipped but needed a serious renovation! The carpet, counter tops, cabinetry, and furniture was very outdated. We loved being on the club level!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: markjchambers
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a little age on it, but it has a great location just a few blocks from the French quarter. The staff is friendly and attentive. It is a good value. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average at best”
Reviews.Author: LARPAT55
Reviews.Content: Instead of the $32/day valet charge, I had to discover myself that if I leave my car overnight at a meter on the block of the hotel after 6 pm and move it by 8 am the next day, there is no charge. At other times it is about $1.50 per hr. Also I wanted to use the computer to check a few things, but when I sat down, it stated $6.95 per 15 minutes of use. I thought this would be included in a supposed 4 star hotel's room rate. The room was OK, but since there is no door separating the bedroom from the sink and mirror in the bathroom, I woke up my wife when I shaved and washed. Maybe good for a businessman on an expense budget, but not for a vacation stay. Austere looking lobby and rooms, no elegance whatsoever. Dingy, dated hallways and thin walls so that one could hear people talking in a normal voice in the next room. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner01
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel in early October for a girls getaway with friends. There are some serious advantages to the Intercontinental versus some other hotels that are right in the center of the French Quarter. 1) Only about 3-4 blocks from all the action. Canal Street is a short walk (as is Bourbon) but its far enough away that you don't have to encounter the riff raff of late night Bourboun St. if you don't want to. 2) Affordability. Intercontinental was quite reasonably priced compared to other hotels in the area. If I recall our rate was about $133 for a 3 night stay from Thurs-Sun. Considering its locale, I think that was a great rate. 3) Great staff. Specifically the bell hop (who's name I cannot recall). He was quite informative and gave us some great recommendations for food and attractions. Overall it was a good stay. There is no free wireless internet in the guest rooms, but there is in the lobby which also has nice big comfy chairs and sofas for reading e-books and/or working.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy. Dated. Disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: Wanderwoman4
Reviews.Content: Came into town for business. Our king room wasn't ready so they put us in a double bed room. I was shocked at how grimy the place looked and felt - carpets and chairs were stained and dirty. The room, the hallways all smelt very musty a d moldy. View from our window was not a view - it looked onto another balcony, which had garbage scattered on it. The bathroom could have used a bit more scrubbing. There was some mould on the ceiling. The beds were AWFUL! Lumpy, sinking, uncomfortable. Could not get a good nights rest. The walls are paper thin - we could hear the guest next door on her phone/ getting ready. At the end of our stay we got a little surprise - a bill for parking -$32/day. Only thing this place has going for it is it's central location. That is it. I'd heard good things about Intercontinental hotels - I was expecting a lot more. Ive stayed at holiday inns that I've been more impressed with.

Reviews.Title: “Location means a lot in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Melissa W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. Nothing special, but it does have the perk of an IDEAL location. Two blocks to the beginning of Bourbon and Royal Streets in the French Quarter. Four blocks from Harrah's Casino. Six easy blocks to the riverfront area. You won't need a car because everything is accessible by foot. If you don't want to walk or are too tired, I highly recommend calling a Pedi-Cab (cart for 2 that's powered by a "driver" on a bicycle). Many work for tips only! There is a decent rooftop heated swimming pool. Our room was okay. Again, nothing special when you book the basic room. There is a tub/shower combo with a shower curtain. The television was an old Zenith boxy set, not a flat panel, but it worked just fine. Taxi's are always lined up out front so you don't have to wait for a lift to the airport which was nice. Overall a good hotel option for downtown New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “So-So Stay”
Reviews.Author: JennyB1012
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location....close to all the good spots in NOLA. The staff was very friendly. We arrived about half an hour before check-in and were surprised that there were no rooms ready for us...so we waited. And waited. And waited. Finally, I told the staff to call my cell when the room was ready because we wanted to walk around rather than sit in the hotel lobby. I found this completely unacceptable seeing that check-in is at 4 pm.....there's no excuse for not having rooms ready that late! The hotel itself is beautiful and so was the room. I was pleasantly surprised at the size of our balcony overlooking the courtyard. The room needs to be soundproofed though. We could hear the people next door talking, coughing, etc. Thankfully, we always travel with a fan to block out noises, but still....paper thin walls. Overall, we weren't very impressed with this hotel considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Try another hotel if you want real southern hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Julie1437
Reviews.Content: Attended a convention here and had a three night stay. When booking the room requested a king room with a view and upon arrival was told there were no king non-smoking rooms at the "convention rate." Opted to upgrade to a balcony room and received a "side" room with balcony overlooking the 3rd floor courtyard--an interior room with no other windows. The room was dark and as other reviewers have commented the walls paper thin. Requested to change rooms and was told there were no other rooms until the next day. The transfer the next day literally took hours. At this point, we should have received the room at the same rate...not $20 more per night. Rooms are very clean. Room service trays are left way too long in hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, so-so property”
Reviews.Author: EdYork
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 night stay at the InterContinental Hotel in New Orleans. The 6th floor room overlooking the courtyard was quiet, with dated furnishings. The bed and bedding was clean and comfortable. The bathroom, specifically the shower tile, was very clean. The room's carpet was dirty and worn and probably should be replaced. The biggest problem was with the acoustics and the sound transfer from the neighboring rooms. Fortunately, our guests on both sides were fairly considerate and noise was not unbearable. Our room had a connecting door with a neighboring room and we were able to hear every conversation even though the guests were speaking at normal conversation levels. We were sorry to hear the neighboring guest was anticipating the death of a close family member, while sad . . . not something we cared to share with someone we didn't know nor ever met. The opposite room (not adjoining, just adjacent) also provided an endless amount of unwanted information. On a positive note, our brief interactions with the front desk staff were pleasant and helpful. I would recommend this hotel for the location, not so much for the acoustics, furnishings or rather dark rooms. We travel to New Orleans about twice per year and will probably try another hotel for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good area for NO, but bad mattress!”
Reviews.Author: Veraaa
Reviews.Content: The area is great (right near Harrah's and Canal St, about 10 minute walk to Bourbon St/French Qtr), the hotel is nice, the bellstaff outside was very nice, the room was fine, decent size. However, I stayed in a room with two double beds, and they both had very bad mattresses that were sinking in the middle. It felt as if there was no box spring, because I could almost feel my midsection touching the ground. Not a good night, but I got the room for cheap on hotwire at the last minute for Halloween weekend. Avoid room 728.

Reviews.Title: “Great concept, need the staff to back it”
Reviews.Author: lilfishouttawater
Reviews.Content: If this hotel was located anywhere else, I would have little to say. However, in New Orleans there is an array of incredibly perfect hotels which make this one stand out as mediocre. The location is incredible, an easy walk to anywhere. The architecture is beautiful and the dÃ©cor classy. However, the staff in all manners that we interacted with them made the experience both rushed and unpleasant. From the curb to your room, do not expect a greeting, eye contact, or kind words. From the valet gentlemen blocking the doors to the inconvenience that you are to those checking you in, the quality of staff in no way reflects the elegance of the hotel nor the attitude of the city. We enjoyed our stay as we found the accommodations comfortable and the location ideal but would not recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to New Orleans. There are much better options in the same area and price range.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Harvey3069
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Intercontinental twice this year and both times enjoyed our stay. Located in the business district this property can seem a little cold from the outside. However, the staff is very warm and gracious and the rooms very comfortable. We all go to Nola for the party, the food, the beads whatever, but when it's time to lay my head down I like tranquility. The property is located a sort walk from Bourbon Street and Decatur Street and the Spanish pavilion is a couple of blocks away. Basically10 minutes in any direction debauchery is available. The hard core party set seems to stay away as evident by the beautiful marble floors everywhere. If you're a party professional this is the place to recharge the batteries.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TomBOak
Reviews.Content: I rarely would write a bad review unless it was truly bad, and this was that type of experience. We're new to the Intercontinental chain but certainly know of the quality based on what we've heard in Chicago and San Francisco; but this property definitely lacks any quality. Having stayed in many high end chains we found that our experience here was similar to what would find at the low end, i.e. Motel 6. Check-in was efficient and friendly, as was the Concierge service, and people at the front door. After that it all goes down hill. The room was actually dirty, and especially the carpet which not only needed a cleaning but had candle wax and unidentifiable substances on it. Pillow covers were actually thread bare. The bathroom was also not overly clean, and there's a very strange vanity that not only is uncomfortably high (if you're short it would be extremely awkward) and has many mock drawers but nowhere to store anything. Housekeeping doesn't seem too concerned about appearance as all the lamp shades were on angles when we arrived. After about the 3rd night we discontinued leaving a tip. The doors to the armoire were broken and could not close. We returned back to the room one evening around 5pm to find the room hadn't been made up from the morning yet, and while getting ready for dinner the maid came to the door only to seem annoyed when I asked her to come back in a half an hour when we'd be gone. The worst, however, was the total lack of sound and acoustic control. Literally we heard every word and conversation of our neighbors. The bed in the room next to ours squeaked so badly that any time a person turned in it you'd think it was in your own room. In a couple of instances the person actually knocked against the headboard and the wall vibrated and woke us up several times. The corridors were rather dingy, and the carpet also very dirty. This hotel is in a desperate need of a make over, and hopefully one is being planned. We were extremely disappointed and unfortunately have left us wondering whether to ever stay in an Intercontinental hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracyd1014
Reviews.Content: The hotel room itself was very nice. The view of the parking garage not so nice but you get what you get. The room we had was supposed to have been a non-smoking room. It did however, smell of cigarettes. The front desk girl was a bit snooty to us. The restaurant was nice for breakfast. We had been told our breakfast was included in the price of our room. We had booked this hotel through NCL as a pre-cruise. The staff insisted that our breakfast was not included until we produced the letter from NCL. All in all, the stay was decent. New Orleans is fun and it was really interesting walking down Bourbon Street on a Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....”
Reviews.Author: OFM77
Reviews.Content: I didn't book this but merely turned up to a booked room, handed over cash to cover transport, accomodation and a few other bits that had been booked by the best man for the batchelor party I was attending so have no idea how much I paid a night for this place but it didn't feel expensive for what I got. Hotel location is great, probably 5 min walk to the french quarter. The rooms are clean, beds comfy and the staff friendly. I used the internet in the lobby area and there was a small charge for doing so. The bar in the hotel is overpriced but I think that's par for the course with all big chain hotels. From the outside the hotel is impressive and easy to spot. Valet parking is fast and efficient. The public areas of the hotel are buzzing with people and it really is a busy place. For a batchelor party I would defo stay here again, not sure If Id stay for a romantic get away with the other half.

Reviews.Title: “I like”
Reviews.Author: pte13
Reviews.Content: I scored a deal on this hotel, so this may skew my perception a bit. I thought the hotel was a very nice place. Three blocks away from the french quarter and a walkable distance to the garden district. There was always people around to help, but we didn't hang around the hotel too much we just played in the city and came back to rest. Security was very good and helpful vallets. I will say the hotel is in the business district so it does not have the New Orleans flare, its kind of like walking away from New Orleans into a more normal (for lack of a better word) setting. It didn't bug me too much though because it's nice to be able to walk away from the craziness of the parties in the French Quarter if you want. The hotel has lovely hotel soap, really quality stuff (I usually use my own soap). If I had to pay the original price I'd think twice, but if you can score a deal this is really great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/location.... GREAT staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jen H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girls weekend, it was the first time any of us had been to New Orleans. We were so happy with our choice to stay at the Intercontinental. It was so close to the French Quarter/Bourbon but yet just far enough away to get a little bit of a break. We all felt very safe day/night walking around the area. Comfy beds, clean rooms, big bathrooms with plenty of mirrors/lighting to get ready in. We really couldn't have asked for anything more. And then we met the friendly folks at the 2nd floor bar, Astrid and Chris. Astrid pours a great drink, and Chris can tell you the best places to go, for anything. Not only will he tell you where you should go, he'll tell you the history of WHY you should go and literally drew us a map with all his recommendations. And he was spot on, every time. Our trip would have been filled with trial and error without Chris. Because of his recommendations we felt every second, every meal, we were living up to what we had hoped our vacation would be. While we probably would have stayed here again because we liked our room and the location, we absolutely will stay here again because of Chris and all the other friendly staff we met.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Staff - Bed a bit lumpy”
Reviews.Author: NewTraveler112
Reviews.Content: I spent almost one week at this conveniently located and well staffed hotel. My only complaint is that the hallway outside of my room had a strong odor of too many parties and the bed was a bit lumpy. I'd like them to not leave the lights on in the bedroom - there is a light-switch located right next to the entry door.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Area and Rate”
Reviews.Author: dolly79
Reviews.Content: Had a great girls weekend in New Orleans and got a hotel on Priceline. The rate was comperable to that of the Days Inn, but our hotel was ten times better and only three blocks away from Bourbon Street. It is super easy to get to all the action, restaurants, bars etc but also far enough away that you arent in the thick of the noise. The hotel is clean, beds are comfy, workout facility is awesome. The only thing was the view (in front of a parking lot) but we werent really there for the view anyways. Also, its right on St. Charles Street so you can take the street cable car right outside of the hotel a block away, super convinient. Really lenjoyed my stay :-)

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly but at a price”
Reviews.Author: Oklahoman71
Reviews.Content: The location was great. We used the valet parking for the four days we were there and never once needed the car. We didn't use any of the services in the hotel but were very satisfied with our room and as Ibg369 commented, the bed was extremely comfortable. We took our cat with us and were charged 150.00 non-refundable deposit. We thought that was quite funny because where we come from that is called a "fee". Anyways, the only issue with this was that the housekeeper refused to clean the room the one day because she was afraid of the cat. He is a ten year old black and white short haired domestic. Other housekeepers came to look at him and they were curious if he would know who we were or his own name. They were very pleasant but unfamiliar with house cats.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a ladies weekend!”
Reviews.Author: mkegypsy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel InterContinental is the perfect place for a ladies weekend in NOLA! The rooms are spacious, with thoughtful details like multiple mirrors, a separate sink/bathroom area, comfy robes and luxe bedding. Lounging by the pool is the perfect way to detox after a night on Bourbon. Also, the staff could not be more helpful! Astrid on the second floor bar was delightfully welcoming, and the concierge Chris, went out of his way to map out great local spots. Bourbon, Magazine and Canal are just a few blocks away, and street cars run right by every few minutes. A great value, with all the amenities of a 4 star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, A little further from Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Laurel113
Reviews.Content: We booked this room for $103 per night through Hotwire. I don't know what was going on this weekend but hotel rooms were not super abundant or super cheap like there were when I went down last year. This hotel is great, the service was great from the door men, to the bell hops, to the front desk staff. The beds are super comfy. However, keep in mind that they claim they are 2 blocks from the French Quarter and I have no idea what kind of math they use for that! Anyone can see from looking at a map that they are 4 blocks from Canal street which is the very edge of the Quarter. I didn't mind the walk and never felt unsafe but know what you are getting. You are at least 8 or 10 blocks from Bourbon Street or Jackson Square. We walked a ton and only occasionally hopped in a cab but when we did it was always less than $10 to get anywhere we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: LorenaC.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this room on a website that offered "great hotel, will reveal name when you book". What a stab in the dark - especially with three young people in tow! Got a great deal. The room was super. The hotel was lovely; always jazz music greeting us when we were heading out. The concierge was mysteriously stingy with the pamphlets which were tucked away in a little room - these should be more accessible. New Orleans is a walking city and Intercontinental is within walking of everthing: the streetcar, Harrahs, Bourbon Street, Canal Street. Never ate there - preferred to go to local restaurants. Too pricey! I would book Intercontinental again in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashley J
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was in a great location... Easy walk to Bourbon Street, Harrahs, and a Trolley stop. The concierge Joey was wonderful however that is about all the positives I can say about this hotel. The front desk staff was less than helpful and the room was a 2 star hotel for a 4 star price. Room was dingy and my view was of someone else's balcony. Overall, I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying at Grandma's Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TommyBoy94
Reviews.Content: I take exception to some of the reviews on this hotel that describe it as "threadbare". i suppose if you are expecting a more typical Euro Hotel like other Intercontinentals or the Sofitel or the Meridian, you expect a slicker look. But this hotel is old-fashioned in appearance. It is not furnished with exquisitie antiques, but looks more like something from the 1950s. The amenities are all there, though, like WiFi, good Tvs, a gym etc. The service is very good, the rooms are clean and the concierge and front desk are all very willing to help out. The value, at least for our conference rate, was excellent. The hotel is very convenient to all major attractions, with the French Quarter 4 blocks away and the Casino about 2. Now the word "threadbare" might very well be applied to New Orleans itself, especially post Katrina and post Oil Slick. Some of the old, cool places never came back or returned as shells of their former selves. The French Quarter is even dirtier than usual and the smells are not exactly pleasant unless you like the aroma of dampness, stale alcohol spilled in the street or other olfactory experiences which will go unmentioned. Still, there is no reason to kick the town while it is down. New orleans is still an extraordinary experience with massive numbers of hugely loud crowds on Bourbon Street and beyond and incredible music blaring from every hole in the wall. The street performers are even more talented than in Paris...which is saying something...and the French architecture is still awe-inspiring as is the culture, the anything-goes spirit and the great Antique and Art shops along Royal Street and elsewhere. Certain comparisons to France are inevitable, but when it comes to noise level and buzzing activity, all comparisons end. New Orleans is like Paris on Steroids. And the food is still great in so many places...best food in the USA, I think. One last word of caution. New Orleans is a dangerous city. Don't get too fat and happy and start wandering where there are no crowds, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: ajg14
Reviews.Content: I go to NOLA regularly since I live in NW Florida and it is a 2 hour drive. This trip was for a conference and I only stayed 3 days. The hotel was under construction June 19-22, 2011 and the escalator was broken, but that is the only bad thing I can say. The service was awesome- bartender in the 2nd floor bar was hilarious and personable. The room was beautiful and they didn't have a problem with me getting all new towels everyday (yeah, I'm one of those). Walking distance to a French Quarter as well as great restuarants. Inercontinenetals are always beautiful hotels and this one did not dissapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaGrits
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel and great location! Staff was very helpful and gave great suggestions to area restaurants as well as things to see and do!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: NormalJane
Reviews.Content: My two daughters and I had a 4 day "Girls Trip". Prior to arrival, the concierge helped us line up our ride from the airport and schedule our New Orleans tour. He was great! The hotel is within walking distance of everything. We walked back from the French Quarter at night (a couple of times very late) without any trouble. We had a large corner room with windows on both sides. Eveyone was really friendly and we will definately go back again.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans InterContinental”
Reviews.Author: Randy H
Reviews.Content: Attractive rooms & ok service, no wireless internet connection in rooms, wired connection in room didnt work. Parking over $35.00 per day with tax. Not what expected from InterContinental Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Very Nice Hotel in the Heart of New Orleans"”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Mi_Mi34
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. It has a very upscale feel to it for a motel price. My family and I stayed from August 17-19 for my Mom's birthday. She loved it and she kept saying how close it was to everything: shopping, restaurants (Landry's :D), infamous Bourbon Street. The rooms were well kept and the decor was very captivating. Upon check-in they made the well-stacked mini-bar prices very clear. And the refrigerator offered a key that you could use to lock/unlock it. It also offers free wi-fi in certain parts of the hotel. This was two-thumbs up for me since I'm a gadget/computer geek.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: savt
Reviews.Content: Situated in the heart of New Orleans, the Intercontinental is a great choice for both business and personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean!”
Reviews.Author: kmcm84
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. Service was friendly but slow. Rooms were very nice and beds were comfy. Only thing is I could hear my neighbor's. I had to call downstair to tell them to quiet down.

Reviews.Title: “I was surprised that it was so bad compared to other InterContiinentals”
Reviews.Author: shann d
Reviews.Content: So--I book on Priceline, arrive at my hotel at 1:00am in the morning, knowing that I will be a late check-in--I called the day of my arrival in the morning to advise them of my late check in and request a quiet room. I spoke with Alton, he was sweet and said no problem, I'll have a room on the 12th floor and to have a good trip. I get there and I am told that they do not have a room for me--the Night Manager, Nygen--tells me that I can either stay in a smoking room or a room with a sofa bed and sleep on that or I can go to another hotel. I tell him that I called ahead during the day who I spoke with and he snottily tells me that the day guy didn't have the right to do that, and too bad, because I booked through a third party I wasn't guaranteed a room. After being shocked by this, I end up at the Crowne Royal on Canal which was a pit and had a fire alarm at 4:30 in the morning. They did pay for the cab there and the return cab, however, the inconvenience and the waste of the day of unpacking (I came one day early to actually enjoy New Orleans before diving into work) was miserable. I return to the hotel around 11:00am and end up getting upgraded to a suite with a balcony, and the breakfast/drinks lounge. OK..they're trying to make it up. I'm here on business, and all I want is to be able to get some restful sleep while I'm working for a client and some work done. The food in the lounge was ok...if it weren't complimentary. The lounge is no access after 11, so if you come back in late, and you need some water, you're out of luck--after learning this, I just stocked up when I went in the morning and if I made it back for their cocktails. Staff is very nice. Upside, they have upgraded the TV's to Flatscreens. Downside they still have mechanical problems with their doors. My door lock stopped working--they had to have engineering send someone to replace the lock. Which means that my key card had to be re-done, and I misplaced my key one night. Both times, I had to come back down to get the upgrade access to the club floor added which was inconvenient and typical, because I stood there while they re-keyed my card and told them to put the upgrade on the key. So the listening skills weren't that great. Plus the upgraded room was next to a bunch of 20 something frat boys who were loud at all nights. My room was part of a suite with the door locked between the two, and you could hear everything. When they checked out, I then ended up next to families with screaming kids who run up and down the hall. They either need to soundproof the place or they need to have kid free and 20 something free floors where people who aren't there to party can actually benefit from this being a Business Hotel. As for the overbooking--that is completely unacceptable. Why are you as a business going to put out rooms on the site at Rack Rate and then tell people who book---too bad? I paid $98 a night, which was $30 more than what other people I saw were paying. Plus the inconvenience of coming in exhausted from a red-eye and being shipped off to a dump. Bed was comfortable. Maid service adequate--the first day, I saw a made and said that my room was available to be cleaned, it wasn't. Called down to guest services--got the we'll send someone right up, and that never happened. Called the next morning, they were on the spot with taking care of it, but it was too late--were already on the next day--what was the point. Room Service--not getting it. Usually they wheel the cart into your room, the guy carried the tray in, there's no place to set the tray down because the desk was covered with work. So I had to eat off the nightstand. The food was ok but not worth the overcharge. All in all, adequate--from my understanding this is what passes for a 4 star in New Orleans. Seeing as how the Crowne Royal Plaza was rated as a 3 star and was a complete pit--I worry for anyone who can't afford to stay in at least a 4 star. Weekend Concierge a bit clueless--maybe she was new, but asking here where a spa was, she didn't know or recommended ones way far away, walking around the corner, I found one that she didn't mention. When I told the spa owner about it, she said they referred people to here all the time. So I'll chalk it up to her being new. However, isn't the point of being a Concierge at a 4 star hotel is that you know everything?

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, a nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: Trvl423
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at this hotel for a mini "getaway" last weekend and thought it was terrific. We weren't in the hotel that much since we were out most of the time, but the beds were very comfortable and the pool was small but relaxing. We also had the chance to talk to one of the staff members during our stay and we found Nial to be incredibly helpful and extremely nice. He gave us great recommendations and advice about what to see during our short visit which helped us out a lot since we knew nothing about the city. Overall, we would definitely recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good New Orleans location”
Reviews.Author: kdishon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for a Saturday night in August 2011. This is a great location. Access to French Quarter is a few blocks away. Hotel is just off Poydras street, very quiet and safe. Never felt unsafe walking to French Quarter with family day or night. All staff that we encountered were friendly and professional. Room was clean and comfortable, tastefully decorated. Paid $99 for room, valet parking is $32. Might be pricey for some, but $32 is comparable to most other area hotels. Valets were a little slow at checkout (approx. 30 minutes to retrieve car) but not too surprised since there was a rush at checkout time. Would definitely consider staying here again if price is good. Close enough to walk to Quarter but far enough away to escape noise and crowds. A few blocks away from river attractions too.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy my stay”
Reviews.Author: jwong1207
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed this hotel, room was comfortable, cool and clean. Close by to everything. And if you have a car, park next door at the 24 hour self park for $20 in and out as long as there is space otherwise you have to wait for space.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad. But could be better...”
Reviews.Author: 1234lolola
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel on a weekend trip to New Orleans. The hotel was booked through Hotwire.com. The hotel is located in downtown New Orleans near the Financial District. However, it is relatively close to all the other New Orleans attractions such as the French Quarter and Bourbon Street. There is a trolley line directly outside the hotel, however you won't need it unless you plan on leaving downtown as everything is within walking distance. Parking was smooth and easy but is pricey at $32/night at the time of my stay. This is however expected as it is a business hotel in downtown. The hotel lobby could use a little sprucing up. There is a mix and match between outdated and new. The walls could use some paint and some of the furniture could be updated. There is a restaurant and bar in the lobby as well as sitting areas. I did not use these too much so I can't speak on those. The front desk personnel was great. Although, I did not interact with them to much. Great thing to point out is that they let me check in really early (6am) which was great after a long drive. The rooms where outdated. The furniture looks worn and there are spots on the sitting chairs. The carpet looked old and dirty. The tv was old and rather slow. The beds were comfortable and clean however which makes up for it for the outdated things in the room. The bathroom was clean however, like the rest of the hotel, could use updating.
