Housekeeping was fine and did their jobs. Overall the hotel is fine if you get a good rate. It does not have too many bells and whistles and is slightly outdated but if you just need a place to rest your head in a safe area of town and that is for the most part clean- you'll be alright. If you are expecting the Ritz or new furniture then this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ryder12
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the InterContinental New Orleans! The hotel looked super busy when we arrived but did not take away from our stay at all. Valet was efficient, Shadrick was very helpful upon check in, and our luggage arrived within fifteen minutes of settling into our room. This hotel is within a couple of blocks of Canal, but far enough away if you need to escape the "constant party". The room was nice and clean! The bed was super soft and comfortable! We will definitely stay here again when we take a trip to the "Big Easy"!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base for exploring the 'Big Easy'”
Reviews.Author: JKiteNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: We just spent 3 nights at the InterContinental in steamy New Orleans. I booked the hotel on Priceline at $65 per night. The concern was that this was a 'business' hotel in the downtown that would lack the flavor of the larger city. New Orleans is a city of neighborhoods and the InterContinental is a couple of blocks from the French Quarter and the Canal Street Trolley which runs down to the river. The streetcar to the Garden District stops in front of the hotel. These are the two areas of the city that most visitors would concentrate on so, in my opinion the location of the hotel is perfect. Being a few blocks away from the trafficked French Quarter is a good thing. Do not consider staying anywhere near Bourbon St unless you like living in a carnival midway. The room that we were given was spacious, clean and comfortable with a large bathroom. We never heard any noise from other rooms. At the end of each day, the room was a pleasant, if temporary, home. The TV wasn't a flat screen but who cares about TV if they are visiting New Orleans? The staff at the InterContinental was professional, helpful and friendly. I was impressed. The Concierge, Michael, gave us recommendations for some of the restaurants in the French Quarter. Our dinner at Arnauds in Bievielle St. was excellent. I felt that I got the benefit of good advice from a local rather than the standard steer toward a place that advertised with the hotel. The front desk handed me an umbrella to replace the one I had been stupid enough to leave in New Hampshire. In short, the InterContinental was exactly what I wanted for a New Orleans hotel. Perfect location, flawless service and a great place to retreat to at the end of the day. I did not use the spa, the pool or the fitness center as I was out walking around New Orleans. New Orleans Tips: Watch Treme, the HBO series before you go. Taxis from the airport are a flat rate $33 for 1 or two. This is the easiest was to get into the city. Use the streetcars/ busses to get around the city. A day pass costs $3. French Quarter Food: Arnauds and Muriels were both elegant and excellent. Both had all-inclusive dinners for $40 or less that featured excellent cuisine. Go to Cafe DeMonde on Decatur St for beignets and coffee while sitting outdoors watching the French Quarter come to life. Try the Muffeleta at the Central Grocery. One of these sandwiches will feed two people. Make it out to the Garden District to see some of the elegant old homes that grace this city. Shopping: The French Quarter has dozens of shops that seem to sell the same tourist-oriented merchandise: T-shirts, postcards, beads, more T-shirts... The Louisiana Music Company on Decatur St had a great selection of local and popular music. It was a trip back to the 70's; Listening stations, and a knowledgeable staff. If you like music, check it out. The ferry that leaves from the base of Canal St can be a brief respite from the summer heat and humidity. Also, its free. Go see Bourbon Street at night. Walk down it for 2 or three blocks and you'll get the agenda. It really is a pretty decadent incarnation of a sophomore's frat house dream. You will meet tourists there from everywhere else. Have a 'Big Beer' or 5...... Not for children or for those with sensitivity of any sort. I loved my taste of New Orleans and will be back. The city has a crumbly, almost Caribbean feel in some of its parts. Hot and humid in July? Absolutely. Learn to sweat gracefully and go out to enjoy this truly different place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blackdots
Reviews.Content: This was by far the friendliest staff. Randy (worked outside, car drop off area) was so helpful. He gave us a map and marked off the locations we should see and the places we shouldn't wander. He suggested we eat at Stanley's for breakfast and it was the best meal of the entire trip. He was so warm and welcoming from the second we arrived. We loved Randy. Jerrica at the front desk was amazing. We showed up to the hotel at 11AM thinking check in would be a major long shot but she quickly got us our room on the 10th floor. She also put a map together for us and highlighted points of interest and gave us helpful suggestions. She was so funny and nice- it was a relief to be waited on by someone as nice as her after traveling all morning. We were also not guaranteed a room with two double beds but had no problem getting the room we wanted- I'm not sure how anyone could have had a bad experience here. The rooms are great, the hotel is clean and quiet. The beds were soft and comfortable. The maids were excellent as well! One day we didn't leave our room until very late afternoon. We had assumed we missed maid service but sure enough- when we came back from lunch the room was spotless. They felt like cleaning faeries- we never saw them but they always came. Every staff member was great! We booked on Priceline and only paid $65 a night so almost anything would have been worth our money but this exceeded expectations. We were so close to everything we wanted to see and never felt as if the walk was too long- even after wandering all the way past the casino and warehouse district. You wonâ€™t regret staying at this hotel. It was a wonderful experience and I hope to stay there again! For anyone that said they had issues getting their desired room- itâ€™s your responsibility to call the hotel ahead of time to not only confirm your reservation but let them know what type of room you want. Thatâ€™s what I have always done and it has yet to fail me.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Bad View”
Reviews.Author: JacksonzMom
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via Priceline for a 3 night stay. Check in was a breeze. We arrived early and I wanted to upgrade to a balcony but none were clean so I took the room I was booked for since I was exhausted. Room was clean and was a decent size. Bathroom was decent but didn't care for the vanity area not being enclosed (only the toilet and tub/shower have a door). The hotel is a quick walk to the French Quarter and Bourbon St and the historic St. Charles Streetcar runs in front of the hotel which was cool. Other streetcars run 2 blocks up on Canal St. so getting around is pretty easy. Second night I switched to a balcony room and gave up my "view" and got a "contact high" from the older couple next door who were smoking some pretty potent marijuana! Even closing our balcony door didn't help but turning up the A/C did help. Balcony overlooks the "courtyard" but is really a view of the office bldg next door or a sliver of the actual street. Spacious balcony but window on outside very dusty. Also wanted to sit out there at night, but couldn't find the light switch. Called and was told that they were automatic. Didn't see but maybe 1 balcony light on so I guess all the bulbs were dead. Elevators run quickly so there is never a wait. Internet was about $11 for 24hrs but I managed to hop onto a free Wi-Fi connection after that so I didn't have to shell out 33 bucks to video chat with my 5yr old at home! Check out was easy. Got an extended check out for free with my Priority Club card (2 extra hrs), then had luggage stored till time for the airport. All in all it was not a bad spot and I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: sdicksteina
Reviews.Content: We were attending a wedding in NOLA and booked this hotel on Hotwire.com. Some of the reviews were mixed, but for us this place was an incredible value. Located two blocks from the French Quarter the location was excellent. The room was very large and the bed was very comfy. They did charge $32 per night for valet parking, but if you checked around for covered parking the price was not out of line. And with the hotel for $65 a night the total cost was great for a hotel this nice. The price incuded a well equipped workout room. We had wirless access in several public areas. The rooms were furnished and decorated like you would expect a classic 5 star hotel to be furnished in the 60's. It was rated 4.5 stars which was probably a bit high given the age of the hotel, but for what we paid at that location it was a great bargain. I would add that the staff there are extremely friendly and professional. They absolutely provide 5 star service!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for the right price”
Reviews.Author: WunderlustKing
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, comfortable stay. Excellent service, friendly staff. LUKE restaurant is right across the street. My only two minor complaints is that a.) It's a short building and there's no chance for a room with a view. Our room was facing a tiered parking lot. The bright lights in the parking lot were on all night, so we had to use the blackout curtains at night. Didn't matter much, since we pretty much passed out at 4AM after returning from a day of partying. b.) The hotel is located 3 blocks off Canal street, which means three extra blocks of walking from wherever you are in the Quarter. No problem in the morning, but makes a difference at night if you had too much to drink and walking is difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the big name fool you-awful service!”
Reviews.Author: txprincess72
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was rude and unhospitable. Granted we stayed on a busy Friday night, however we have stayed at IC hotels before and never had such rude staff. Louis at the front desk, Gregory a "manager" and Shedrick also a "manager" had horrible customer service. The room had some sort of construction writing on the wall (see photo), rooms were not sound proofed properly, screw fell out of the vent in the bathroom due to doors slamming all night long in hallway. Contacted both managers for a barely there apology. I will NEVER stay here again and seriously question stays at other IC hotels. No Wifi...had to pay for it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet neighborhood and convenient”
Reviews.Author: CarolDanipete
Reviews.Content: We had 3 generations and we all enjoyed our stay. The hotel was more on the European style. It was convenient to the trolly, the Convention Center and even the French Quarter. The restaurant in the hotel we wanted to eat in was closed for dinner but we went across the street to Luke's which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again, sure.”
Reviews.Author: Travelitupyo
Reviews.Content: Service is good. Pool isn't as glamorous as the photos look. Gym is nice. Would like blinds that pull over entire window. Valet peeps are sweet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SandyRed
Reviews.Content: This hotel was referred to my husband and I by my brother-in-law. It was perfect! It is a boutique hotel just 2 blocks from the Canal St., so within 5 minutes we were on Bourbon St. It was clean, well-decorated, and away from the noise of the city (but still close to the action). Staff was awesome, bar was great, and we felt special since they left us a gift for our anniversary. I am VERY PICKY about hotels and was VERY PLEASED with this one!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Central Business District”
Reviews.Author: mpeterson
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel using Hotwire and got a great deal. Pros: The hotel is only a few blocks from Bourbon Street and the French Quarter and it was really easy to walk pretty much anywhere we wanted to go. The workout room was spacious and had good equipment. Service was friendly and helpful, and they held our bags for no charge on check out day. Our room had no view to speak of but the room was large and the bathroom sinks are higher, which is great for tall people like myself and my husband. Cons: The hotel hallways smell like smoke. The Verandah restaurant breakfast buffet was really expensive ($18/person). The hotel pool is tiny and often crowded with children. Extra: They are filming a movie called "The Loft" in New Orleans, and the Intercontinental was one of the filming sites. This did not create many problems, but there were extra people in the lobby which sometimes made navigation difficult. Very interesting to see the rigs for the film though.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Llaselle
Reviews.Content: So pissed. I booked a room with double beds and they gave me a room with a King bed. Don't know how this happened. They told me they were fully booked and they could not accomidate me with a disireable room. The person who made the reservations should be fired and the hotel should accommodate me with an additional room free of charge or 1 night free for their careless mistake

Reviews.Title: “A good, clean hotel that served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: Nadia215
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a few days ago for two nights. It's in a great, central location- just blocks away from French Quarter and all the stuff you'd want to check out. Our room was clean and bright, the bed was great (slept like a baby), and the staff was very nice. We were particularly impressed with the menu at their restaurant. We were stuck indoors one night because of rain and enjoyed tasty mediterranean bites and polite service. One of the knocks would be that the breakfast was a little overpriced considering what they offered for the buffet. You're better off ordering from the menu. Another knock was that their pub, Pete's was absolutely empty except for a couple of barflies. Also, considering it's a higher end hotel brand, you expect to have wifi (even if we have to pay for it). We only had landline internet, and managed to jump on the Hilton's free wifi across the street. Kinda pathetic. Finally, if you bring a car, it's about $35 a day to valet, no other option. We walked and used taxis instead. I will say that it's lacking a bit of the luxury that you would expect from the brand. We paid considerably less because of online deals, but I don't think I would pay their normal rate. But overall, it's a great place for quick getaways, and when you think about it, you're not in New Orleans to stay in a hotel. Go out and enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Onion Rings, Early wakeup calls”
Reviews.Author: rrrobie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, clean, the staff friendly and the location was outstanding. Room service is available 24 hours and I highly recommend the onion rings. Sounds crazy, but I'm serious, we ordered them (along with some other typical room service food that was terrible) after a long night of liquid fun and they were so delicious, we ordered then again the next night. The only complaint I had was that the room next to ours was empty, but had an alarm that would go off around 6am every day. It was maddening, and we had to call every day to ask them to go turn it off. Despite the early wakeup calls, we would stay hear again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Day_tripper1234
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed in this hotel for two nights while visiting New Orleans and we we're really suprised. Upon arrival we were told our room wasnt ready despite us being 3 hours late for check-in anyway which was a disappointment. after waiting for half an hour we found out that someone on the desk had given our room away so we were upgraded to a Suite for no extra charge which was fantastic! The room itself was very spacouis with 2 bathroom, a living area and a bedroom complete with 2 flat screen tv's, sofas and chairs and all the luxuries you expect from a 4 star accomadation. The area was great! a five minute walk to the french quarter and bourbon street and it doesnt cost that much in a cab from the greyhound station. We got this hotel at a bargain price of $57 and ended up with a $500 suite so we cant complain there! the only downfall is that you have to pay $11 for a 24 hour pass to the internet which is ridicoulous! and the swimming pool on the 15th fllor was very small but other than that i would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, expensive parking.”
Reviews.Author: kylegrn1
Reviews.Content: This hotel met expectations of a intercontinental and it was very nice. I will say parking was expensive (35 a night) if you do the vallet. If you drive around to the parking structure in back it is 25. So if you know about that and you want to stay in a nice hotel with a nice bar i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent bachelorette pad!”
Reviews.Author: Redshoes56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the InterContinental with a group of nine girls for a bachelorette party. Our rooms were well worth the price paid. The hotel isn't very modern (no flat screen televisions, some of the carpets and furnishings seemed a bit dated), but unbelievable comfortable beds and linens made up for that. We slept like logs. The hotel was in a quiet area that seemed relatively safe. We walked everywhere; the hotel is four blocks from Bourbon Street and about one mile from Cafe du Monde, riverboat tour pick-up, etc. The rooftop swimming pool was pretty standard and not huge, but clean; the area gets a lot of shade from tall buildings, which I appreciate -- but if you are looking to get a lot of sun, you may not! I did have some trouble getting the internet working in the room, but the front desk sent an engineer right up; a quick phone call with tech support, and I was on. All staff were generally quite nice and helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you do not have a car to park, this is the best hotel to stay !”
Reviews.Author: mamazee48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended the Mended Hearts, Inc. national convention on June 1, 2011. We stayed at the Hotel InterContinental New Orleans and arrived one day early and left on June 7, 2011. Reservations were taken care of and our room was very comfortable, as expected. The Convention went of with great service and attention from our Convention Mgr. Megan. She went beyond her duty to please and serve us and thanks to her our convention was very succesful !! Thank you Megan, you are the best !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: retired_traveler075
Reviews.Content: Good location, but not really walking distance to convention center. Taxi ride is $6. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Check-in and out was a breeze. Room was clean & spacious. Got a free upgrade to a balcony room just for the asking. Bed was comfortable. Free wireless in the lobby area. $32 a night for valet parking. There is self parking in the area, but not sure it's worth the hassle, and it's not much cheaper. None of the rooms have much of a view due to it being downtown and surrounded by buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not what I expected from an Intercontinental Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bumrob
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice and fine, but when I think of Intercontinental, i think more upscale and luxurious. This hotel did not fit that bill. The rooms were just okay, like any other hotel room. No wireless internet and had to pay about $6.00 per 15 min to use from hotel. We did upgrade to room with balcony which was nice for the exyra $20/night. Bed was very comfortable. Parking at hotel was an additional $32/night so factor that in to cost. We parked a few blocks away at the Hilton on Gravier and it was only $17/day. Just tell them you are staying at Inter and they will give you this rate. It is not far and worth the savings. Also, check your bill carefully b/c they charged us for parking and we did not park there. It was no problem having it removed. I think the best perk of this hotel is location. It is close enough to walk to downtown and streetcar stop is just out front. Would only stay here again if priced better than other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: blondemommy05
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to New Orleans during one of the more difficult times to get a hotel room - during Tulane and Loyola graduation - plus unbeknownst to me there was an architects convention. Be that as it may, the Intercontinental had rooms available 2 months in advance and at reasonable rates, considering what was going on. My first impression of the Intercontinental was that the entry was a bit cold feeling - especially as I arrived around midnight. While I love the semi-circular driveway for easy exit of a cab with luggage, I didn't appreciate that there was no doorman in the dimly lit entrance and that it was an escalator ride up to the reception desk. The ground floor was completely dead and the sundries store was closed. To a New Yorker, that's a little off-putting. But beyond that, we stayed in a double queen room. The room was large and clean and comfortable. It was mildly disappointing that we were surrounded by rooms with balconies when we didn't have one, but that's ok, we weren't there to lounge on a balcony and there was scaffolding on our side of the hotel anyway. We ate breakfast in the morning at the lobby restaurant - ordered off the menu. It seemed the waitress was not used to that nor did she really seem to know the menu. But service was prompt, coffee and water were regularly refilled, and the food was tasty. My preferred NOLA hotel remains the Loews, but I wouldn't be disappointed if I had to stay at the Intercontinental again.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras Experience at the InterContinental 2011-”
Reviews.Author: DrLWPace
Reviews.Content: We attend the Mardi Gras celebration every year and have been traveling to New Orleans since 2000. 2011 was the first year we ever tried Intercontinental and it was a HUGE mistake! â€“In addition to the room being very ordinary, the amenities that we were seeking such as ability to easily watch parades was not as we expected considering we paid for Grandstand admission as well as all the extras that the hotel charged for. You would think with all the extra invested the event would go off just fine, this was NOT the case. The main parade we wanted to watch was Endymion and since that parade was moved to Sunday due to weather we extended another day. Then, when we arrived at the Grandstand, we learned that parade goers from the Sunday parades had already filled the Grandstands & were offered tickets to stay through Endymion. So, all of the patrons who had Endymion grandstand tickets ended up behind all of the other parade watchers. TO make it even worse, after standing behind all of the crowd, it was sadly apparent that Intercontinental Employees had their families front and center occupying at least a third of the Grandstand prime location. While we understand that the weather couldnâ€™t have been avoided, the management of the Grandstands should have been more organized. We were truly disappointed w/ the Attitude and the behavior of the employees who were representing the Intercontinental. REALLY unprofessional approach to the entire event.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, but nothing outstanding”
Reviews.Author: giftgrrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights during the JazzFest. The room was on the small side. Bed was a little too soft for our taste. Amenities very basic. Good water pressure in the shower, decent linens. We expected something more luxe from the Intercontinental brand, it was just your average hotel room. We actually had a more luxurious room at Harrah's Casino hotel of all places.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but pricey for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Ghally
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for the city and site seeing. The hotel is nice but the service at times was very poor. On several occasions I had to make a number if calls to get basic requests. If the service improves it will be a really nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal - Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: duranfreak
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on a "deal" website, otherwise I would not have considered it. Glad I did. It's a nice old hotel and I like it's character. Front desk and door staff were very nice. I could never get concierge/guest service on the room's phone... The room was very spacious and I loved the furniture. It was quiet except for the St. Charles St. car going by, but I liked that. Only real complaint is that there was no trash can in the bathroom. I had to call room service for a bottle opener. (The minibar has pop-top cans and I bought beer on the way to the hotel one night.) It took a while for it to arrive, but when it did, the opener was presented on a bread plate and doily. Too funny. The walk to the French Quarter and Marriott was shorter than I expected. VERY safe to me. I would return, and I would recommend this hotel to just about anyone. There were kids in the pool upstairs having fun, nice fitness area, and I liked my time there!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but poor for Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: milepig
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be downgraded to a Holiday Inn. The lobby area is nice enough, but the rooms seem unchanged for at least a decade. What seemed upscale then now seems dowdy. The room is only average sized at best, and it was poorly furnished. My upgraded room has a single chair that was so worn I was almost sitting on the floor, with no footstool. The desk chair should be upgraded to an office style chair. The mattress was way too soft for my tastes. Everything from the lamps, to the desk to the ambiance was ugly and old. The bathroom was one of those split affairs, with the sink area open to the main room - at an IC?!?! My safe was operational, but not screwed into the wall - anyone could have walked away with the entire thing. The ammenities were tiny and not up to IC standard. My room included a balcony which was pretty useless since it was a windswept wasteland, facing other rooms and the building next door. It was also none too clean. The balconies all face the back of the hotel and from the constant noise I'm guessing the ventilation units from both the IC and the building next door face the courtyard - not relaxing in any way. Old fashioned CRT type TV - I repeat, in an IC!!! My room had not one but two connecting doors to the rooms alongside me, and neither were insulated - I could see light from the adjoining rooms underneath, and I could clearly hear conversations from next door. I stayed here for the points - next time I'll forgo them and stay someplace that justifies the price, or stay in the HI for half the price in a similar room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: MarriedinMexico07
Reviews.Content: Got our room through Bookit.com, super deal. It was a King with a balcony! Great, quiet location in the city and walking distance to everything. The Service was top notch! The doorman were amazing and so helpful! Pool had a neat view of the buildings! Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem, perfect location to everything. amazing hotel at the right price!”
Reviews.Author: klily588
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the intercontinental for 5 nights in april 2011. the deal we got on this room through bookit.com was outstanding for the location and hotel. i would definitely not pay full price for this hotel as it is a bit older and could new some renovations. the location is amazing, it is right on st. charles street so you can pick up the street car to the garden district or walk the mere 4-5 blocks to the french quarter. we stayed almost a week and only took a cab maybe 3 times, and mostly to go to frenchman street at night. most hotels scare me because they are dirty and old and gross. while this hotel is older in decor, it is very clean. the staff were so professional and helpful, everyone says hello. we were able to check in 2 hours early without a problem. we didn't eat the hotel because hotel restaurants/room service are always overpriced. but there are so many amazing restaurants within blocks that you don't need to stay inside. the carpets and overall decor is definitely dated, it isn't updated or modern. decorated very "old southern new orleans". lots of reds and golds. but we had a room with a balcony with was our saving grace to be able to spend more time in the room. we hit up the pool on a nice day, it gets lots of sun up there. its a small pool but we didn't have a problem finding lounge chairs on a nice day. there were maybe 8 people there at once. not bad. location location location. we had so many delicious meals in Nola and many were recommended by the concierge. they directed us to local, hole in the wall places that only the locals know about. and we successfully avoided the overpriced tourist traps to eat at. and man, is the food worth it. you can walk everywhere from this hotel. french quarter, french market, cafe du monde, take the street car to the garden district. and the guys at the door will never hesitate to call you a cab. we never had to wait for anything at this hotel. everyone was prompt. walls are alittle thin, we could hear our neighbors talking. i recommend this hotel for people who want more amenities and great location without staying in a crapthole. and also without paying a million dollars a night. yes, i would have loved to stay the loews or ritz carlton. but at 26, you gotta do what you can afford without being disgusted by the hotel! its a great deal for a discounted price. do it. now! new orleans is one city you can definitely do on a budget. i think the whole trip including airfare cost us $700 for two people staying 6 days.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Not A 4-Star Hotel, Despite 4-Star Prices”
Reviews.Author: Business_TravelerFFX
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental was disappointing. The service is attentive and the housekeeping is better than average, but the hotel itself is somewhat worn and shabby. The furniture in the room had seen much better days and was beaten and scarred like that which you would find in a second-rate hotel. The plumbing was very noisy and the room door closers were adjusted so that if someone walked out of their room and let the door go it would loudly slam shut. As a consequence, flushing toilets and early departing guests ensured that you were wide awake no later than 6 AM. My biggest complaint was the Internet broadband. They charge about $10 per day for the service in the room and it is hard cable only, not wireless. If a couple both have laptops, then they have to take turns using it. If one of you is traveling with an iPad, then you cannot use it at all. To add insult to injury, the bandwidth is only slightly faster than a dial-up connection. I ran a speed test on three different sites and the fastest download speed I got was 7/10th of 1 MegaBaud, or 700 KBaud. Compare that with typical speeds of 15 MB on most cable TV or FiOS home connections. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: DaisyZ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really close to French Quarter and we checked in at 2am and the staffs were really nice and they helped us with taxi, tours, and directions. Its cheaper than other hotels because its not in French quarter but its right across the street from French quarters and probably within 10 minutes walking distance from all the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mladd2
Reviews.Content: Although I was part of a small group meeting in a large hotel, we received excellent, personalized service that made all of our group feel like VIPs. The meeting facilities were top notch, the guest rooms well appointed and the food and service was great. The hotels location made it easy to get to the New Orleans nightlife and fine restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel with a great location but lacking in a few areas.”
Reviews.Author: songoftheeclipse
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 days and overall I found my stay enjoyable. My girlfriend and I had booked a king size no smoking room but when we arrived they told us they could only provide a double as they were completely booked. The woman at the front desk was polite about this. The only odd part about this was during my stay I rarely saw other guests. The customer service from the staff was good overall. The one bed we slept on was quite comfortable but the other bed was lopsided and had a wooden board underneath. I would have been really disappointed if I had to sleep on it. We had a corner room on the 12th floor with a decent view but I would think most rooms from this hotel probably are lacking that because of the surrounding buildings. No free Wifi from the hotel but there was free pulic (slow) Wifi available from other sources. The room had a tube television. The bathroom was lacking. The shower pressure was alright but the shower head was old. It was easy for water to get on the floor while taking a shower. Both the shower and the toilet made some interesting noises. The rooms and hotel look older but I found them both to be some of the cleaner I've seen. NO received over 3.5 inches of rain in less than 8 hours the first night we stayed. That evening and early morning there was a repetitive banging and groaning noise that went on for hours. It didn't really bother me but I could see it bothering most guests. I'm not sure what it was but I'm assuming it was something from the drainage of water from the storm. That weather was extreme so I'm not sure if those noises were a rare occasion here but it didn't happen any other night we stayed. The main aspect I liked about this hotel was the relatively cheap price for it and round trip airfare I payed. I would not be happy if I payed what the rooms list for.

Reviews.Title: “friendliest, most helpful staff i've ever run across”
Reviews.Author: babycakes8
Reviews.Content: and that means a lot to many travelers especially women vacationing alone. from the doorman to room service personnel everyone was anxious to help, offer a smile, and more often than not, great you by name. both concierges offered good information on tours, restaurants , etc.; one even shared a portion of his lunch to take with me when i was in a rush. almost suspect that all employees there ( except a sourpuss receptionist and a careless bellman) had completed a stint at disney world! one negative... wi-fi is free in common areas, but the cost for in-room use is high. the double room offered soothing sleep-inducing feather(?) beds and nice linens.... if you prefer a hard mattress, mine was not. all areas were very clean, and well stocked. a running toilet as promptly repaired. the room ambiance is comfortable, a tiny bit worn, but elegant and roomy. 2 blocks from street car, and plenty of cabs waiting at your disposal. bartender, michael, concocts a delicious white russian and pours a decent wine. didn't dine in restaurant, but room service was very prompt, friendly, and attractively presented by courteous folk. enjoyed my stay tremendously, would eagerly stay again.... quite a lucky draw for a "Mystery Hotel in New Orleans!" oh, avoid the cajun encounters tour in slidell.... one encounters perhaps 3 alligators (named, so how many could they possibly have) a couple ibis, wild iris and some snakes in approx a 2-hr. boat ride. the captain was entertaining, but tour is not worth the time and cost. will, the tarot reader at jackson square, is the perfect reader for a first time readee.

Reviews.Title: “Great quiet place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Libby P
Reviews.Content: Best concierge service! Easy access to the quarter without being right in it and avoids noise. Rooms just a tad on the small side. Overall very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but hotel seemed old and shabby”
Reviews.Author: AnjanieN
Reviews.Content: The staff at the front desk is awesome, very service oriented and willing to help in any way they can. I asked for an upgrade at check in as they highlighted many upgrade options on the screen (additional $80 for a deluxe room, $100 for a suite). However, we couldn't get an upgrade because they were completely booked and no additional rooms were available. We wasted at least 20-30 minutes on the whole upgrade thing while there were no rooms to upgrade to. That was frustrating. The basic room is small. There are no kings, only queens or doubles. The bathrooms are tiny. The single sink is so high, I had to lift up my daughter every day so she could brush her teeth. I found it high for myself even! The shower head was a joke as the holes were almost completely rusted out. The shower also "screamed" the entire time it was on. I can't explain it better than that. Just a super LOUD screaming sound coming from it while on. The beds are very, very old. My bed sloped to one side and throughout the night, I was constantly rolling to the one drooping side. The pillows are old and not comfortable. The linens on our bed were ripped and simply tucked in to hide it. The furniture seemed fine. The televisions were the old tube models and the picture was grainy and fuzzy. They use satellite tv, so one night when it rained, we were stuck inside the room but had no television. The view from our room was onto a parking lot. The rooms were the worst I've ever stayed in from a 4 star hotel (or even a 3 star or 2 star). We ate at the breakfast buffet one morning (our last), and were super disappointed. There was very little offered, and the hot items were cold and stale. It was not good, and the final insult came when we got the bill...$60 for two women and one four year old child (we had coffee, scrambled eggs, fruit and some grits). We complained, but no one did anything. We had one other meal at the hotel restaurant, and it was just ok. Very $$$. Avoid it if you can. Try Luke's Brasserie directly across the street. Room service is very expensive, as expected. Don't do it unless you have to. A VERY SIMPLE breakfast for 2 was $60. We didn't have a car, so cannot comment on the parking. We got a good deal through priceline, so I can't say I felt ripped off, but if I had paid their regular rates, I would have been pissed.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and elegant!”
Reviews.Author: Heather F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to New Orleans because I had a one day conference. The rest of the week was a pleasure trip. We were overall very pleased with the Intercontinental. We were allowed to check in early, as our flight put is there by 12:30. The front desk staff could not have been nicer. Our room was clean and spacious. The balcony was nice but looked out into a parking garage with only a sliver view of the city. The bed was comfortable but sloped down on one side like the mattress needed to be replaced or flipped. Everything was clean. I was surprised at how quiet the hotel was even though I think it was almost full. Breakfast was delicious the day I ordered off the menu. One day I had the buffet and was disappointed. It was cold and very standard fare, nothing special. We loved the pool area and the fitness room. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Teklanika
Reviews.Content: Well after reading about valet problems we decided to self park. Guess what no self parking in the garage (contracts only) After cirlcleing the block several times and consulting GPS unit, we located an EZ Park about a block away. So the rooms are large, but the bed and pillows fairly uncomfortalbe. The noise from the streetcar below sounds like a jet taking off every few minutes. Our neighboors came home late and we awoke to the drunken argument going on in the middle of the night because of the connecting door not keeping the sound out. If you get a discount rate I would stay, but not paying full price.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and very nice!”
Reviews.Author: DRB060607
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through hotwire for only 99.00 a night! It was a bargain for this 4 star hotel. Our room was very nice and clean. The beds were comfortable. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. It was a great location within walking distance of everything we wanted to do in New Orleans. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking service destroyed rental car!!”
Reviews.Author: mdditt2000
Reviews.Content: Don't use the valet parking service at the InterContinental Hotel New Orleans. I did not stay at this hotel however the valet staff destroyed my colleague's rental car which impacted my trip. My colleague handed the keys over to the valet staff late in the evening after returning from work add day. When he picked up the car in the morning the front wheel had been destroyed. The valet staff changed the tire which took 45 minutes. We believe they didn't just change the tire. Every time you turned left we heard grinding metal coming from the wheel. The water light on the dashboard also came on. We could not replace the vehicle since hertz did not have any available vehicle. However the valet manager did get a replacement vehicle from Enterprise rent a car the day after. The valet staff also admitted to damaging the car. The vehicle had to be cleaned since the valet driver vomited all over the driver seat. Disgusting!! We also noticed the gas was half empty. Basically the valet staff took the car on a joy ride and was drunk. It was a nightmare for my colleague taking care of the paper work and situation. Basically don't use the valet parking at the InterContinental Hotel New Orleans. The hotel manager did not care!! No compensation or even an apology from the hotel. The hotel manager just pointed the blame to the valet company which is run by another company. The valet manager was very apologetic. My colleague will never stay at another InterContinental Hotel. Neither will I after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Valet damaged my car.”
Reviews.Author: Jkdgo
Reviews.Content: This is really a nice hotel but don't stay herenif you are from out of town. The valet service damaged my vehicle and painted over it! Worse, hotel management deferred to the valet management to address the issue. The hotel is nice and the location is good but in the event of a problem I would rather be at a better managed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Safe great place to stay, close to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: janellew29
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on a Friday before a Mardi Gras parade, so needless to say it was their busy season. Check-in was easy and our family was able to get two rooms right next to one another, with easy room to room door access. The concierge was helpful and friendly. We had to call the front desk a couple times for extra pillows, towles, etc. and each time they arrived within minutes. The rooms were an ok size, but who is spending time in their room while visiting New Orleans. The hotel was clean and quiet. You can occasionally hear the street cars pass, but never load enough to keep you awake. It is about a 5 minute walk to the French Quarter, just far enough for the hotel to be quiet, but close enough that you feel the "energy" of the French Quarter. I would suggest staying here for your visit to New Orelans.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel in new orleans”
Reviews.Author: bridget138
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, the beds were not very comfortable and the walls were thin. You could hear people talking in the next room. Staff was nice, but not really worth what I paid for this room. The rooms were small. They had a nice courtyard you could go out on which was pretty cool. This hotel was not bad but not great either.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ryan H
Reviews.Content: When I walked in I was loving it . It looked pretty nice and the people working here were friendly even made friends with the guy who gets you a taxi when you need it. By the French Quarter but not to close. My room was pretty clean and nice can't really complain except for the fact that it smelled like weed but you can't blame the hotel for that just blame the idiot smoking it, I mean I could tell it was a room that had the smell far away but it was pretty strong. The gym was nice not crowded and the pool which is on the roof is OK, the place for it was a good idea but the pool was a little dirty but I have seen much worse. The rest of the hotel was pretty clean seemed really nice. I would defiantly want to come back to this hotel when visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Crazy4Beach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a girls weekend. Value was great as I was able to use my companies rate with them. Rooms were reasonably sized and the location was perfect. Only a few blocks to the French Qtr, but also not right in the middle of it so you could get away from the noise when it was time to sleep. My complaints are minor. I'd requested 2 adjoining rooms so that we could all be 'connected' but didn't' get them. I know it' not a guarantee, but would have been nice if since they couldn't do that they at least put us on the same floor... Only other thing was that the rooms we got (both in the x07 series) had a terrible 'view'. The windows were at an angle and looked out directly onto the balcony of the room next door. Sort of odd, and also because of the weird angle of the window, didn't get any sunlight in, making for a dark room. All in all, though I would stay again. Staff was friendly enough, concierge very helpful, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location, but was a bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Nusiax
Reviews.Content: I spent three days in New Orleans at the IC. The staff on check in was great and friendly. I was upgraded to a Parlor Suite according to my Royal Ambassador Status. However, the maid service was spotty and slow. My room was not made up one day. And never got my turn down service. The room was spacious and wonderful on the corner of the building. But it could get load from the slamming doors of the 2 rooms in my area. The club lounge was disappointing. There was no major service, only a few soda and chips on the sideboard. The internet was very disappointing. I have had faster dialup connections. And finally, I had many issues with my keys and room locks, the card key would work one moment and not work the next. But would stop working again. Was very frustrating. But overall the hotel is good, just needs work out a few issues.

Reviews.Title: “Not upto the Intercontinental standard”
Reviews.Author: Odilon
Reviews.Content: Quite a disappointing stay, the place was understaffed (bar, restaurant,...) and room was worn out (I had a room with balcony), had a connecting room with as a result much noise from my neighour, the breakfast was very poor, the lunch buffet was not even as good as an airline economy class meal, ... I've stayed in other Intercontinental hotels which are much better. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like gold”
Reviews.Author: JRandTR
Reviews.Content: It was an awesome experience !!! From the moment we arrived at the front doors we felt very welcomed and had a great greeting from the Doorman. The check-in was smooth and we even got checked in early which was nice. The front desk staff were very friendly, hospitable and welcoming to their city and hotel. We stayed in a king deluxe room on the club lounge floor and the room was spotless and spacious. We loved the private lounge providing us with great service in the mornings and the evenings. The staff in the lounge were awesome and gave us some great places to eat !!! The hotel is in a great location downtown. It is only a couple blocks away from the French Quarter and Canal Street, but yet far enough were you can get a break from everything and relax in your room with peace and quiet. We enjoyed every minute in City of New Orleans and at the Intercontinental New Orleans !!! Enjoy your stay !

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back..a true hidden gem!"”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl201170
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we knew our stay was going to be wonderful. The valet driver was friendly and welcoming..our check in was seamless and pleasant. The staff really cared about our needs and made us feel very welcome. Our room was so beautiful and the beds so comfortable. The staff helped us plan our day tours and made great recommendations. They have a great lounge on the lobby level, perfect for cocktails before dinner. From one traveller to another, I would HIGHLY recommend staying at the InterContinental New Orelans if you are planning a trip there. The hotel has perfected the art of hospitality is only minutes from the French Quarter and many other great historical sights..... we can't wait to go back again !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: JulieAp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for a long weekend. It was clean and updated with good service. It hotel was walking distance from the French Quarter and around the corner from the St. Charles Streetcar.

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice hotel, but a bit pricey.”
Reviews.Author: jenncatty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for three nights while on another business trip. The staff were very friendly and efficient, the doormen were helpful and always were willing to quickly call a cab while I waited inside in the warmth. My only real complaint was when I arrived on Sunday and didn't really have much of a choice for lunch. Their eating choices are limited and Sunday apparently is a "down" day for eating there. I did get room service and the food was very good, but a bit expensive compared to other places I've been. The room was clean, the bed was firm but not too hard, only thing missing was free Internet. I paid $24.95 for 3 days of Internet access. I would stay here again if I was in the area again, I got a good price via Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was fabulous fromthe minute I steped out of the car until I checked out".”
Reviews.Author: mrossholmes
Reviews.Content: The gentleman that checked me in was friendly and efficient. The doormen were all very gracious and successfully retrieved cabs for us. The only negative was the cab drivers that were not familiar with the Uptown area. I realize that is no fault of the hotel. I left my makeup case in my room and when I called the lovely and efficient Leshia was able to verify the makeup case was found and had it sent to me. She was fantatistc! Thank you to the housekeeper that gave the makeup case to Lost and Found. All in all a wonderful stay and great way to start off the New Year. Sorry about the Saints loss but I'm a Buccaneers fan!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely attentive staff and quick to anticipate our needs”
Reviews.Author: Julie29196
Reviews.Content: I seemed to have more interaction with the staff than I am accustomed to. The housekeeping staff was friendly and easy to have conversation with. Great location...easy to walk to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: island_gyal78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on the executive club level located on the top guestroom floor. This was a key access floor for great privacy. We also had access to the club lounge. The club lounge served a light breakfast in the morning, snacks throughout the day and appetizers and drinks in the early evening. "Happy Hour." Free morning newspaper delivered to the room, separate check-in area, turndown service, continental breakfast was complimentary. Max who worked in the club lounge was very nice and showed special attention to us by having our favorite snacks available for us to go if we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Clan and Comfortable Rooms. Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: poppypanterling
Reviews.Content: The staff was great, friendly. The rooms were clean. The beds had a great down comforter and down pillow. No nasty bedspread. I would recommend this hotel to someone traveling to New Orleans. It is four short blocks to the French Quarter which was nice to be away from the noise and the craziness of the Quarter. A couple of downsides,there is no place to grab a quick cup of coffee or quick breakfast other than room service in the morning and there is no free WiFi other than the first 3 floors . The room did have a coffee pot to make coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Papa Noel, we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: mightyt
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to NOLA during the Christmas season. Amazing!! The hotel was beautiful. We recieved a free upgrade upon check-in to a room with a balcony. The staff was genuine and strived to make our stay unforgettable. Our room was huge. The bed was more comfortable than ours is at home! Room service was pricey ($52.00 for lasagna, a burger and bread pudding) But isnt all roomservice? There was an in room fridge to hold the minibar items which left just enough room for us to keep our own drinks cold. However it was not big enough to store leftovers, so dont take it back to the hotel. The streetcar picked up steps from the front door and there were always taxis waiting. The location was perfect for us. Blocks from the Quarter and casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...but the trolley noise I could live without!”
Reviews.Author: grayfish4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful! The hotel room was nice--nothing spectacular, but nice. My husband and I were celebrating our 15 year anniversary and stayed 2 nights. It is very close to everything...walking distance which was wonderful. However, the sounds of a garbage-like truck rumbled throughout the wee hours of the morning. I looked outside and realized it was the Trolley going back and forth...it was horrible! It woke me up bright and early every morning! Our hotel room was facing the street so it was very loud. Not a peaceful sleep. Overall, it was a nice stay and we enjoyed it despite those little mishaps. I would stay there again, but request NOT to be near the street facing the trolley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BigCheeseOxford
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although advertised to be in the â€œbusiness districtâ€�, is perfectly placed for all the usual tourist stuff. It is a short (5 min?) walk across Canal Street and you are there! The benefit was that the price you can get it for is much lower than the French Quarter and also it is much quieter than the French Quarter. We had a room-only basis so we got breakfast out most days - including the famous (and yummy) Beignets and coffee at the Cafe du Monde â€“ great value and very tasty. Can also recommend â€œLukeâ€� the restaurant just opposite the hotel, super food and huge portions. There was a good coffee machine and supplies in the room. Free wi-fi in the lobby and some other public areas, but we decided to get the paid for â€˜in roomâ€™ internet which was $21 for 3 days. Overall a very nice hotel in a really great location. Recommended trips/activities are the New Orleans School of Cooking, the Grey Line â€œLaura â€“ a Creole plantationâ€� and â€œKatrina/ City Tourâ€� plus self-guided walking tours around the French Quarter and the cemeteries (go on the tram up there). We were very happy with the hotel since we got a really great price (through Priceline) so our judgement is based on the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras Ball”
Reviews.Author: brensin
Reviews.Content: We are having our Mardi Gras ball this year at the Intercontental Hotel for reasons too numerous to begin to mention here but let me try. #1...Customer Service. What we asked for was what we got. We were served the best food we have ever eaten, large portions, cooked as promised, the presentation was wonderful and that was for almost 500 people. The wait staff bent over backwards to help us and went above and beyond the call of duty. I look forward to the ball this year and know the staff at the hotel will make it an event to remember..just like they have for every year we have had the ball there.

Reviews.Title: “Royalty”
Reviews.Author: Fleurdemimi
Reviews.Content: My room was perfect and the staff treated me like a Princess! Great Location! Great Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Trep586
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Intercontinental for a long Thanksgiving weekend. We got a great deal on Hotwire and couldn't pass it up. As others have said, you had paid a typical downtown business hotel rate, you might be dissappointed but for what we paid it was a great deal. We arrived very early at about 11am and were greeted by a very nice bellman. The front desk was efficient and they had a room available for us (we didn't expect they would). In fact, we were offered an upgrade by buying into their "Ambassador's Club". This turned out to a be a GREAT deal as we were given a balcony room and had use of the club level that included daily hot and cold breakfast and nightly happy hour with unlimited "pour 'em yourself" top shelf drinks, beer and wine as well as really quite good food including sushi, pasta salads, mini egg rolls, etc. Well worth the money and the club also includes late check out which was great as we had a 5:30PM flight. The room was nice enough and while it is true the hotel is showing its age, it is in now way "dumpy" or uncomfortable. It is still an upscale hotel that is nearing the point of needing a renovation that you happen to be able to get for a steal. We had nothing but good service from everyone in the hotel and the only real we had was that the walls are PAPER THIN! Our neighbors must've been on their honeymoon because...ahem...they made a LOT of FREQUENT noise! If I could get a similar rate, I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very upscale hotel with great service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: derbdo
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had the opportunity to stay here for 1 night on our trip to New Orleans. It is very upscale and lavish as you enter. The staff were incredibly helpful. We arrived a little earlier to the hotel and our room wasn't ready, so they stored our bags and called my cell phone once our room was ready. The bell hop brought our bags up and we had a great conversation with her, very friendly. The rooms are very clean and spacious. Comfortable bed with a mini-bar and a great view of the French Quarter (we were on the 12th floor facing the quarter). The hotel is located about 5 minutes away from the French Quarter and in a VERY safe and well populated area. You will not be disappointed with your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not a top tier Intercon”
Reviews.Author: chilly_h2o
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just ok. Nothing special compared to other hotels in NOLA, but then again, not really below the typical NOLA 3.5-4 star property. Rooms are ok, clean, decent size, decent furnishing, but outdate TV and no wireless and NO complimentary internet access for Platinum members? As a PC Platinum, I was given an â€œupgradeâ€�, but come to find out this did not include an upgrade to Club Floor?! No, Club Floor is $20 more, even for highest tier member! I did go for Club floor and it was a complete joke. Food was terrible, service was non-existent. Not worth the money, not even close. Bathrooms were nice and decent size with good amenities. Pool(small) and exercise facility are pretty good. Lobby, check-in non-descript. Location is good for CDB and French quarter with easy access to St. Charles street car, Canal St. and Poydras. Bottom line: a business-oriented hotel with a good location. Not a particularly high value for what you get and certainly not overly service-oriented. If you are used to top-level Intercon properties, you will be disappointed. If you are used to the sub-standard Intercons, found mainly in the U.S., you know what to expect. The hotel is acceptable, but certainly does nothing whatsoever to distinguish itself from the 10â€™s of other similar properties in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly & unaccomodating staff and Management.”
Reviews.Author: Garyorlando
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were not greeted or asked if we needed assistance. They bell staff watched as we fumbled with our belongings waiting for assistance. When we realized we weren't getting any help we all grabbed what we could and headed up the escalator. The concierge who greeted us when we got off the escalator asked do we need any more help and we said jokingly not now, she said oh I don't like to help either. After getting up to the room we noticed that the TV didn't work, there was no cold water and the AC didn't work. When I called down to ask for the manager on duty they didn't want to transfer me. After doing so reluctantly, the mod Gregory was much help and acted like he didn't care. Just very poor and unaccomodating people.

Reviews.Title: “Solid and Comfortable with a Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: TravelerPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We lucked into this hotel through Priceline, and got an excellent price. We requested a king bed, but they only had 2 doubles when we arrived. The next day, we left our luggage at the front desk, and while we were out sightseeing they changed our room to a king and moved our luggage into the new room for us. Very nice! Even the car valets are extremely friendly and talkative, and love to give you ideas for things to do in the area. Everyone is eager to show off their town. The rooms were very clean, and very comfortable, decorated in a dark, old-fashioned style. This is not the W, but it's only a few blocks from the Quarter or from the Warehouse district, and it's very inexpensive, so I would definitely stay here again. The hotel has a nice Fitness Center with a small outdoor, heated pool. It's very clean, with towels, yoga mats, water cooler. Machines seemed well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Intercontinental, need a tad updating.”
Reviews.Author: AllSunnyDays514
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze, very nice staff. Young guy working at the valet was very accomodating and understanding because I was back and forth from uptown. This is a nice location in CBD off St Charles and close to the french quarter without dealing with the tourists. The room smelled a little musty but nothing too noticeable, it was clean and the shower was very nice...along with the wonderful bath amenities!! The bed is ridiculous, I wish I could take that to go! I was very happy to be staying here. Parking sucks at $35 a night, but if you want your car quickly then go with the valet. Otherwise there are tons of early bird parking specials around the block....money to be spent on food. I actually had the best Turkey club sandwich downstairs at their Bistro, quick service. I missed out on the street car sweet shop, looked like a must too! Overall a wonderful experience, definitely an Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but better value across the street at Hilton”
Reviews.Author: KCtravelr
Reviews.Content: I came to New Orleans for business and then stayed the weekend. I had to move from the hotel across the street to the InterContinental. InterContinental's rooms could use either a good cleaning and/or some updating. Staff was what should be expected but nothing special. In fact, when we asked how to catch the St .Charles Street Car since there was work underway on the line and it was not picking up riders at the stop by the hotel, we were given poor instructions. It shouldn't have been hard since it was at teh street intersection basically right behind the hotel. Location, though is excellent since it is so close to many things--walking distance or a short ride. I wouldn't stay at the InterContinental again unless the price came down.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be sorry”
Reviews.Author: Copiaque
Reviews.Content: I spent a week with a family member touring the city, 1st time visitors. Hotel was wonderful, no fancy lobby, but tasteful, great room- good size, clean, quiet, great value. Staff was wonderful, exceptional service, they went out of their way to be helpful. The little extra touches by staff was greatly appreciated. Sunday Jazz brunch was really enjoyable. Nice Pub on premises for light food and cocktails. We felt the hotel was in a good location convenient to almost everything, a few blocks walk to the river and casino, right on the streetcar line. Close to shopping and the french quarter. Cons were minor, when cleaning the room housekeeping did not replace the towels they removed. A telephone call quickly remedied the situation. They have a per hour internet charge to use their connection. Robes were provided in the room. Room service was quick and efficient. There is a lovely outdoor garden off the fifth floor, nice roof top pool and exercise room. We have no regrets and would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, but not if you want something UPSCALE AND RITZY”
Reviews.Author: absalom2
Reviews.Content: I genuinely enjoyed my stay here. From the minute I arrived, the valet was friendly and welcoming. I didnt like the fact that parking was $32 a day, but it seems typical. Keep in mind that this price DOES NOT include TAXES!!! When you go up the escalator to the lobby, it is clean and elegant. The front desk is nice. There is NO WIFI in the rooms, which was disappointing bc you can find that service in 2-3 star hotels. If you want internet you can pay for dial up, or you go down to the lobby area to use the free wifi there. A little bit inconvenient, but it might not be a huge big deal to you. The walls are thin, and there is a gap under every room door, so light does come into the room and there are lots of noise complaints. However, when a couple was violent a few rooms down from me, the security came within one minute. They restaurants werent great, but the staff is SUPER friendly. The pool on the fifteenth floor is small, and there was NO hottub, which was a bit disappointing. The fitness room is old, but workable. Great location, easy to get to anything yet far away from the dingy parts of town. The beds were a bit lumpy and too soft for my liking, but clean.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Infamous28
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Wonderful location..close enough to walk everywhere (bring comfortable shoes) but far enough from the loud noise on Bouborn St. Club privledges are great, good breakfast, dinner is more like a snack. Only one robe and one pair of slippers in room. Balcony room is nice but not great, No real scenary.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs or Fleas, not sure which!”
Reviews.Author: smokn
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Hotel Intercontinental. I arived on Sunday and Monday night noticed red marks all over my legs. I woke up itching several times during my stay. When I got back home a friendm who is a doctor told me they were either bed bugs or fleas, Other than that, the hotel had a great gym. I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: princenylc
Reviews.Content: excellent service and great food. even thought we were so many, they offered us a very good service...nice and quite place

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the price and location”
Reviews.Author: Rinkermama
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a decent choice for the price and location in the Big Easy. Nice looking hotel, close to Bourbon Street, the French Quarter, the River Walk, and Stadium. The rooms were comfortable and clean. Only down side was the front desk staff in the evenings and concierge were not friendly or very helpful. Also, our room had a broken TV, and my bed was tilted and broken. That said, the maintenance staff fixed the TV for us very quickly. The room service food was outstanding. All and all, it was quite a bit cheaper than the major hotels in the area, and was decent. Not a bad choice...but certainly not luxury!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel which is very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: vpk18
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and you get what you pay for. The hotel is very centrally located, which is great. It is a short walk from the Bourbon Street area, which meant that we could enjoy the Bourbon Street atmosphere when we wanted to, but could go also escape when we wanted to. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The only downside was that the hotel was unwilling to give us a fold away bed (as we had three guests in the room) and they were a little confused as to why we would want one!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; not great value”
Reviews.Author: countryskipper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference and overall enjoyed my stay there. However, I would never stay there for a private stay... It's pretty expensive and everything costs extra (e.g., breakfast, internet, small water in the room, etc.). The restaurant in the hotel is really not good - but with that many restaurants in the neighborhood that wasn't a problem. I love the location - you are in the French Quarter in a few blocks. While I was there, there was street work right in front of the hotel at night. I understand that the hotel has no influence on that, but I would have appreciated a heads up on the website or via email. I might have stayed somewhere else had I known that the city was working on the street 10pm through 6am. Not very relaxing! And the St. Charles streetcar was much harden to reach because of the construction. Disappointing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: TeamMcMillan
Reviews.Content: Having stayed for 8 nights in this hotel, we have very few causes for complaint. The room was contemporary, spacious, clean and comfortable, with good airconditioning, an essential in New Orleans. Bathroom was clean and reasonable though shower could have been better. Easy walking distance to French Quarter. Would happily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our needs”
Reviews.Author: Tinseltine_com
Reviews.Content: Both our accommodations and my friend's wedding/reception took place at the InterContinental Hotel 444 St. Charles Ave. The banquet coordinator was very available, extremely efficient and had a knack for dealing with a weepy, frightened flower girl. The archway and solarium of the restaurant made for a good backdrop for the ceremony. The timing on the butlered horsdoevres didn't quite work out as they stopped serving them too soon to rush into serving dinner. However, both the beef & chicken choices for this sit down dinner were very tasty. In regards to the hotel the service and amenities (particularly the lotion) were stellar. If you're going to New Orleans and you're looking for a good hotel, not 4 star top of the line or cute boutique, but clean rooms, attentive staff, nice touch of elegance throughout, easy walking distance to the French Quarter, Bourbon Street and Harrah's Casino, then I'd suggest the InterContinental And I highly suggest joining the InterContinental Club!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay and great location the CBD”
Reviews.Author: poodleone
Reviews.Content: Our main reason for staying here was the Sunday Jazz brunch. We had gone about 10 years ago, loved it and planned to try it again. Got a good rate for two nights- $89/$109 for Saturday/Sunday. My mistake when booking on line was choosing two queens instead of king. The desk clerk looked for a king at check in- none available- but she was very helpful and friendly. Both the valet and front desk staff were professional and welcoming. The room was OK but no view and the beds needed new matresses. But the bathroom was great- I like the sink/vanity in its own area and the tub/shower was very good. Plenty of towels, nice amenities. We swam in the pool Sunday night- nothing spectacular but relaxing and quiet. Very nice work out facilities (not that I used them!). The location was quite good- a very short walk over to the FQ. This stay came at the end of a week long trip so we weren't energized anough for much night life but enjoyed shopping, eating and drinking all around. The Sunday Jazz brunch in the Veranda restaurant was less elaborate than before but still very good and well worth the price ($42.50). Bottomless champagne/mimosas and Blood Mary bar. Wonderful selection of seafood dishes, fish, fruits, salads, desserts plus servers making waffles, eggs and cutting prime rib. Loved the gumbo. Staff was very efficient and attentive. The jazz quartet was very entertaining without being too loud. Checkout was smooth. It did take about 20 minutes to get the car although we called ahead but it was Monday morning. We enjoyed chatting with the bellman while waiting. Our stay at the Intercontinental was a great ending to a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Food/Sleep and Location”
Reviews.Author: jasmae
Reviews.Content: Since I was going to the Viking/ New Orlean Saints game we wanted to choose a hotel that was close to the Super Dome and The French Quarters. I arrived Wednesday night and order room service. The gumbo was so delicious! The next morning I order shrimp and grits for lunch and was pleasantly surprised. I slept like a baby all through the night due to the pillow top mattresses. The staff and concierge were very helpful and were able to to book me a last minute reservation to Stella's. The only complain is that the escalator didn't work. Other than that I look forward to visiting New Orleans and staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lelea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a central location between Bourbon Street and the riverfront. The room was fabulous and the service was outstanding. The people behind the desk actually remembered us and always asked us about our day. The restaurant and bars were great as well. Staff, again, was friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not at full price. . .”
Reviews.Author: TravelBeard
Reviews.Content: This is not an awful hotel. It is, however, a disappointing one--and at full price, a terrible value. Also, it seems that either the management or the ownership of the hotel is asleep at the switch at times. A number of New Orleans hotels date from the late 70s, or early 80s, and this one opened in 1984 in time for World's Fair. Unfortunately, this hotel looks every bit of its 26 years at times, in decor, in upkeep, or both. While other hotels date from the same period, you'd be hard pressed to find a hotel as charmless, inside and out, as the InterCon in New Orleans. In a city of great character, this is a structure that looks all the world like a 15 story office building. That sense doesn't go away once inside the front door, either. A bank of escalators rises to a rather non-descript second floor. And the weekend I stayed here, one or both of the escalators was broken. The rooms are average sized (though for New Orleans, above average) though the position of the building and its lack of height deny guests much of a view. Great beds are the highpoint of the room. The room's carpet was particularly dated--both in pattern and age. Nearly didn't want to walk on it with bare feet. As befits an InterContinental, there are some nice details--bathrobes, phone in the bath, bathroom scale, a nice coffee making machine (the single cup sanitary kind--thanks). The TV is about 15 years old and is encased in a huge armoire. The marble bath is large, but a wall between the vanity and the water closet/bath bifurcates the space awkwardly. Curved shower rods would have been a nice addition. The shower didn't work well--once I notified the front desk, was fixed quickly and well. Bathroom amenities are tough to open--particularly with wet hands. There is mouthwash available, but you have to ask for it. . .how about placing it in the rooms? WiFi is free on the first three floors, but no one bothered to tell me that at check-in, and the wire-required internet in the rooms costs $5-10 a day, depending on how long you purchase it. (Note to hotel--just do it free throughout the hotel. Feels cheap and nickel/diming to do otherwise). There is a fitness center and pool on the 15th floor. Fitness center was fine, clean, and bright, though the clock there was broken throughout my stay. The pool is small, and the outdoor pool deck smaller. Location is not bad--on St. Charles Avenue on the streetcar line to the Garden District and Uptown, four blocks from the French Quarter in one direction and four blocks from the Casino in the other. I paid $61 a night on Priceline. As such, the hotel was not a bad value. However, this hotel clearly would like to get more per night for its rooms. . .And at full price, I couldn't recommend this hotel. Would have to think that hotels like the JW Marriott, Loews, Hilton St. Charles, W are meant to be most direct competitors. Nearly all are nicer, more charming, reflecting of more local flavor. If you have to pay full price here, ensure they have renovated first. To my knowledge, no renovation has been planned.

Reviews.Title: “Lap of Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: GeauxSouthernBelle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely love this hotel. Our family is living on a budget and we booked a room at the InterContinental due to a good room rate that we found on www.neworleanscvb.com. We were pleasantly surprised by the regal infastructure of the hotel and absolutely adored the location. The staff was very friendly and the desk and offered to upgrade our room for a minimal fee. The upgrade was wonderful. We had a huge room with a California King sized bed. We also had a private balcony. Our room was well furnished and the amenities were fresh and new. We had lots of space and the linens were soft and comfortable. The parking situation is tricky if you choose not to valet, however, my husband and I found free street parking. We plan to stay at the InterContinental again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SRod17
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a work trip. Good location, near French Quarter but not too close. The food at the hotel was okay, but nothing spectacular. Try the place across the street, it was amazing! I forgot the name! Only complaint was the pool, it was kinda small and a lot of shade because of the way its set up and the trolley passes by in front of the hotel. I don't know if it was all of the rooms, but I could definitely hear the trolley everytime it passed by.

Reviews.Title: “PROS: Great location. Right on the street...”
Reviews.Author: linensandbooks
Reviews.Content: PROS: Great location. Right on the street car line, that will take you all up and down St. Charles. 1 block from Poydras, about 3 from Canal St... In other words, walking distance to pretty much everything. Rooms are very clean. Many have large balconies, which seems to be a favorite for smokers (found a few buds). Hotel accomodated my early check in easily. CONS: It is a very large hotel, many rooms, which means that upkeep and maintance is difficult and it SHOWS. Example: you will see wallpaper started to peel in many areas, in both the rooms and common areas. Carpet has stains in the hallways.parts of the walls look patched and warped.
