The second room I was in the shower head was loose, I has to tighten it back to the wall. Old bulky tvs in room. FYI. This visit I stayed in two rooms. The first room I was on the 7th floor which has some smoking rooms. My room was non smoking, but still smelled of smoke. Staff readily relocated me to another floor. Valet is about $32/night. Typical for a hotel in the area. For the money, you can stay at another hotel, and hope they maintain the upkeep of the hotel. This hotel is being neglected. One more thing, in the shower, in the second room there is a vent on the ceiling in the shower... It's caked with dust.

Reviews.Title: “Supreme comfort in the big easy”
Reviews.Author: Chozz
Reviews.Content: By no means is this a 5 star hotel but since we got a great deal through hotwire as a mystery stay, it was excellent value. Our king room had an old world style and was very comfortable and spacious. Good in room facilities and sleep enducing beds. Staff were helpful and friendly, although the bar staff were a bit hit and miss, a shout of 'last orders' would help before closing. The location is just about right. Situated on St Charles avenue, its a simple walk through canal street leading onto Royal st. This runs parallel to Bourbon st, and once you're in that neighbourhood you can't go wrong. The swimming pool and gym up on the 15th floor are a little disappointing and quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: heathermark28
Reviews.Content: After arriving on a Sunday night to another hotel near Bourbon Street and being thoroughly dissappointed, we checked in to the hotel Intercontinental on Tuesday morning. Much to our suprise we walked in to a clean, and beautiful hotel. We were pleasantly suprised to see that our room was plenty big enough for a couple and two children and that it would definitely meet our needs. I can't say enough how glad we were to switch hotels and how this part of town is definitely area to stay in with kids. One added bonus was paying a whopping $10 more for breakfast for four. The breakfast was your standard eggs, potatoes, grits, bacon, sausage, oatmeal, fruits and danishes-but very tasty! We really enjoyed our stay and will be back soon, can't say what a difference it makes to stay a couple more streets away from Bourbon!

Reviews.Title: “My new " New Orleans GO TO" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sobchbud1
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised and impressed with this hotel. It isn't 5 stars, but it is quite nice with a solid rating. My female travel mate and I were in New Orleans for a conference, and we got a terrific rate bidding on Priceline, so the value rating for this hotel was definitely 5 star! We were both thrilled with our rooms and really loved this hotel. It was a nice 1/4 mile walk to the Convention Center and just stumbling distance to Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. There is a streetcar stop almost in front of the Hotel. The rooms were clean, large, and tastefully appointed. The beds and linens were heavenly. I had the urge to sleep in every morning. EVERYONE I came in contact with at the hotel from the front Desk to Housekeeping was professional and pleasant. No complaints! On this trip I stayed at 2 hotels in New Orleans. I got both from bidding on Priceline. I didn't get so lucky with the same price for the New Orleans Marriott Canal Street. It wasn't nearly as pleasurable a stay. Be careful when bidding, and be informed as to the possible results: Intercontinental = Jackpot! OR Marriott = Decent...OK. I would be glad to pay much more for the Intercontinental. This Hotel is now at the top of my New Orleans list for value, comfort, and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: ajie
Reviews.Content: The Intercontinental is located a few blocks from Canal Street and it's location makes it very convenient to walk to the French Quarter. The St Charles trolley stops a block from the hotel. The hotel is very well maintained with well appointed rooms.The amenties included coffee maker, safe ,iron, robes, stocked bar. There is a pool and gym on the 15th floor. The beds were to die for and housekeeping did an excellent job without being seen. The staff is very efficient and friendly. Was very happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, good location, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: jwobkk
Reviews.Content: Everything was positive about my stay here although the property is starting to look a little tired. The room was comfortably large as was the bath. The bed was nice and comfortable. Service was friendly and attentive. The location is a close walk to all the action in the French Quarter and the Harrah's casino. I wouldn't pay the rack rate but this was a real steal at the $65 a night I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: TXTravelcrazy
Reviews.Content: Well, if I had paid rack rate I'd be disappointed. Got a last, last minute great rate on Hotwire ($68/night) and it was clean, the bed comfy and the room good. Also good location walking distance to everything. Very happy with the stay for the price point I paid. Again, if I had paid $200/more per night, I'd be harder on them. The pool area was small but nice after a hot day. Minor complaints: the little store on the ground floor of the hotel does not take hotel charge. Not a big deal, but the prices are hotel quality and I was coming in from a jog without a wallet....the girl offered no explanation as to why they don't do hotel charge. Sound carries through the ventilation system a LOT - at least it did in my room. Beware if you are having a loud discussion or if you are being amorous - others will be hearing it loud and clear. I was woken up two days in a row by noise from other guests. They had been testing their fire alarm system and the Friday morning I was there it was being tested - they did have a note at the desk upon check in but it started EARLY. I was hearing the alarm coming from outside my window at 8 a.m. (very early by any standard but this is New Orleans...). Overall I would say it's a good place to stay but only if you get a good rate on it - NOLA has so many hotel options that you can afford to be picky unless you are going on a budget last minute get away like I did.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for $99/night on AAA rate. Very...”
Reviews.Author: Gburg4
Reviews.Content: Stayed for $99/night on AAA rate. Very nice place. Stayed 4 nights and housekeeping forgot to make the bed one day. Also, bottles of shampoo, etc were very hard to open. Glad my husband was with me. But other than that, everything was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel near Canal/Bourbon Streets”
Reviews.Author: Roadnut
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. Upon check-in, the very pleasent staff member asked if we wanted a high/low floor and upon mentioning an upper floor room, we were given one on the 12th floor. Had plenty of room within the room. TV worked well although the remote channel up/down buttons were a little troublesome. Bathroom had a decently large counter. Wished the room safe was a little bigger. There was a minor problem within the room that maintenance took care of the same day. Maid service, if you are not out of the room early enough, may be a little spotty. One day they didn't return until late in the afternoon; one other day, we had left the room, came back, left again, and the room was not serviced. Valet and bellhop service was friendly and quick. The fitness center on the 15th floor is large with plenty of cardio machines. The outdoor pool is next to the fitness center. Downstairs' bar "Petes" has a nice happy hour with free apps and 1/2 priced beers and other specials. Bourton Street is about 3 - 4 blocks away. Decatour is about 6 blocks. The street and area around the hotel appeared safe and we never had any problem walking around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay - for the price we got ;)”
Reviews.Author: Ducati40
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal through Priceline ( about half price) and for that price we were very pleased with this hotel. Room are not big, but big enough, very clean. Nice bathroom area, great towels and shampoo etc (only very hard to open - metal screw top!) Quiet area, we dont mind walking and enjoyed walking to the French quarter etc, will rather walk to the noisy part and sleep in the quiet one! Nice staff. the concierge was very helpful and gave us lots of advices, and recommended a great restaurant for sea food ,just around the corner (Bon Ton Cafe) which was wonderful! No free internett - expensive parking - but all in all - a nice stay. PS Just found out that they charged us for minibar as well - which we did not use at all. Called them and they should get back to us on that. Hope that will be solved. Not a big sum but still - you always get the feeling they are trying to fool you - we signed and checked out and then these extra cost is added afterwards!

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: FoodieTampa
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed with this hotel. We have stayed at other InterContinental Hotels around he U.S. and have never had such a bad experience. When arriving at the hotel, the bellman were standing around talking to one another while guests, including my husband and I lugged suitcases from our taxi to the front doors of the hotel. Not once did any one of them ask if we needed assistance. As we entered the hotel, the escalator was "Out of Service." These things happen. However, the check-in desk was upstairs and as we struggled up the steep stairs with our suitcases...no one again from the hotel asked us if we needed help. When checking in, we were told our room had a balcony. When we got to our room, we didn't have a room with a balcony but a room with a view of the parking garage next door. Sunday morning, we were told the restaurant was getting ready for Sunday Brunch, so we had to eat in a banquet room to the side of the front desk. After being seated, it took the wait staff fifteen minutes before coming to ask for our drink order. The room was not crowded at all, so we couldn't understand the wait. When our coffee came, it was cold along with our server's mood. If she was having a bad morning...why should we have to suffer? After dropping off our drinks, we didn't see her again for another ten minutes. If it wasn't for our having to catch a plane, we would have left and gone somewhere else for breakfast. however, we had no choice that morning. Breakfast was awful and it was a terrible way to end our romatic getaway. I will never return to this hotel again. It was a waste of money and was in no way a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place, service & location”
Reviews.Author: nikkikh
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Comfy beds, great location - close to everything! Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a plush place”
Reviews.Author: Vidiot42
Reviews.Content: Got an amazing deal through Orbitz Vacations for an air+hotel package -- the nearby Holiday Inn Express was more expensive than the four-star Intercontinental! It's not the kind of place I usually stay in, but the hotel was very comfortable, with a large, sparkling-clean, quiet, plush room. The concierge was very helpful in pointing out some things going on, including a jazz and blues festival just down the street in a small park. Good location in the CBD, a short walk from the Quarter and very close to the Canal St streetcar.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but not fab...”
Reviews.Author: AJMick
Reviews.Content: The bf and I traveled down for the first weekend of Jazz Fest 2010. The hotel was nice, in a good location, easy walking distance to the Quarter, friendly and helpful staff. The room itself was fine but dated, the bed was okay but not terribly comfortable. The thing that disturbed me most was the absolutely filthy carpeting. I originally thought my feet were dirty from walking outside in flip flops but later discovered that the carpet was making my feet dirty after I showered and my white socks turned black. Just kinda gross in general and completely unexpected from a hotel of this caliber. I would have no problem recommending this hotel to friends but will definitely warn of the carpet issue... we should've requested a new room but it's hard to say whether a new room would fix the problem...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Ruubarb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. Our room the first night was not good at all - there was a leak from the air conditioning that left a puddle on the floor in front of our closet. And we were in one of those rooms with connecting doors - we could hear EVERYTHING next door, including the zipper closing on a suitcase. Needless to say, we called the front desk and they got us to another room and upgraded us to a balcony. Unfortunately, the room transfer took a while and was a bit frustrating, but after that everything was great. The balcony room was nice as it allowed us to open the door and let in some fresh air. Overall, the hotel and its staff were great and we were happy with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “The greatest hotel bed I have ever slept in...”
Reviews.Author: oohsherry
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in April 2010 in a balcony, king room. The bed and pillows were extremely nice... The windows had black out drapes that kept the sun out in the morning so we slept in, which was wonderful. The room was quiet and clean. We ordered room service one morning and it was cooked and delievered to us on the balcony within 15 minutes! I was impressed!! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Beds - Worst Place to Sleep In NOLA”
Reviews.Author: precious123ma
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to NOLA. The hotel was recommended by a previous traveler. They were correct in stating the hotel is close (walking distance) to everything you can need - CVS, Casino, Shopping, Restaurants, Tour Guides etc. The 90% of the people working in the hotel were more than nice. But the bed was horrendous! It was too, too soft. It was a very old mattress with a down comforter placed on top. There was also an issue with the electrical outlets - I need to use it for my C-PAP machine and they finally gave me a extension cord to use for the evening. The following day they claimed it was fixed - it wasn't. Evenutally we had another room. By the way my roommate broke out in a terrible rash and need a presecription cream to allevate the rash. Oh yes - you need to pay for computer access and even though they offer you the ability to print out your plane pass it would time out after 6 minutes (the computer was extremely slow).

Reviews.Title: “Close to Fr. Quarter, tram; free boarding pass printing; fine overall”
Reviews.Author: bikinghiking123
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend--our first time in NOLA. After hearing other tourists' stories about staying in the French Quarter (good luck getting a good night's sleep--even in early November!--because of drunken revelers and partiers not quieting down till 4am in the quarter. Then a couple of hours later the garbage trucks come in).... SO the Hotel Intercontinental in NOLA provided wonderful quiet nights! It's walking distance to the Fr. Quarter and historical sites; CVS and Walgreens convenience stores, and of course the famous trolley/tram. The rooms are getting dated as others have said, but overall it was clean and fine. The staff are a bit stiff, and our wake up call and requested taxicab never came. Never mind--we just took the next cab that came in the early morning. The ability to print for free your boarding passes is available at the two computers off to the side from the reception. That was the 'computer/biz center'--you'll pay to use the internet but it's free for boarding passes which was great. The famous "Mother's" restaurant is nearby. Good price for the package we booked via priceline.

Reviews.Title: “good location but terrible beds....”
Reviews.Author: CheleMiami
Reviews.Content: I cannot recall a worst night than the one I had trying to sleep in the bed of this hotel. No support, very very old mattress and too soft. I had back pains for three days after that night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Dave G
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights for a wedding and for the first time visitor to New Orleans this hotel was in the perfect location. Recommended by local residents, the hotel is a close walk to Bourbon St but far enough to be quiet and modern (relatively) . Hotel staff were outstanding, very helpful with advice. Which included the bell hop advising of a free concert in the park just down the road from the hotel, this type of service made us feel like we didn't miss anything that was going on. Room was huge with nice decor, for the price, very surprising. Whilst in New Orleans you must try Cafe de Monde for breakfast and the Mufaletta at Central Grocery on Decatur St.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Just a GOOD stay”
Reviews.Author: gophils26
Reviews.Content: Booked through hotwire at $70 a night, so for what we paid, it was definitely a great value. Check hotwire when your booking in NO, they always have either the intercontinental or the Sheraton for under 70 dollars. Anyway.... THe room was pretty solid, the beds were nice and comfortable, the pillows just ok, soft pillows. TV was outdated but we don't spend alot of time in the hotels anyway. Fitness room was very solid and free!!! Tv's, Ellpiticals, biking, treadmills and assorted machines. Did not use the pool. The only problem we encountered on our stay, besides minor toilet issues, occured at night. The first night we were awoken at 3:30 by an alarm that went off next door. This alarm continued on for an hour and would not shut off. By this time all of us were up, so we called the front desk, and the problem was taken care of within 5 minutes. Next night.... We did not expect the problem to happen again, but it did. This time I found myself up at 4:30 and I heard the dreadful loud and annoying beep beep of the alarm clock from next door, in which no one was staying. Two nights in a row, I had to call the front desk for assistance, but again they arrived promptly. Would stay here again, great location on st.charles easily accesible to the streetcar, and the quarter. Oh yeah, parking is incredibly expensive, but we didn't have a car, and internet is not free but on the 12th floor we were able to find internet connection called (wireless)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.....but....”
Reviews.Author: DC60BShift
Reviews.Content: The motel itself was very nice and the staff was very friendly. With that being said....There was some misrepresentation by the hotel. I looked at the place on Priceline.com and decided to call for more information. When I called I was told (by someone) that they had FREE wireless access in the rooms and that parking was included in the price of the motel. When we arrived I found that there was only valet parking and it was $32.00/night and that the only wireless was in the lobby of floors 1, 2, 3. Internet access was available in the room for $14.95 for 3 days I think. We did find a parking lot next to motel for $15.00/24 hours and you can go in and out, but there is no guarantee you have a spot when you return. There is other wireless in the city you can access for pay, but it does not work well. I think it is a bit pricey for what you get. The room itself was not much different than a normal motel room with the exception of a high priced wet bar ($7.00 bottle of airplane booze, $4.00 soft drinks, $6.00 bottle of water). As typical with most motels, they did not replace towel or sheets unless you threw towels on the floor and place a sign on your bed. They did not vacuum the floor at all during our stay. Even with all, that I would consider using it again as it is only 3 blocks to Canal street and then 2 blocks to bourbon street.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster! Arrogance! Uncaring!”
Reviews.Author: kchnman
Reviews.Content: What a disaster. I spend about 150 nights a year in hotel rooms & I am used to being treated as a valued customer in the various hotels I visit whether for the first time or for a return stay. This hotel, while it's supposed to be a top notch venue, falls way short. THEY DON'T CARE ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS! They gouge you every chance they get, for example, I need to refrigerate some medication. Until I complained to the G.M. of the hotel, they wanted to charge me $40.00 PER NIGHT for a refrigerator in my room. The staff were arrogant, they couldn't be bothered with my needs. They stood around joking with each other rather than take care of guests who were waiting to check in or check out. Yes, there were a few people on their staff who were great; the doorman;the bellstaff;the houskeepers, but they were the few. All in all - GO TO MARRIOTT, THEY TREAT YOU RIGHT!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience,location and beds, with quite rooms,highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: fidweaver
Reviews.Content: Greatest hotel staff ever had the chance to deal with . The rooms were very quite ,beds were super comfortable after a long day of sight seeing on the cobblestone French Quarters , they were always a welcome sight. Close enough to French Quarters to spend time thier during the day and have the quite at night.Just a 2 block walk. Only had one glitch with my stay , only lasted a few minutes , staff went right on point to change batteries in our in room safe . All was good for our family, and I would recommend the Intercontinetal hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “For an Intercontinental, a seriously BAD hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tom2592
Reviews.Content: Seriously bad beds, banged up furniture, dingy hallways, tacky decor and indifferent service make the Intercontinental New Orleans a poor choice when seeking a 4* hotel. Within the 4* market segment (Westin, Renaissance, Omni and I/C)- and I stay at lots of them- this property is among the bottom 10%. I had rooms with two beds. In both my butt was a foot lower than my feet or shoulders and the left side of my body was higher than the right. This was unacceptable so I dialed the number labeled "we solve all problems". The attendant was sympathetic and said she would get right back to me regarding a room change. When the return call failed to materialize in 15 minutes, I called again and was told, "The managers are really busy today and aren't calling me back." I marched down to the front desk and got a room change. Guess what? Once again both beds sagged north/south and east /west. I decided to investigate. The metal bed frames had been pulled apart and were now wider than the box spring, which therefore was not supported. The mattress (judged by the look of its cover and condition) was 25 years old. It was compressed and sagged with no weight on it. Granted there were $300 feather beds on top of them, but the mattresses had been dead for 15 years. I called Guest Services two more times. Both calls met with polite sympathy and promises to get back to me with a fix. No calls were received. I proceeded to adjust/fix the metal bed frame so that it at least supported the box spring, I then stuffed the pillows from one bed between the mattress and box spring on the other and in the end had a highly improvised, but reasonably comfortable bed for the night. That this even needed to occur is absurd. That management can literally ignore priority customer service calls boggles the mind. The second room had no upholstered chair- a first for me in a 4*. Perhaps it had been removed because it was stained even more than the chair in the first room, which was filthy. The furniture had been through the wars. It was chipped and banged up. The carpet I am quite sure dates to the 1980s and has never been steam cleaned. I did not walk on it with bare feet because the thought of doing so grossed me out. In fairness, the housekeeper had vacuumed and the bathroom was clean. It is the absence of heavy cleaning over the years that creates the problem. The hallways look like a 2* hotel from 1945- dingy. So many light bulbs have been removed in the public spaces that one suspects the hotel is in bankruptcy. The decor is 1980s red velvet and faux gold leaf- not a great look- done badly. The look suggests the designer's previous commission was a house of ill repute for senior communist party officials in Eastern Kazakstan. The similarly priced Sheraton where I have also stayed is a standout for that brand and far, far nicer than the Intercontinental. Avoid the I/C New Orleans like the plague. This hotel is a prime candidate for reflagging as a Day's Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly quiet, restful hotel in the heart of NOLA”
Reviews.Author: catietravels
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by this hotel's ability to have a good quiet atmosphere being in the middle of NOLA. The location was wonderful as I visited for a meeting with Shell who's main office is across the street. The service was wonderful, everyone I encountered were very polite and helpful. The room was what I would expect paying a more-than-average rate for it. Very comfortable bed, and wide selection of TV channels including HBO. There is a fitness center that is above par, and many little restaurants that are easily accessable. The location as I said before was great, most attractions are with in walking distance, and the staff are happy to help direct you to where you want to go. Overall, I would stay there again on business, but maybe not on vacation due to the cost of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: DallasAice
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 7pm our room was not ready and we were told by the front desk "you all are not the only ones, you should see the wait list", well she sure was telling the truth, the lobby was full of guests all waiting for their rooms to be ready. The reason being given was there was "a lot of late check outs". One would imagine a hotel that charges as much as the InterContinental could afford to hire a staff to keep up with basic housekeeping. Speaking of housekeeping, they did not enter our room for 2 days in a row, when we called Guest Services to inform them of this we got major attitude-"you must of had the do not disturb sign up" and were informed that there was no evening housekeeping shift so we were given towels and DIY instructions. The room was small, in need of updating(there was a big rip in the carpet which they attempted to cover with a table, I am not positive but it sure looked like something I donated to Good Will about a decade ago) and begs for a dresser. We visit New Orleans all the time and this hotel was both the most expensive and the worst one we have ever stayed at. There are so many better hotels in New Orleans for about half the cost of the InterContinental

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: brnidgrl
Reviews.Content: I selected this property as part of a Southwest Vacation flight/hotel pkg. deal and of course, it wasn't the least expensive option, but I was happy with my choice. The room, while on a dark side of the property (I was made aware of that at check-in) was very comfy and clean, with two queen beds, nicely appointed, though some of the furnishings are beginning to show age. The bathrobes were not in the room as mentioned but one call to the desk and they appeared pronto. Biggest complaint was the leaking toilet which I had to turn off the valve at night so it wouldn't keep us awake "refilling" every few mins. We did make the desk and maid staff aware, but no action taken during our brief stay. Otherwise, the desk staff (Benjamin), was quite pleasant, professional and accommodating and that made up for much. Everyone I encountered was knowledgeable and nice. I would recommend this property and would go there again myself. One negative: It would be nice if the "Veranda" restaurant served breakfast later than 10:30 a.m. We tried to get in about 10:45 a.m. and were turned away. Most places serve breakfast or brunch at least until noon.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average.”
Reviews.Author: Treavelpros100
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay at the Intercontinental New Orleans. I do not have anything bad to say about the hotel, just be advised that the hotel is VERY average. We got a great rate of $89 as the mystery 4 star hotel on bookit.com so we were just happy that we hadn't spent a lot of money. The room was clean, the bed was comfy, no complaints just nothing at all special. The hotel is in a good location, New Orleans is an amazing place. Make sure you eat a Po Boy at Mothers, they are the best, also the Desire Oyster house on Bourbon Street was good for dinner, We ate Etoufee and shrimp and grits, and of course eat at cafe Du Monde as often as you can, the beignets are to die for. Visit New Orleans it is a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, quiet, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: kkmbam
Reviews.Content: Been to new Orleans many times but had never stayed here before. Got a good price on Expedia. I can't believe some of the bad reviews. The rooms were a decent size, very comfortable bed, quiet (sometimes I have a problem with noisy people) and safe neighborhood. Except for the unusually cold weather, everything was wonderful with the hotel and our trip. We love to spend New Years in NO and hope to stay @ the Intercontinental again.

Reviews.Title: “SO wish I'd chosen a different hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chessielabmom
Reviews.Content: I thought the Intercontinental was supposed to be a fantastic, 4 star hotel, so I was thrilled when we were able to book a king size room with a private balcony for our Christmas vacation. It was a bit more than I'd hoped to spend, but I figured it would be worth it. WRONG. The room was tiny, with one chair - so when my husband and I ordered room service, there was little room to eat. There was no dresser, only two small drawers beneath the tv cabinet / minibar. We were travelling for a week, which meant we ended up with wrinkled clothes in our suitcases - oh, and there was nowhere to put our suitcases except the floor beside the bed. There was one suitcase stand in the small closet, but it was broken. The walls were paper thin; neither of us slept a single night all the wall through, as we awoke every time our neighbors came and went. We could even hear distinctly every word of conversation and each time they opened the safe or put down a glass. We did have the balcony as requested (and paid for), but I hadn't realized it would be looking down an alley and constantly dark. It wasn't exactly inviting - more the atmosphere of a dank apartment block. The bed was dirty. There was something that looked suspiciously like vomit encrusted all over the bedskirt. Had I noticed this when we checked in, I would have requested another room, but it was late and we'd been travelling all day. After that, I just tried to avoid it. Disgusting! The internet connection in the room didn't work, so I tried the "business center." Their business center is nothing more than two computers in the lobby (which require a credit card for use, which struck me as pretty chintzy considering the price of the hotel) - but they were broken all week long. The TV remote didn't work either. Finally, the room service ... The hotel has a "romance package" breakfast, which we ordered for our first morning. It took forever to arrive (which seemed odd, considering nothing needed cooking), and when it did, it was missing some of the advertised food. Considering that, with delivery charge and included tip, it costs about $100, that's pretty bad. But, for some reason, we ordered room service twice again. With those two times, we had the same problem: they gave us silverware and coffee cups for two people, but food for one. Oh, but they did charge us for two. All in all, it wasn't a good experience. I would NEVER stay here again. My family is from New Orleans and we travel there quite often. This was the worst place I've ever stayed. It wouldn't have been so bad had it not been so expensive - I would have been more likely to forgive some of the problems had it been a run-of-the-mill motel ... but it wasn't and I felt cheated.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: BostonLilybelle
Reviews.Content: I think the best part of the Intercontinental is it's location. It is outside of the French Quarter so you get to avoid some of the craziness, but still within walking distance. We got a great rate at this hotel on Priceline. It's your standard nice hotel, so we were pleased in that respect. We didn't spend a whole lot of time at the hotel, but it was comfortable to come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JFPK
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights just before Christmas. Check in was a breeze & was given a requested room on the 12 floor facing St Charles. Hotel reminded me of NYC type old, eligent and well maintained. Beds were outstanding with plenty of pillows. Shower was hot with a stong stream of water. Coffee provided in room was very nice & very easy to prepare. NY Times delivered each morning . Free wifi available in the lobby. Christmas decorations were outstanding especially hte gingerbread house (very unique). NFL teams stay here, Dallas Cowboys last week. Self parking is available next door for $15/ 24 hrs. St Charles street car comes by every 10 minutes or so. If you have time take it out to hte end of line, passing some very beautiful homes, only $1.25 each way. Don't miss the WW2 museum which is a few blocks away. If you enjoy Dixieland jazz visit Frizes on Bourban St.. This is the quiet side of Canal St, but still very close to the action. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Had turkey club from room service first night only $11 & came with large delicious helping of onion rings. Arrived within 15 minutes of order. What more can I say. This was a fabulous stay & the we will come back. One more thing, got the room on Priceline, it's a steal of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was helpful to ensure our stay was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: JMC0789
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days, and i have to say my partner and I enjoyed this hotel immensely. Very clean which is important to me. We were on a non smoking floor. All staff were helpful and recommended plenty of restaurants and Jazz clubs to go to. The hotel is on the "American" side of canal - this is the street the divides the french quarter and business district. So its only 1 block and you are on royal street in the french quarter, which is 1 block from famous Bourbon street. We booked 3 tours the swamp, city and a boat cruise all were worth the money. We learnt how the Cajun people live, learnt the history of the city and sore the still remaining devastation of Katrina. I love this hotel the staff are amazing and the rooms are great and the city is fascinating. I had no troubles.

Reviews.Title: “Intercontinental cancelled reservation 3 days before trip”
Reviews.Author: Georgia_in_MS
Reviews.Content: I made reservations directly on the IC website on August 2, 2009 for December 19 - the Saints/Cowboys game. They called today to say they were overbooked and were going to try to make arrangements for us elsewhere. I had picked the IC because of the great reviews and for the proximity to the Superdome. They were supposed to call back in 30 minutes to let me know about the new hotel. An hour went by - I started looking for hotels on my own. I finally found a hotel 3 hours later (still no call from IC) at the convention center location. The lady said they have trouble with their website, which resulted in the overbooking. It is the entire IC website because the Astor Crown Plaza (another IC hotel) showed they had availabilities. I called - of course, they did not. I will NOT use the Intercontinental Hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Eavesdroppers”
Reviews.Author: Jomida
Reviews.Content: I have never written a hotel review, but our experience compelled me. The Intercontinental is in a great location, and presents itself well from the outside and the lobby. It stops there. The first thing we noticed when we got off the elevator (7th floor) was the smell of cigarette smoke. Although we had a non-smoking room, apparently, they don't have non-smoking floors. If you have an issue with cigarette smoke, avoid. I think the room walls are made of cardboard. Our first night, we had to endure the guest next door calling all her friends and chatting. It was embarassingly loud. The following morning, the alarm clock woke us, but it was not OUR alarm clock; it was in the room on the other side of us. The room was empty and the alarm continued througout the morning. This was followed shortly afterward with Ms. Chatty getting back on the phone. Paaaleaze. The shower head came to my chin (I'm 6'1"). The drain didn't, uh, drain very well. By the end of my shower, I was in ankle-deep water. No plastic laundry bags for dirty clothes. There is no free in-room Internet access. I writing from the lobby, where there is free wireless. If you want access in your room, cough up the dough. This is soooo 20th century. It was raining, and apparently that is enough to cause trouble with satellite reception for the TV. With no TV and no Internet, we could nothing but enjoy our neighbor's conversations. There would be no romance for us, if you get my drift. New Orleans is making a great comeback. Unfortunately, the Intercontinental is not. There are too many fine hotels in the NEW New Orleans to waste your hard-earned cash on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but overall a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: condorhauck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference in the same hotel. The rooms were very nice, and comfortable. My first fault was as soon as I stepped off the elevator the smell of smoke was overwhelming. I had the misfortune of being on a smoking floor. The television in the room worked O.K., but has a very limited set of viewable options. My colleagues had told me their televisions had features that mine did not. The view from my room was pretty awful. Not that there would have been a great view from any room. As for the service, it seemed to be pretty good. I had no complaints, however my iPhone ear buds did go missing after the second day. I am not sure if they got sucked up in the vacuum cleaner, trashed, or taken. The location is really great, it's not on Bourbon street, but it is a very short walk to the French Quarter, Harrah's, and the Mississippi riverfront.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not Four Star Quality”
Reviews.Author: tpd1
Reviews.Content: I'm sorry to say that this place was less than adequate for a four star hotel. Although the rates were resonable, it lacked the quality I expected. There are many, many places to stay in NOLA so I suggest that you look elsewhere. While the service was average, the rooms were very run down and need some serious renovation. The place had a mild odor that was enough to irritate me for the duration of the stay. There were several minor things that you also wouldn't expect. For example, one of our beds (which were all seriously uncomfortable) didn't have a fitted sheet. Also, it was pretty loud. One weekday morning we could hear all the traffic below, including an annoying whistler from a person directing traffic. If it hadn't been for the fact that they have a terrible cancellation policy, we wouldn't have even stayed in the first place. I tried to change reservations well over a month before we traveled and they would not even consider changing our dates... Overall, it wasn't the worse experience ever (and we travel a lot) but I wouldn't recommend this to anyone since there are many other nice places in NOLA...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travelchiks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great experience. The rooms were nicely decorated and the beds were very comfortable. Great location too!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Pleasant Surroundings”
Reviews.Author: rickv1
Reviews.Content: Having arrived on an early flight, we got to the hotel at 9:45 AM expecting that we would store our luggage and explore the city for a few hours. We were pleasantly surprised to be told that our room was ready and we could go right up. All staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is great, 3 blocks from the french quarter and on the street car line. Our 3 day stay was fine. The room was clean and well maintained, except the bed,(see below). Housekeeping did a good job, usually early in the day. The bed. The mattress should have been replaced years ago. It was very worn, not dirty, just worn out. It was topped with a large fluffy down cover, I suppose to make it look new and luxurious. If you like a soft, squishy, crooked mattress, you'll love it. Otherwise, you'll find the bed in need of replacement. At $79./night (hotwire) it was bearable. If I had paid market rate, it would have been less so. We didn't use the hotel restaurant or bar, so no comment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Beds and Location for a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: senorchivas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent Halloween weekend at the Intercontinental and had a very pleasant experience. The hotel room itself was very clean and well appointed. The only cleanliness concern we had was the women's restroom in the lobby but that was only on one occasion. The concierge was very helpful and gave us some excellent tips on where to eat great New Orleans cuisine. The beds at the hotel were amazing and it was hard to get out of them every morning. I would have to say that the best impression that was left on us was when I contacted the front desk on the morning that we were supposed to check out. I told them that my wife was not feeling so great and since our flight was later in the day we would appreciate a late checkout. They were very accommodating and granted us an extra couple of hours at no charge. It's the little things like this that leave lasting impressions and build customer loyalty. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a stinking hotel.... Avoid it if you can!”
Reviews.Author: pwelch
Reviews.Content: Thought I'd be doing myself a favour by booking into the Intercontinental, how wrong was I? The lobby area looks quite nice, but when you reach the rooms you are magically transported to the late 1970's early 1980's with the cigarette smell (in the non-smoking rooms) lingering like it has been around since then. The service was sloppy, no late check-out for gold members because they were "fully booked" I could never imagine that hotel would get fully booked. Of course I stayed at a bargain rate of $69 a night, so maybe I'm asking a lot, but I can't help thinking this place was not even worth that - there must be some wonderful hotels in New Orleans - but do yourself a favour and avoid the intercontinental, bad management and poor service means that this is a disgrace to the IChotels group.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but a little run down”
Reviews.Author: Kurt12
Reviews.Content: If you want a comfortable place to sleep, you're not going to be unhappy at the Intercontinental. But this hotel has seen better days. I noticed missing and crooked brass letters at Reception (what manager would let that go for long?), and as soon as I entered my room, found that the toilet seat didn't stay up, and I had the handle for the faucet fall off in my hand. The shower head needed replacing, and the doors don't close properly and have to be pulled hard. I heard lots of doors slamming when I was there, fortunately none at night. This was probably a very nice hotel in about 1979. However, I had a pleasant stay there and would recommend it to anyone who isn't bothered by the kinds of details I mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: pavari
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Hotel InterContinental New Orleans, booked through bookit.com. It seemed a bargin at/ $79.00 night. The location was great and I was able to walk to the French Quarters and the museums. The St. Charles trolley line is just outside. The staff were all friendly and helpful, when I complained that the door stuck, it was fixed when I returned to the room. On the top floor is a fitness room with several machines and a heated outdoor pool. I didn't swim in the pool because I don't think it was "heated." There's a gift shop downstairs and a pastry/coffee shop. On the second floor is a lovely European syle restaurant--The Veranda and Pete's--an English style pub. The room was large with a foyer at the entrance, two room marble bathroom and two double beds. The shower was great with a large shower head and plenty of hot water, but the shower curtain always allowed water to run across the floor. Damana brand French tolietries were supplied. Plenty of coffee was supplied with the single serve coffee pot. I personally don't like all the little signs around the room and the water bottles with the price tags and the pricey stocked refrigerator. I like my room to seem like home, not a "sales room." The view from my room was of the parking car garage nest door, I was so close, I could read the license plates numbers. Here's what's unbelievable to me, the mattress was soft and bouncy. A thin feather mattress was placed on top of it-- I guess in an attempt to improve it. I had such a backache that I had to pay for a $140.00 massage just so I could get through the next day. So much for bargain hotels --right? I hope no one actually pays $175.00 a night for this hotel. Also, if you have a car, you will pay &30.00 night to have it parked or $45.00 if it's "oversized." I think next time I book a hotel, I'll try and find out what kind of mattress the hotel has. Sleeping is kind of an important aspect of my hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “never stay again”
Reviews.Author: truthadvisor4u
Reviews.Content: My husband had a conference at New Orleans for 3 days. He got 2 free nights points from Priority Club, so we paid one more night by ourseelves. Because we had a good experience staying at Intercontinental Hote in Chicago and the good location close to French market, so we booked this hotel. In fact, after staying at Intercontinental New Orleans, I won't think I'll come again. The Cons: 1. The service was bad. The front desk told us that the free room and the paid room would combine together, but it never. On the 3rd night, the card could not open the door. We had to go to the front desk to lie up again to change to a new card. 2. Breakfast was cold, no variety, less choice and pricey. The paid room $199 is including 2 free breakfast. We have 2 kids (6 & 3)with us. We brought our kids go to the resturant with us becuase they could not stay at the room by themselves. They bring their own milk inside. The manager still charged 1 kid's price at $14.99+tax. I argued with him, he still had to charge a small box of cheerio which my son just took a piece into his mouth. The manager told me the box cheerio just costed $2-3, but it was $4+tax when he handed me the bill. 3. The same opinion with other travelers is the bed is old and too soft. It caused my husband and I had back pain. They have to update the beds and furniture. 4. Lack of amentiy. We have 4 people but they have only 1 person's amenity. We have to ask call them to bring in everytime. A bit stingy. It maybe good for one business traveler but not family with kids. Will recommend to anybody especially family with kids. 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_from_NYC2
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a long weekend w/a friend and this hotel served our needs well. The room was clean and we were able to check in early. The bellhops were welcoming, friendly and a great source of information. It was a 4 block walk to the French Quarter. The trolley that goes to the Garden District/Audubon Park stopped right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good value could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: mlouann
Reviews.Content: great location and a great value but could use some updating. Room service took a little longer than expected. Gym was a little small but functional. Overall a good experience for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. I will definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: belle04_
Reviews.Content: The InterContinental New Orleans was awesome. We arrived around noon, and we were able to check-in early with no problems. The staff was very nice and helpful. Rooms were spaceous and clean. It was a great location, not far from the casino and french quarter. I will stay there again when we go back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Mystery Solved - It was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Muscatine
Reviews.Content: I crossed my fingers when we signed up for the 4 star Mystery Hotel. We were not disappointed. A wonderful hotel. Room was upgraded to a King with a balcony which really made our visit nice. Clean, Comfortable and so very nice. Wonderful bed with lots of great pillows. Located on St. Charles Street just a block or so from Canal Street. Easy to get around by foot, trolley or cab. The doorman Randy was such a helpful man and so cheerful. We would stay here again. Tip: There is a parking garage right next to the hotel for $15 a day. We didn't use it but it looked very nice and next time we will do that. Valet parking was $30 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ria5457
Reviews.Content: There was 6 of us with three rooms and the hotel was able to get us all on the same floor (a last minute request). The staff was pleasent and helpfull. Our standard room was very nice with the best bed I have ever slept in away from home. Our breakfast at the Veranda resturant was plentiful and of the best quality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: meetthebains
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this Hotel and the service was remarkable, the location is great, short walk to the French Quarter, Jackson Square and the Riverwalk Mall. The rooms were very quiet, nice and clean and you didnt want to leave the bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Rated 4 star but it's really 3-”
Reviews.Author: WantToSeeItAll
Reviews.Content: Decent enough, located on St. Charles streetcar line, front entrance broken, so had to take side doors, lobby located on the second floor so you have to take an escalator up, front desk staff excellent, processed my room fast as I had to get to an airboat tour. Front bellhops provided minimal help, just talked to each other. NO PARKING, anywhere in NOLA without paying, but it does have a nice drive thru area for dropoff. My major complaint and the reason for 3 stars- the beds are horrible, they have the same old, floppy beds, with no support, and have topped them with a fluff pad to give the illusion of new beds. Back could not take another night on the bed, and I consider the comfort horrible because of it. Pillows have NO support so you feel like you and in a cotton ball. The price was right, got it reservation of a discount site, but I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, well located but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: willi348
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-located and the rooms are clean and comfortable. To have a quiet location so close to Bourbon Street and Canal Street was great. I would not want to stay in a room on Bourbon - way too noisy. Great, comfy beds and water pressure in the showers was awesome. Negative - it was $6 to use the hotel's business center computer for 15 minutes. I would have liked to print my boarding pass prior to flying but chose not to pay for this. Most hotels offer this service for free or only charge if you want to check e-mail or do personal business. Service was all over the board. Excellent at the front desk and concierge - but there was usually quite a line. Pretty poor in other areas. Took over 1.5 hours to eat lunch at their restaurant due to service. We weren't looking to have a long meal. The server couldn't have been nicer but I think she was the only one and was pretty new. Valet couldn't recommend a single place to grab a quick bite to eat and a drink on a Wednesday night (come on, this is New Orleans!). I know it was the valet and likely not his job but to wait and ask the front desk would have taken forever. Our room type was not available upon check-in so we had to switch the next day and then that room wasn't available at 3:30pm (they told us it would be ready by noon and they would transport our luggage for us - didn't happen). We left a tip on top of the luggage to be taken by the person who transferred it and we left a seperate tip for the maid. Both were taken by the maid and we had to transfer our own bags. Finally, if you use any of the glasses in the room the maid doesn't replace them with clean ones - they simply leave the dirty ones for your entire stay. This hotel has great bones (rooms, location, the people who do manage to give good service are very friendly) but needs to work on its service level and consistency.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay!”
Reviews.Author: RosiNYC
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent four days and three night at the Intercontinental. The hotels is quite impressive outside and inside. The staff was courteous and accomodating to us. The room as lovely with not much of a view, we faced another hotel but either way, it was very clean and big. We booked an amazing deal through expedia and we had a great time. The hotel is conveniently located- walking distance to the French Quarters and the Riverwalk. We are two young women walking late at night from Bourbon Street and we felt very safe. It's far enough from the noise, I would not want to stay on Bourbon, it's way too noisy at night. The only thing was the room doors slamming at all hours of the night and day which got irritating by our second night when you are startled awake. We were not sure if it were other guests or if it was staff coming in and out of the emergency doors. We were also pretty much on our own in figuring out were to go and what to do, there was not much information available and the concierge was never around when we needed the information.

Reviews.Title: “Only at a Discount”
Reviews.Author: Ted Fry
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the New Orleans Inter Continental, but must say straightaway that it didn't quite live up to expectations. This was surprising, since it had so many things going for it beyond its reputation: a) excellent location in the CBD, just steps from the Quarter but removed from its noise & frenzy -- and an easy stroll in the other direction to the Warehouse/Arts district b) very courteous, polite staff c) stylish lobby & grounds d) all "public" guest facilities (ice machines, business center, convenience store, pool/fitness center) available and in working order There were, however, a number of shortcomings I wasn't entirely able to overlook: a) a rather shopworn appearance of some of the rooms (mine) and corridors b) lack of sufficiently hot shower water c) housekeeping knocking at 8:00a (!) d) no balcony rooms as reserved (not a huge issue at all, just somewhat of a disappointment) e) front desk touting "24-hour room service," but the property book indicating 7:00a - 11:00p. This kind of inconsistency makes me crazy. f) a simple room service request that required an hour and two calls to complete Overall, my stay was a good one. As long as I got the kind of discount available on this trip (roughly 1/3 off rack rate), I'd return, and recommend it to others. But not at full price.

Reviews.Title: “Top of my list in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Nub2travel
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed this property for years staying three times this year so far. We were recently upgraded to a suite which was greatly appreciated since we had child with us this time. One of staff members remembered me and welcomed me back. And I have to mention the deliciously fragrant flowers in the lobby. Contrary to a previous post there is plenty of parking for those who prefer not to valet. The is a parking lot right next door only steps away from the entrance. We use when we can not find street parking. So do not let that discourage you from staying at this wonderful hotel. However I will remember this fellow posters experience as further reason not use valet. BTW, on a much earlier visit during a busy time (jazz fest) we arrived very early to attend a funeral. The concierge learned that we did not know the location. He recognized our name and thought his mother might know since she was acquainted with the deceased. He saved the day his mother knew the location and he gave us directions. I am a yankee but I just love the south and the people from there!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: globe_trotter818
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located, there was a streetcar stop right at the corner. Canal street was a direct and short walk down the street. The hotel was gorgeous and elegantly decorated. Our room was very nice with plush carpets, comfortable beds and down bedding. There was a really cool rooftop pool that was connected to the gym and a really pretty balcony/patio on the 8th floor. Gave nice view of the skyscrapers around the hotel. All of the staff I came into contact with were very friendly and pleasant to interact with. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, comfortable bed!”
Reviews.Author: WhiteAsian
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is so convenient a couple of blocks from the FQ and Warehouse District. The street car line is right in front and it takes you all over the Garden District. The beds and pillows are so comfortable and the room was spacious and clean. Also, you are a good distance away from the FQ to where you are away from the noise. Check-in is at 4pm but we got there at 1pm and they gave us our room right away (of course, I am sure it depends on the availability). The staff is very nice and helpful and very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “I received a red light camera violation, thanks to the valet service.”
Reviews.Author: esm0220
Reviews.Content: I was completely satisfied with my stay at the Intercontinental until one month later, when I received a red light camera violation at the corner of Poydras St. and Carondelet St., an intersection one block from the hotel. I'm sure I'm not the first to receive this additional $125 fee compliments of thier fine valet service. Unfortunately, as an out of town visitor, it's cheaper to pay the fee than appear for my court hearing to protest. I'm currently "working" with Intercontinental to get reimbursement for the traffic violation. I contacted Intercontinental immediately after learning of the violation, and they mysteriously did not have record of my stay. I'm sure the record will appear when I appeal the credit card charge. FYI, every car that uses the valet service will be driven through this camera monitored intersection by a valet driver. Valet is mandatory at the hotel, as there is no option for a parking garage or public parking in the vicinity. The camera angles do not clearly show the driver, just the car and license plate. Therefore, proving that it wasn't me behind the wheel may be impossible. Budget an additional $125 for traffic violations if you choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A great place. Very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: flyme123
Reviews.Content: Was there for 5 days in June. Rooms were good size. Forget any views. the hotel is not situated to have a view of anything. I stayed in a standard king room. the bed was comfortable with ALOT of pillows!! Its just a few blocks from the fun of Burbon St. in a quiet downtown block. If your looking for a party atmosphere... dont stay here!!! it's upscale and quiet. A small pool on the roof with a few lounge chairs. Look for a deal and this hotel will be worth it. Plenty of great restaurants close by in the quarter and downtown. I reccomend Mothers just 3 blocks away. Get away from the Quarter and try "The Joint" in Bywater for the best BBQ in the USA ( this distinction is not just from me but the Food network as well) Also take a trip to Willie Mae's for the best fried chicken you will ever have. ( also ranked #1 in the country by the Food Network) . And don't miss Angelo's for great gellato and deserts. NOLA is back in a big way. ENJOY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ataman71
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conference oriented. Nice clean rooms. Very friendly people at the front desk, was able to get early check in and late check out free of charge. A very quiet location. Ten minutes walk to French Quarter. I paid $64 per night including taxes. I found a deal through Orbitz.com. Across the street from hotel is a very nice restaurant LUKE. Food is delicious. Go to Motherâ€™s for lunch or breakfastâ€¦â€¦ interesting experience. Jazz brunch at Commanderâ€™s Palace is nice. Restaurants that I would recommend are: MOTHER'S RESTAURANT IRENEâ€™S CUISINE GALATOIRE'S RESTAURANT NOLA RESTAURANT BAYONA K PAULS LOUISIANA KITCHEN COMMANDER'S PALCE RESTAURANT AUGUST LUKE RESTAURANT Ireneâ€™s has the nice romantic decor and delicious food, also not that expensive. The best restaurant in New Orleans. Go to Napoleon house for drinks or lunch. Their muffalettas are delicious and drinks not expensive. Try beignets at CafÃ© Beignet or CafÃ© Du Monde. They are delicious. Public transportation is very unreliable, no time schedules. I had to wait 40 minutes for a bus just to go 15 blocks. Do not buy 3 days passes. Itâ€™s better to buy one day pass for $5. You can see all neighborhoods that worth seeing in one day. Sometimes you would get faster to some destinations by walking than waiting for a buss or a trolley. This might change with time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: TysonConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Really enjoyed it...room was nice, service very good, and the location great. Liked the fact it was close to the French Quarter and not in it. Free Internet in the lobby (and they mention this), so no need to pay up in the room. Head Bellman was great (tall, older gentleman with a moustache)...he helped us on everything. When we checked in, there was a loud new born next door and they had no issue movie us promptly to a new room that was quieter. A couple of nits...its on the street with the cable car and you can hear it when it goes by. Also, room never got cleaned the last day we were there...we got back late to the room, and then off to dinner followed by a very early checkout so we did not make a big deal of it. All things considered, great overall...especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A Big Disappointment in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: HJB777
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not pet or people friendly. Our nine pound, non-shedding, well-behaved dog cost almost as much to spend the night as it did our four humans. We were told on the phone that the pet cost would be @ $75, but it was $150 on check-in due to "deep cleaning" after each pet visit. Really? Our "pet room" was filthy. Stains on the carpet and upholstery, dirty baseboards, leaking faucets, and worst of all, smoke smell was prevalent in our room. Our safe was broken, but after waiting for the security staff forever to show up, we finally gave up on that. There is no grass anywhere on the property to curb your dog. How can they claim to be "pet friendly"? The only bright spot was the valet staff. They were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great helpful staff, nice place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: DaMick
Reviews.Content: Great service ( we stayed for a weekend getaway), I ahve to say i was quite impressed by the hotel in every aspect. I wanted a quiet hotel away from the Quarter,and this place was perfect. Room was nice,bed was incredibly comfy. We are coming back probably during football season and im defiantely booking another room here. I was very impressed with this hotel ...and i dont get impressed easily. Quick tip- go to Lukes for some great food right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great rate, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: daveo1538
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was a pleasant one. I prefer staying in the Marigny, but the IC's location on St Charles is close enough to the Quarter that you can walk to it and through to Frenchmen. There's also a streetcar stop less than a block from the front door. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, our room, which I believe was a fairly standard queen, was brightly appointed, clean, and comfortable, and we got a great rate through Expedia packaged with our flight. It's a good middle ground if you want to do stuff in the quarter and also want to go uptown and into the warehouse district. A great experience, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hospitality.... EVERY TIME......”
Reviews.Author: jretpe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have enjoyed the wonderful hospitality of the Intercontinental Hotel many times over the past few months. We can always count on finding a beautiful and clean room, a comfortable bed, and friendly staff ready to help whenever we need it. This hotel is a very special place. As we travel down the maze of hallways looking for our room during each stay, we are always enchanted by the stories held within the walls over so many years. It's nice to find a place that we can call a home away from home when we travel to New Orleans. Every time we are there, we can count on hospitality, a friendly smile, and people who make us feel like we are the only ones in the whole place. We recommend this hotel to everyone we know who is traveling to New Orleans. After you stay there, you will too. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Wonderful staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KVAMPBELLA
Reviews.Content: I spent 4.5 days at the Intercontinenal Hotel. Tarek at the front desk was wonderfully professional and charming. The room was very nice and had a great balcony over looking a mosaic tiled court yard and several art pieces. The pool area was small but quiet, It was not busy the days I was there so it was very enjoyable. We received royal treatment from the moment we pulled in the portege. The Valet parked our car right under the portege in front of the hotel , the bellmen unloaded our luggage and took it to our room . The hotel lounge is decorated nicely and they had a great jazz trio. Room Service was fast and the food was very good. Also the food that was catered by the hotel for our business luncheon was fantastic, much better than some of the big name New Orleans restauraunts. The Housekeeping staff was always courteous and cheerful. I will stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a Spring Clean"”
Reviews.Author: TXTravelerDallas
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent three nights at this hotel over Spring Break. When we arrived, we were immediatley told the hotel was completely booked, even though we had a reservation. However, any staff we encountered were very personable and helpful. We visited the fitness center and used the swimming pools a couple of times. There were a few "out of order" machines in the center and dirty,wet towels around the pool and women's dressing area in need of pick-up. Didn't go to any hotel restaurants. My husband did use the business center to get copies of our return boarding passes. My only complaints about the hotel were the level of cleanliness and the street noise. The hotel carpets were stained and tired looking. Everytime (day or night) we were in the hallways, they were littered with used room service and newspapers. I never saw it clear. The rooms could also use double-paned glass, especially if you are stuck with one facing St. Charles Avenue. The noise from the streetcars and traffic can be distracting.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location if you want to be near the quarter but not in it”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut70
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Intercontinental during Jazz Fest so it was really busy. We actually were not there for the Fest and did not go but just about everyone else there did! Location is very good since it is only three blocks from Canal. You can be in the bustle of the quarter really quickly but can escape if you want to also. We had always stayed in the quarter before so were not sure this would be something we would like or not but thought it was worth a try. We are very happy that we did! Check in went quickly. Rooms are very nice, more antique than trendy. Rooms have balconies, however, ours faced another building across the street so not much of a view but nice to sit and enjoy a breeze. Surprised no flat screen TV yet but it worked just fine. Also, there doesn't seem to be that many hotels with good outdoor pools downtown so we were happy that we could sit outside and get some sun every day. Work out area is pretty small for a big hotel so getting a machine was not always an option. Ate the first night right across the street at Luke. Really happening bar with unique food options. It was very good and price was moderate for New Orleans. Other days we did walk over to the quarter. We were happy to see that Hotel Monteleone bar was still a hot spot where you can sit at the "merry go round" bar and have a drink watching the bartenders get confused as you move around them. They also have to jump over the bar since there is no door so it is pretty funny to watch sometimes. We had lunch at Napoleon House...one of our favorites. They have great lunches and a lovely courtyard to sit in. Prices there were very good also. We always hit this place whenever we are in town. A lovely restaurant we went to in the quarter was LeMeritage. It is quite new but service and food were fabulous. Once again, a great courtyard with a very creative menu. Wine pairings with half or full pours were available and we loved the idea of also offering small or large plates so you could taste more items on their menu and not get full. Everything was great. I would highly recommend this new option in the quarter. We did eat several breakfasts at the Intercontinental. The buffet didn't really seem worthwhile for what we like but the off the menu options were very good and reasonably priced. We also enjoy the $7.00 mimosa's to start the day! I would stay again at this hotel or in this area as a nice option for being near but not in the quarter. Riverwalk is close too.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth a return visit”
Reviews.Author: patsychom
Reviews.Content: Sadly disappointed in this hotel. The conference I attended was in the hotel. In three meals, not once did they serve coffee although the cups were there. Food was barely edible. Front desk staff were surly; wait staff provided very poor service. Rooms were very average at best, slightly run-down. Business centre was very expensive as was print service. WIll not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Hotel - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: mparrill
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent three nights leading up to Easter so we could visit Tulane. I got these accommodations as part of a Priceline package which included airfare. The hotel component was probably $75 / night. This was one of the best travel bargains I've ever had. The hotel was stately clean, and a little slow in the public areas (though I believe the hotel filled up during the weekend - we left Easter Sunday.) The hotel is well located in the central business district. About 3 blocks from the French Quarter. The streetcar stops out front and can take you through the Garden District. Service was great. I ordered room service and the great food arrived quickly and wasn't outrageously expensive. The same staff were at the front desk each day we were there. And, even though they wouldn't upgrade our room without an additional charge, they were very friendly and knowledgeable about the area. The room was quiet and mostly up to date with the exception of the kind of old-timey bathtub area. Housekeeping was fairly thorough. The TV is not flat panel which I don't normally notice but since staying at the Wynn Las Vegas last year I seem to notice every time I travel now. There was a great workout space (free). The rooftop pool was clean and nice (though veeeery windy the times we were out there. I would recommend this hotel for both business and leisure travelers. The hotel would be a bargain up to $200 / night.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service...”
Reviews.Author: NYDANNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Intercontinental for 4 nights and I was extremely pleased with the level of service I received while there. The check-in was very smooth and the room was clean and spacious. The bed (king) was very comfortable and had about 1000 pillows. My only issue was that the A/C didn't get as cold as I wanted it (i prefer to sleep in a cooler room). We did attempt to use the pool which appeared to be fairly well kept however the water was definitely not heated and was certainly too cold to enjoy. The concierge (Michael) was excellent. He seemed to have all the answers and made some great recommendations. I only did one actual tour while I was there and I had him book it (he picked up the phone and had it booked in seconds). He also seems to know every restaurant and activity in the area. The doormen were always in place and seemed to always be smiling in the morning. I can honestly say that after all my travels over the years, this staff truley impressed me. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to categorize”
Reviews.Author: YossarianDelaware
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a five night stay wrapped around Easter weekend. The Intercontinental was part of a Travelocity package for an astoundingly low rate with air from Baltimore. The room component had to be less than $75 per night with all taxes. From entrance at street level, an escalator is taken to the lobby. The lobby is marble and wood, tastefully done, but no matter what time of day, seemingly devoid of life. Very sterile. However, check in was smooth and the clerk very friendly, courteous, and helpful. Asked for a non-adjoining, quiet room and given a nice corner room on the 12th of 15 floors. Room quality was very good, comfortable, and quiet. Maid service efficient and good. Did notice that the entry door, though heavy and thick, had the worst seal I have ever seen in a hotel door. An open inch of space at the bottom and light coming in at the sides. There was no hall noise, but had there been it would have been easily heard in the room. Very quiet hotel in general. Amenities - Very nice rooftop pool open from 7:00 - 10:00. Area kept very clean. Very nice, free fitness center. Good equipment and enough machines. Concierge available from 9:00 - 5:00. Lifeless lobby contained a restaurant you could walk past without noticing. Same with the bar; never saw a person in there. There was a pub on the street level, but way in the back beyond all foot traffic patterns. Sundries shop seemed to close too early for a major hotel. There was a snack, candy, gift shop that supposedly sold coffee and breakfast items, but it was closed Friday, Saturday, and Sunday of Easter weekend. I don't know if it was open Monday. Seemed ironic that they had a great deal of Easter candy on display but were not open to sell it. Overall, helpfullness of staff and level of accommodations were very good. Streetcar outside the hotel. Walk to French Quarter, Riverfront, or casino. Exceptional value for the price paid. Lifeless public areas.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay and the price was excellent”
Reviews.Author: deebaby
Reviews.Content: This was a trip for my spouse and I to bond together due to our hectic schedules. It was last minute, unplanned and we did not need the stress of choosing a place to stay. I went to hotwire and read the reviews and that is how I chose this hotel. Booking through hot wire, got us rooms for $68.00 and for the price it was well worth it. The porters were friendly. When we drove up, our bags were taken immediately. The front desk staff was friendly and very helpful answering all our questions about where to eat. The bellman took us immediately to our room, checking everything out and explaining some sites in the city. I was very pleased with the room. It was clean, plenty of towels, the linen was clean and the bed and pillows were sooooo comfortable. I thouroughly enjoyed the gym and the fruit basket was consistenly filled. The pool was small but the area was nice, clean and relaxing. The hotel is close to everything but away from all the noise; That I really enjoyed. You are in walking distance to all the good spots; and there is always the trolley. I didn't like paying $30.00 a night for parking. There was a parking area next door that charged $15.00 but I wasn't aware of it until afterwards; Don't know the details but it would have been cheaper since we didn't use the car again untilI we left. The hotel was very clean, the staff professional, atmosphere was wonderful. Friday night was extra special for us to listen to live piano music in the lobby. I would stay here again and would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: WorksOnly2Travel
Reviews.Content: Myself, my partner and two friends stayed at the Intercontinental for 5 nights during the Mardi Gras celebrations. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, apart from one hiccup. When we checked in, was asked if an extra bed could be paid for in the room which our two (male) friends were staying in, as a friend was travelling from Florida to stay for one night. The morning the bed was required, we asked the front desk if they could please arrange for the bed to be put into the room, and we were told no problem, and charged $30.00. After a call to house keeping later that night the bed still hadn't arrived. When we went to enquire at reception, we were told 'There are no spare beds' and then were told 'No you can't have a spare bed, due to fire regulations.' After a debate with the Manager, who told us in the first place we could have a spare bed, we conceeded it wasn't going to happen and our friends worked out their own sleeping arrangement. To the hotels credit, they did remove the charge of $30.00. The rooms were very nice, I liked the decor and the bathroom was lovely with a marble benchtop and huge mirror. The large windows made for great viewing of the Parades below. The hotel's restuarant was fantastic. We had dinner on the first night and tried the 5 course Tastes of New Orleans menu - the food was delicous and well cooked, although we did run out of cutlery part the way through and had to 'borrow' extra from an empty table. The breakfast was nice, and there was a wide selection of cereal, fruit and hot food (bacon, eggs and potato). The location of the hotel was great - A short walk to Canal St and to Bourban St, and also to the River, where many of the tours operate from. We were lucky enough to be staying at the hotel as part of a prize, and didn't have to pay. If we had been paying (which was rack rate of approx $400AU a night) I would have been dissapointed, but if you can get a reasonable rate I would recommend the Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “not worth full price”
Reviews.Author: cwpw
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Parking was difficult because parking deck next door was full. We had heard from a friend that street parking was not safe, so we paid the $30/day fee for valet parking.
